title: I love this app!!!
review:
Original edit: 
I get migraines all the time but I am not able to take medicine yet due to the fact that I was not 100% proven to have migraines yet so the only way I can really make it feel better is if I fall asleep and take ibuprofen, A.k.a. Advil ( my savor) . I am a terrible napper I can only sleep whenever it‚Äôs time to actually sleep but somehow headspace helped me fall asleep even when I was wide awake five seconds ago.
 I love this app and I would recommend it to lots of people! 

New edit:
 I came to this app for sleep help got a subscription and got what I wanted. They gave me real ways to help me sleep. I realized that was meant for meditation I ended up getting dragged into the meditation part and now I love the app so much! 

My constructive criticism: 
I mostly use the app for my sleep. I would like in their surveys for them to give something about what stress is most is to take into account not everyone who is using the app is a true adult and not everyone is actually doing work. I think I would say it‚Äôs causing the most stress is school for me. So I would like for in the surveys for them to include the fact that some people are using this app for sleeping purposes and some people are also technically kids who are in school and what is stressing them might not necessarily be what you put on the quiz. 

Thank you, Grace R

title: AMAZING
review: I have been using headspace for over a year and a half and I have been amazed. Over the past year I have been going through some personal difficulties, but I could always count on headspace. This is because of Andy‚Äôs soothing voice, the amazing variety, the sleep tab, and many more services headspace offers. I have been a bit disappointed on how they have changed the platform. It is a bit harder to navigate and I don‚Äôt see everything right in front of me. That aside, this app is amazing and definitely worth it. You will fall asleep in minutes, discover new ways you can calm yourself down, and much more! Headspace also brings a great sense of community in the ‚Äúwake up‚Äù, where you get to hear from the community, and the group meditations where you can really feel a sense of community. Headspace has done so much for me and I hope it will help you.

title: Headspace is a true blessing of an app
review: It‚Äôs not just about helping calm the mind, or helping you work through difficult life challenges. Headspace is about find your inner sense of gratitude, joyfulness, and peace. Helping you to not only live a better life for yourself, but also helping you create more meaningful relationships with other, and in turn helping other in the process as well. But it doesn‚Äôt come instantaneously, the mind is like any other part of your body, if you want it to become skilled at meditation, you need to practice, and headspace is like the best coach, trainer and friend you‚Äôve ever had rolled into one. It cheers you through the good days, and sits with you to ease the mind on the bad days. Headspace is honestly the most unique app I‚Äôve ever seen, and it truly is life changing. Thank you Andy and the entire headspace team for helping people live a bit more mindfully every day.

title: Wonderful experience
review: I signed up for a free year of headspace when the pandemic began and have been so impressed by both the app and the quality of the meditation courses and the sleep stories and meditations. I also think that the offer of an entire free year to folks who were financially impacted by the pandemic shows a real concern for mental health beyond pure financial gain from the people behind the company. So far, there have been options for both male and female voices which I appreciate, and I hope to see more diverse voices in the app moving forward. With some new voices on their roster from folks outside of the white community, it looks as though that‚Äôs something they are working towards. It‚Äôs been a valuable tool for me and I will be subscribing when my year runs out. Although it‚Äôs not a cheap subscription, if you can afford it I would definitely recommend.

title: Doesn‚Äôt work well with Iwatch
review:
I wish this app was designed to be more intuitive with the Apple Watch.  I can only play a 1 minute breathing exercise on the iwatch app despite the website is conveying and customer support is poor.  I sent an email to customer support. The first response from customer service is that my response will take longer than 48 hours with an apology.  Second response was a name of a customer service agent and never heard back.  I tried reaching out by DM on social media, but no response.  Furthermore, if you use the 1 minute breathing exercise on the watch, it doesn‚Äôt sync to your account.  

The phone app is great, but I would like to use my phone less, not more.  My phone is integrated with my work apps (email, calendar, teams, etc) and adds endless anxiety.  Because the phone app is good, I wouldn‚Äôt give it just one star, however I am posting a 1 star review because both devs and customers only read 1 star reviews.  Headspace has a customer service problem along with a poor iwatch app.  I haven‚Äôt had an issue with the phone app.
developerResponse: {'id': 17169865, 'body': "Thank you for your review regarding the Apple Watch options, we'll be sure this feedback is heard by our team! If you have any questions, feel free to get in touch with our team at help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2020-08-09T20:35:33Z'}

title: üòå
review: i get the premium free with my college tuition, which is cool. a great way to learn mindful meditation. lots of extra resources, like the daily wake up, sleepcasts and workouts. i like that there are courses so you can work on specific things over a longer period in a guided and intentional way. i can‚Äôt speak to the free version because i automatically get premium but i‚Äôm enjoying it and it‚Äôs helping me sleep and feel better. however! i would recommend shine slightly more, especially if you‚Äôre BIPOC, a woman, or a member of the LGBTQ+ community, since they‚Äôre run by us and are mindful and inclusive of our issues. it has more diverse content/tools instead of the same structure of meditations over and over ‚Äî which can actually be useful, and is kind of the point, since you‚Äôre learning this one type of meditation style, but i like what shine does slightly more.

title: Cannot get a human to respond
review:
I am super frustrated & don‚Äôt know what else to do to get a human to provide answers. I am having so many problems with the Headspace app- login issues, profile management, invited family members can‚Äôt create an account. I have tried the FAQs and online support but they don‚Äôt provide solutions. The ‚Äúlive chat‚Äù doesn‚Äôt exist.  To unlink an account it says to contact support - who is that? I have emailed many requests but no answers. 4-6 days to respond due to high volumes. I still haven‚Äôt heard one iota of anything except that I‚Äôm in some queue. I just wanted a human to respond. 
Nobody has replied but yet my credit card is charged. And on our end, we can‚Äôt use the app. I realize I am just a drop in the bucket in terms of your users. But I want to cancel my account. I believe I get 30 days. But I‚Äôm afraid nobody will respond within that window and I will be stuck with a family subscription nobody can use. Please help me get out of the anxiety that trying to use app has caused. If that ain‚Äôt irony. üòÇ What do I need to do to have a customer service representative contact me?

title: Life change
review: I‚Äôm a professional in mental health and have recently decided to become completely sober with alcohol and also make some life changes regarding my nutrition. I‚Äôm about six months sober and I‚Äôve been encouraged by other friends to take a meditation as a means to deal with heavy emotions that alcohol was suppressing in the past. I have to say that the headspace app has been a life change for me. I fallen in love with meditation and meditate now about 3 to 4 times a day. I just completeThe NV and jealousy meditation for this morning and it was amazing. I‚Äôm excited for this new chapter in my life and his journey that meditation is going to help weed me down. I‚Äôve also introduced my 10-year-old son to meditation. He currently plays at a high-level golf and is utilizing meditation in order to navigate through stressful situations while on the golf course. Thank you so much headspace!

title: A better mind, a better life.
review:
I‚Äôve been using Headspace every day for years now, and have completed many, if not most of the courses available. I could go on about meditation and how beneficial it is to having a healthy mind, and living a calm content life... but words aren‚Äôt the same as experience, and I could never do it justice. 

I am a better person because of this app, and hopefully I have had a positive impact on the world around me because of my practice as well. Headspace isn‚Äôt full of ‚Äúwoo-woo‚Äù and doesn‚Äôt conflict with whatever you believe. It‚Äôs just a thoughtful collection and presentation of the parts of mindfulness that are proven, practical and legitimate. 

Only you can choose to begin on a path of mindfulness practice, but for your own health and happiness, I hope you do (whoever you are)... and if you do, Headspace is a great way to start.

title: Love the app, would like to incorporate more specific reminders
review:
I love this app, and I usually don‚Äôt pay for apps if I can help it. That said, this has been a great purchase for my mental health. I‚Äôve been using it for morning and evening meditations, and for short mental health breaks during the day for the past two weeks. 

My recommendation/request of the developers: please allow users to add more notifications through the app for specific activities like a yoga break or a walking break. I‚Äôd like to take advantage of more of the features of the app‚Äôs activities but need to schedule them separately in my calendar app at this time. I use the morning wake up and bedtime notifications in the app which have been great. Basically, any opportunity to further incorporate moments of relaxation and mindfulness throughout the day is greatly appreciated.

title: The BEST app ever
review: I got this free through an offer last year because of my essential work as a health care provider. I didn‚Äôt think much about it at first but really used the ‚Äòmorning wake up‚Äô during the first few weeks of quarantine. Months past and I started using it again-this time to meditate. My family started as well. Within two months it has completely changed how we live! My stress levels are down, my kids breathe before reacting (so do my husband and I) and we are doing so much better as a family. You have to stick with it, but the app has tons of different options to use and a variety of teachers. They even have Sesame Street for the kiddos! I also have grown to love the English accents and my kids say ‚Äòwhen are we going to listen to Andy?‚Äô if it‚Äôs been a couple of days. This app is a game changer!!!

title: Better than therapy!  Seriously.
review: I had attempted meditation off and on throughout the years, never really having found anything that suited or ‚Äúworked.‚Äù   Until Andy.  I don‚Äôt know what it is about his demeanor or his voice, or if it‚Äôs how accurately he addresses (universal) challenges with learning meditation, but I am hooked.  Not only do the sessions relieve and clarify the cloudy emotions we all deal with, I‚Äôm now starting to subconsciously use techniques Andy has taught even when I‚Äôm not meditating.  I have especially found his instruction helpful as it pertains to not engaging with certain thoughts as they bubble to the surface throughout the day.  I‚Äôm better able to watch them pass by like cars in the road be chase them, or I simply turn the channel to a more neutral or happier subject.  I have never felt more centered and at peace.  Less reactive.  Happy!!

title: Great App!!
review: Headspace is a phenomenal app for helping you to relax through meditation. Especially with everything going on in the world today, it can be easy to become wrapped up in all the uncertainty and anxiety, whether that comes from watching the news or simply being stuck in the house and slowly going stir crazy. As someone who enjoys being able to go out and shop, see friends, or simply stop by my favorite restaurant, this unprecedented experience has taken a toll on me, but Headspace has been an incredible resource for keeping me sane. Whenever I need a little break from the craziness all around me, I can open up the app and listen to a meditation or even do a quick workout. This app has it all, and if you‚Äôre having any issues with anxiety, stress, worry, or the like, I‚Äôd definitely recommend you give Headspace a try!

title: ‚ú®Some Advice To People Dealing with Anxiety!‚ú®
review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for about a month now, and it‚Äôs really helped! It helps with stress, eating, sleeping, and getting to know more about the mind and body, and how to feel comfortable.

I‚Äôve been having ALOT of stress in my life, from school, to siblings, to friends, to the sleeping disorders and the depressions. To the lost loved ones and moving houses. 

I‚Äôve become so stressed that I become really sick. I‚Äôve developed this thing called ‚ÄúAnxiety Nausea‚Äù I became so sick I thought I was dying! Headspace has helped me deal with and understand with what‚Äôs happening with my body, and I appreciate it! 

I recommend this app to ANYONE. Even if you don‚Äôt suffer from bad anxiety or any disorder, I still recommend. It helps you a lot, and you may learn something you never knew about your body before. 

From the help of my family and headspace, I‚Äôm recovering. To anyone going through this, or something similar, you will recover. And you‚Äôll find people who support you. If you don‚Äôt, find a hobby! Or go out on a walk! 

And yeah.. maybe anxiety will never go away.. but you can help your body by knowing some solutions to help! Treat your body with the kindness and respect it deserves.

To anyone reading this, you will make it through!

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-
Much Love, Ava ‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Daily Calm
review: I have attempted to start a meditation routine several times over the past four years, but struggled greatly. Instead of feeling relaxed I would quickly feel panicked and found breathing difficult. When I first began meditating with Andy, I immediately tried the guided meditation for dealing with anxiety. It was so comforting to learn that my anxious tendencies resulted in overly trying to control my breath and in turn created an unhealthy pattern. I took heart knowing that if it was on his app, surely this must be something many others have faced. With his expert guidance I have learned to look forward to meditation and how it relaxes my body and mind. As I have explored the app more, I find that Andy has addressed many other hurdles I have had with meditating. I have benefited so much already and look forward to see where this path takes me.

title: It‚Äôs good, but you can only listen to very little things
review: There‚Äôs a few things you can listen to. Most of it is locked because you need the free trial. I‚Äôm a teen,I use head space  because I can sleep  better. My parents aren‚Äôt going to get me a trial in this app in this crisis. And I can‚Äôt start a free trial because it asks you for credit info. I don‚Äôt have momey. I‚Äôm letting you know so you guys can please make more things available to the people who can‚Äôt get trials. And make more of the sleepcasts, Winddowns, and  soundscapes available- please it would really help me... I would be able to sleep even better because I already listened to the sleep cast ‚Äúrain day antics‚Äù and I can‚Äôt listen to more because I‚Äôm order to do that I have to get the free trial. Please read this and please let others that can‚Äôt whet the free trial listen to more- it would help please and thanks.

title: The Best Treatment
review: I have struggled with a variety of anxiety disorders and PTSD, and nothing feels more frustrating than walking out of the therapist or psychiatrist expecting them to have solved your problems quickly or with a ‚Äúmagic bullet‚Äù. Nothing felt like it was working so instantly. A psychiatrist and a friend both recommended headspace and I had been a long time skeptic of meditation and hesitant about mindfulness. Giving the app the first 10 minutes was a bit tough, but the next 10 got easier, and easier, and easier. My sleep problems from recovering from using substances were even solved by the goodnight meditations. I can‚Äôt recommend enough, whether you have a mental disorder, you‚Äôre an introvert or an extrovert, whether it‚Äôs for insomnia or daily stress, headspace has slowed my roll and helped me find peace in day to day life.

title: Unbelievably grateful for this app
review: I had purchased the app because someone had told me about it. I knew nothing about meditating or how to do it. I just dove right in and now with the help it has guided me, I can almost do it on my own. It‚Äôs something I turn to when I get stressed, angry or sad. Or even need to sleep. The videos have been so soothing and helpful in every way. It has changed the way I look at my day and helps me remember to focus. Not a day goes by where I don‚Äôt use one of the audio recordings to help me tackle and problem I‚Äôm having. Also the work outs are very subtle and easy. Best app for a stressful life. Highly recommend. I‚Äôm better at controlling my struggles now. Thank you! ‚ù§Ô∏è I hope someone reads this because it‚Äôs a real experience and I‚Äôm so grateful it‚Äôs helped me, it may help someone else too. Try it.

title: Great meditations but a cluttered app
review:
A month ago I would have given headspace 5 stars, because the meditations and courses are great.  Recently though they have started crowding the app with community content, suggested content, information about juice cleanses... All of which invites you to spend time on the app or flit from meditation to meditation rather than sitting mindfully with one meditation course for a few weeks at a time. The app design is in direct conflict with the stated goals of the app and of meditation generally. 

To make matters worse, they recently changed the layout of the home screen so when you open the app, you have to scroll past testimonials and information about juice cleanses to get to the course you are working through. Why would a mindfulness app do this? It betrays a lack of commitment to the principles of mindfulness that headspace claims to care about. Please just give me back my simple, uncluttered home screen and make it easy again to pick up where I left off rather than tempting me to use headspace the way I use Facebook or Pocket.

title: Love the app but your PR using ‚Äúsocial justice‚Äù and racial agenda starts to get annoying
review: Love the app but your PR using racial agenda starts to get annoying. Can you guys pls stick to meditation / related areas and not try to push politics, agendas and ideologies on what justice is and what is not? (A lot of the ‚Äúsocial justice‚Äù ideas pushed on society by ultra leftists that are actually destroying the left as a valid movement (and only give more power to the right), actually result in ‚Äúinjustice‚Äù overall so really hope you guys are not going to be part of that (just dig in a bit deeper and dont follow the herd w/o thinking pls). Yes, it is a trend but dont try to ‚Äúlook good‚Äù as a company using this stuff. Also, a lot of people who meditate are not dumb and understand the absurdities being pushed by the authoritarian ultra left (that destroys the actual liberal left) so you do not want to align yourself with that movement. Please Headspace - stay sane :)

title: Simple and effective.
review: Repetition is the key to learning. My therapist outlined a meditation exercise for me when I began seeing him. That was about 4 months ago. I‚Äôve stuck to it at around a 90% clip ever since. Over that time what at first seemed pointless and an exercise in futility at quieting the mind got easier over time and the benefit more readily noticed.  I have to say tue coaches on here have call convinced me guided practice is right for me. Their voices and knowledge are much appreciated. I look forward to this practice more than I did when it was just me and silence. At first I did not believe it would be worth keeping past the free trial. I am pleased to say I find the cost benefit to paying for full access to this tool money well invested into personal self care. I am a better human internally and externally w/o a doubt.

title: thank you andy, 10/10 app
review:
I cannot emphasize enough how meditation has impacted my life. I have been through really dark times and went so long not caring about anything that I had forgot what it felt like. Headspace and specifically Andy has taught me more than any school or person has. how to be kind to myself, that you deserve to feel good and how to see things clearly. It amazes me that just a small practice can change in how I feel and how I view the world everyday. this practice has finally let me feel how grateful I am to be alive. 

I now am working to have my friends and loved ones practice meditation as well because I can see the benefits it brought me and I want that for those I love.

If you are struggling or even if you aren‚Äôt please give meditation a real chance and use headspace.

title: Best falling asleep app ever !!
review: So before I was staying up till 2am not being able to fall asleep and having to listen to lullabies until I saw this app I fell asleep in under 10 minutes instead of spending 30 minutes wasting my sleep time I was now spending 10 minutes going to sleep in a peaceful night that‚Äôs why I suggest headspace as a very good app!! But there‚Äôs only one thing that I would like to change about headspace you need to pay money for most of all the things maybe put one or two more 45 minute long rain casts like to listen to rainday antiques and that‚Äôs it because that‚Äôs the only thing for free I would suggest maybe putting one to two more things for free instead of paying a bunch of money to get more. But anyway amazing app definitely get it!!‚ù§Ô∏è -Recommend By Me

title: The best app for this new decade.
review: Endless content, and all of it is of the utmost quality. Having played professional sports, to working in a high stress environment, I have always been looking for ways to calm my mind and avoid my tumultuous relationship with anxiety. As anyone who suffers from anxiety knows, this is not a simple fix. Headspace is the solution that helps us avoid popping prescription anxiety meds. Meditation has been around for thousands of years, and it works. If you are new to meditation do not worry, it may take weeks for you to start to see the benefits but it absolutely works. Headspace you have truly made something incredible, I believe in this generation when we all suffer from to much screen time and stimulus, headspace is a staple to anyone who is trying to better themselves.

title: Meditation, Californicated
review:
This app is the epitome of the stereotypical Californian that everyone digs on; cool on the surface, but pretty hollow when you get to know it. 

The pros are that this is a very polished, inviting, and well designed experience. There‚Äôs a lot to dive into, and something new to see every day you launch the app. If you‚Äôre not sure where to start, there‚Äôs a lot in place to get you somewhere. Perfect for dipping your toes in the meditation waters. 

The pitfall is that meditation is a very personal experience, and can need a pretty tailored touch for each individual. This is something that‚Äôs near impossible to get from an app for the masses, but when you‚Äôve used this app for a year, and notice how homogenized the sessions are from one to the next, you can‚Äôt help but start to question the price tag. 

It feels like they know there isn‚Äôt much substance either, as they start cranking out a one page draft of a morning show with as much substance and personality as a cross between a reality TV show and a pharmaceutical commercial. Two second introduction until... oh crap? An exercise? I wasn‚Äôt ready! Next time I‚Äôll be ready. Oh it‚Äôs just a breathing exercise, oh OK. 

The app feels like it mastered its framework, and is looking to build from there, but aren‚Äôt sure what the next building blocks are. I‚Äôll come back when they‚Äôve picked it up a bit.

title: Quiet and mindful and in joyful
review: Hi this is me Lily I just got this app today on March 25Thursday and I barely been doing it and I just come to enjoy myself and peaceful and I want to get this out to the world and say that this is very very mindful and peaceful and I think it‚Äôs also nice that they provide not just sleeping stuff they also provide stuff that you‚Äôre having trouble with like I go to private school Sungro sometimes I have trouble focusing so they have one that helps me focus and I also have waking up so then I‚Äôm gonna try that out tomorrow and see if it goes and works but I think it‚Äôs just so far really good for me and my sister Stella and I wanna get this out to the world and say get headspace because it‚Äôs really really nice and relaxing for me and stuff and helps me out a lot so yeah so like I said get headspace

title: Best app for meditation
review: I was a complete beginner to meditation when I found this app. I decided to add this due to some stress in my life. It was a great decision for my own mental and personal growth. Not only do you meditate, but there a lot of good food for thought at the beginning of the meditation courses. It helps to challenge your current mindset for the better.  The sleep meditations have helped calm me during some restless nights or just simply help me relax for bed.  I have yet to utilize the move section of the app and I‚Äôm looking forward to exploring this more. This app helps guide you in learning this new skill that requires consistent practice. It is great for practicing sitting in the present moment and observing what is going on in your mind, body, and environment with clarity and calm. I highly recommend this app to anyone.

title: Bloated and annoying - no longer good for meditation
review:
Had been using a couple years ago and made the mistake of re subscribing without checking out a trial first. They recently added many additional features that appear in your face all over the app. Literally the home screen has been taken over by annoying video ads for courses I have no interest in. My goal for meditation is to resist the constant flood of distractions ... so why choose an app that throws distractions in your face? As a result I no longer find it useful to use this app for meditation. 

It‚Äôs just too many swipes and too many taps to get to the meditation I want. And ads for irrelevant courses take over screen by screen and I feel like I‚Äôm swatting them away in anger. Doesn‚Äôt make me get into the proper mindset anymore. 

I‚Äôm sure all the new crap makes them a lot of money but I fail to see how celebrity endorsed yoga playlists have much to do with their initial mission. Sad to see a good app like this now ruined by chasing too many new business lines.

title: Don‚Äôt think Just download it
review: After watching Netflix Headspace Guide I felt BRAND NEW. So I texted my bestie and recommended she watch it since we were both stuck in depressive episodes after a long/weird 2020.. She responded with ‚ÄòGIRL download the app I use it every night!‚Äô. Honestly love this app. It really has improved my overall happiness. Their lessons resonate most days which is more consistent than any other techniques Ive tried over the years. I genuinely look forward to meditation time now because it makes my day feel brighter even on days when I‚Äôm really struggling. Moms, if youre feeling burnt out this is the place for you üñ§this is where I found calmness and appreciation for my hectic everyday life. Feeling like myself again (only better). Thank you Andy and the Headspace team.

title: The best
review: I have listened to many of the meditations, videos, music and sleep meditations. This is the only year long subscription that I have purchased At first I thought this won‚Äôt do much, but after listening to Andy‚Äôs coaching through the first week of meditations I realized that this was effective. My goal this year to focus time for myself and this is a great way to focus for a couple minutes or many minutes. I have recommended it to many of my family and friends. Like a lot of things in life you think this isn‚Äôt going to do anything but line upon line you build the ability to calm self. This is an amazing app. This best money I have spent and thank you to Andy and others that have provided a very positive nonjudgmental experience. You will NOT be disappointed.

title: suggestion
review:
hello! i recently got this and on the usual, i listen to asmr every single night to go to sleep. and it sometimes takes me up to an hour because of how distracted i get with all the videos. but this really helped me to immediately set my focus on one audio and just let myself relax and fall asleep quickly. 

i was listening to ‚ÄúFalling Back Asleep‚Äù and i noticed that the background that plays is extremely calming and visually pleasing. 

my suggestion is giving us an option to make the background interactive. it already has shapes that sway from side to side really relaxingly but i wanted to touch the shapes and kinda have them slowly move to my finger as a fun little relaxing addition. it would be awesome to see that small feature in any future updates!

title: Great meditation app
review:
Headspace was recommended to me when I first started CBT around 2 years ago due to their excellent intro to meditation, and I've enjoyed using the app ever since. I took a hiatus from the app around the time they added sleep soundscapes, and coming back to it I see there's now a ton for various activities, as well as some yoga courses. I'm eager to resume my practice!

I'd love to give this app 5 stars, but it's lacking a crucial feature. It doesn't seem compatible with airplay or iPhone automation, so there's no way for me to play the soundscape through my homepod. It really tanks the utility of the feature that I can't use a speaker with the app. Automation is definitely a nice-to-have feature, but with it I could start playing the soundscape from my phone to the speaker when it's time to sleep, kind of like an inverse of an alarm clock.

title: You can‚Äôt afford not to meditate!
review:
I am training myself to use healthier coping techniques when handling my mental health symptoms. For example, I have utilized the SOS meditation feature from Headspace and couldn‚Äôt believe the results. I thought it laughable. How could a 3 min meditation remove that tightness in my chest and feeling of dread?!? And I‚Äôm not even ‚Äúgood‚Äù at meditating, doesn‚Äôt matter. I tried. I tried and it worked. And if the feeling came back. I just did the meditation again. I‚Äôd rather do 3 x 3min  meditations a day over an unhealthy response. Headspace is a blessing and an absolute must for my health and wellness.

It would be terribly sad to under estimate the power of meditation‚Äî I learned this first hand. I wish I would have been doing this years ago. 

Want to change your life? Here‚Äôs how.

title: I love it! But would make a minor change
review: I have had this app for a long time and I ‚Äúaccidentally‚Äù bought the year long subscription in the fall. $70 is a lot to pay but I mostly use it for the sleep casts and I think it is worth it just for that. The thing I would change is the main screen while the app is loading which currently it is the logo so it‚Äôs a big white screen and when I open the app with to find a sleep cast the bright screen is like unsettling and irritating even though my brightness is all the way down. I love the soft calming tones of the ‚Äúsleep‚Äù page in the app, but anything but the big white screen at the beginning would be amazing. I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only one that feels this way!

title: Really helps üòä
review: I was getting extremely worried and anxious today. I decided to sit down and take some time to just meditate, since I felt this way. At first my mind had so many thoughts and it was hard to just let go and focus in on myself and the things around me. But as the meditation went on I felt myself start to calm down and relax. For me, meditation really clears the mind and sets it back on track. Headspace is perfect for meditating and the sessions make my mind simply be instead of running everywhere in a jumbled mess. Even when I don‚Äôt feel down, maybe even super excited, meditation really sets the mind at ease and gives a wonderful sense of clarity. I highly recommend getting Headspace and trying meditation out for yourself, if you haven‚Äôt already.

title: Incredible App!
review: This app just gives and then gives some more. If you‚Äôre looking for an app that helps to create mindfulness, you can stop right here. I have been using this app for about 3 months and I couldn‚Äôt be happier! It has improved my sleeping habits as well as my general mood for each and every day. It doesn‚Äôt take up too much of your time and it pays off in many more ways than one. I have learned so much from the meditations. It‚Äôs just a great app all around and I strongly recommend it to everyone. Even if you‚Äôve never meditated before or if you feel like there‚Äôs no one particular part of your life you feel needs significant improvement. Take a step towards bettering you and your life. Get some headspace. I promise you won‚Äôt regret it!

title: Worth every penny
review: This app is so well thought out. I hated the thought of meditating, but my mental health was suffering so I tried the app out for the free trial. Oh my god. What a difference it made! This app is truly for beginners and professionals. I only started meditating for three minutes a few days a week and now I‚Äôm meditating about 10 minutes each time. I don‚Äôt meditate daily, but I realize, just like a workout, if I get inconsistent it‚Äôs harder for me to focus and stay healthy. This app has helped my mental health, my eating patterns, my focus, my motivation, and my appreciation! If you‚Äôre thinking about getting it, I‚Äôm telling you, GET IT. It‚Äôs so so worth it. It will change your life. Thank you headspace for all the work you put into this app! You are truly helping people!

title: Consistency is key
review:
This is probably the best mindfulness meditation app out there! Offers a ton of different practices and sessions and let's you choose a time that works for you. The animations are also a great added touch and help to clearly visualize what is being said. 

My only complaint is that the annual subscription is quite pricy. Not to discount the value of the content but in truth, for someone who may not use the app to it's full capacity daily, it just seems like a lot. They do offer some free options in the app but they make them incredibly challenging to find imo which gives the impression that they're really trying to push people to upgrade vs. offering more of a service to paying and nonpaying customers alike. Overall great app though.

title: So helpful!
review: I discovered Headspace years ago on the Rich Roll podcast. I love the guided meditation and the meditations with different intentions and how they reach so many different needs. I now have been checking out the morning wake ups instead of scrolling Facebook and it just starts my day off so much better. If I have trouble falling asleep at night, I tune into the Midnight Launderette and it is absolutely soothing and helps my mind calm enough for me to relax. Andy and Eve‚Äôs voices are so calming and I have learned the basics of meditation through their basic package and have moved on more specific guided ones, such as appreciation, or letting go of resentment or anxiety. It has created this beautiful, subtle change of me being much more aware and intentional and I absolutely love it.

title: Great, unless you have an issue
review: After using this for a few days, I knew it was going to help me and was so excited. I shared the info with my family and a couple of them were interested so I decided to upgrade to the family plan. This is where everything went off the rails. Four emails later and I still have no resolution. I couldn‚Äôt ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù, I was told that I had to cancel and could then upgrade. I canceled but still couldn‚Äôt upgrade. Then I was informed that I needed to go through Apple to request a refund and I did but I still can‚Äôt upgrade. Now I‚Äôm being told I can‚Äôt upgrade until the app basically decides I‚Äôm no longer a member (and basically doesn‚Äôt work) in order to upgrade. All my meditation tracked progress is gone but the app still works. However it isn‚Äôt really relaxing me with all of this frustration and no real help. I‚Äôve wasted more than two weeks on trying to fix something that shouldn‚Äôt be this difficult.  Very disappointed.
developerResponse: {'id': 22831993, 'body': "We're sorry for the trouble with the Family Plan. Since you purchased through Apple, you will have to wait until your subscription expires, then you can purchase the Family Plan. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com if you have any other questions. ", 'modified': '2021-05-16T17:30:51Z'}

title: Amazing - I thought I was above it
review:
Honestly for years I assumed that my own thinking processes were meditative and thoughtful. A friend I look up to brought up this app and I gave it the 2 week trial. I love that it asks what you are working on when you first open the app. I didn‚Äôt even realize I was struggling with sleep, but that‚Äôs what the meditations focused on. I only used it 2 times during my free trial. But after the 2nd meditation I was oddly hooked. I still can‚Äôt explain it, but I‚Äôm way less distracted and way more present now that I‚Äôm diving into these 2-3 minute digestible lessons. 

I love this app and absolutely recommend it. My only complaint is a lot of the times when I select to download a course it will not download. 

Besides that it‚Äôs a champ of an app!

title: Too Little Options!
review: I love this app SO much! I have been using it for the past few months and the Sleepcasts function has really helped me combat my insomnia. However, you get to a point where you‚Äôve run out of new content. You either have to repeat a sleep cast you‚Äôve already listened to, or be left with nothing, neither of which are ideal. If new content isn‚Äôt uploaded soon, I would be very sad to have to unsubscribe, since it would become repetitive. Something I also recommend doing in order to grant listeners more options is to make EVERY audio with both male and female options. Some audios only come in a female version, which isn‚Äôt as soothing to me. Overall, it‚Äôs a lovely app but it needs to be updated with a new variety of content every few months.

title: Teaches anyone the skill of meditation
review: I had tried to learn to meditate for years and never felt like I could do it right or get past the frustrating feeling of failure.  This app broke it down into such manageable pieces of information and small concepts to practice.  I can meditate without the app now but I still enjoy its many features.  My son has used the bedtime stories to get to sleep on difficult nights.I always thought of meditation as an art I wasn‚Äôt talented at.  This app has some great conceptual lessons and practical tools to overcome challenges, stop judging yourself about doing it wrong, and realize whatever you‚Äôre doing is normal and it gets easier with practice.  Incredibly helpful app.  And the sleep tools!  Oh my!  Check them out.

title: Amazing app, with good M1 experience
review:
EDIT: There's a lot less weirdness now on the M1. The Wake Up, short videos, meditations, and music playlists seem to work without a hitch. Easy 5/5 on the Mac App store. Any shortcomings with the M1 experience is more on Apple's court now. 

I am super thrilled, because more of my morning routine, like journaling, meditating, etc. can be better centralized on my Mac. Really great.

OLD: 3/5 stars for now, because we in the Mac App Store, and the app crashes on the M1 when trying to play audio (focus music or meditations). Bear in mind the M1 is super new, and I'm sure issues will be ironed out soon. I hope the dev team continues to give consideration to ARM Macs; being able to use the native Headspace app on my Macbook would be awesome!

Outside of that, this app is amazing. I have had an off/on affair with Headspace over the years, but this year I really got into it, and I'm so grateful how it has elevated my sense of well-being and balance.

I like this over other meditation apps because of the cohesiveness of the app. There's a clear path from starting out to exploring deeper topics. And the art, UX, videos, etc, all really gel together nicely.

title: Used to be better
review: I‚Äôve recommended Headspace to countless people over the years but am disappointed with all the recent updates. Missing the days when Headspace was a clean and simple space that didn‚Äôt try to be anything other than what it was (a meditative respite). I look forward to the mindful moment notification every day, but now I keep on getting push notifications for working out within the app or to watch a new video with some influencer I couldn‚Äôt care less about. The only notification I have turned on is for mindful moments and I still keep on getting these other notifications even though there‚Äôs nothing mindful about them. Please Headspace, stop trying to be like every other app with your incessant notifications and suggestive design, and go back to being the app we all loved you for in the first place.
developerResponse: {'id': 18484659, 'body': "We're sorry about the trouble with the notifications. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and our team can further assist!", 'modified': '2020-10-14T19:56:00Z'}

title: New to meditation and love this app!
review: I can‚Äôt say enough good things about Headspace! I was never drawn to meditation before and did not like the more spiritual/mystical aspect of it. Headspace is so different, though. It has a very down-to-earth, accessible feel. I love how they have meditations to fit so many different situations and moods. The app is a valuable tool for me as someone who struggles with anxiety. It makes me feel calmer, happier, and more confident at dealing with my anxiety. It feels pretty essential to me just like taking vitamins, exercising, getting enough sleep, etc. It would be a great way for anyone to have a healthier lifestyle. Honestly, give it a try even if you‚Äôre not sure if meditation is for you. The yearly subscription is worth every penny to me. Thanks Headspace!

title: An incredible start to a new me.
review: Headspace has been a blessing at a time that so many people like myself, out of work and in need of mental clarity, can really learn and grow from what this app offers. From the apps ease of use, to the many unique features, to the ways it forces you to stay accountable and on track as opposed to just coasting along, I‚Äôve now been using the app for a full week straight and am already feeling more focused and mindful than I did 7 days ago. Thank you Andy and the Headspace team for doing something so few businesses have done and committed their product and service to the furloughed and laid off employment community that truly need a helping hand through this challenging time. It doesn‚Äôt go unnoticed!

title: Headspace- what to expect
review: Amazing app. Whether you‚Äôre looking for an entry into meditation or expanding your practice, this is a great starting place... specifically for meditation/mindfulness only, that is. In that way, it can be life changing. The UX is okay; you kind of have to dig around in a not-so-intuitive way to get into other features, but some essentials are laid out plainly upon opening the app. It‚Äôs still 70USD/yr. So, a tune up in that department wouldn‚Äôt hurt. The voices are very pleasant, but I wonder if using only British accents deters a more diverse audience (i.e., people who are already a tough sell [i.e., british accents = liberal conspiracy ~ U.S.A.] but would benefit tremendously from meditation, and people who might consider using British accents in this context to be appropriation/co-opting target cultures of some kind). Just some thoughts for a potential reality.

title: Calmness and clarity of thought has never been so simple.
review: This app is amazing. I haven‚Äôt even started my free trial, just doing the basics course, and I immediately felt a difference. I am more calm, have more control over my emotions, and can think clearly. I saw a difference after the first lesson. I love that all the lessons can be 3-10 minutes long but these techniques are skills you can use throughout your day. Focusing on your breathing, your body contact and the space around you, who would‚Äôve thought that would help me manage my anxiety, stress, and disempowering beliefs. Grant it, this is coupled with almost daily exercise and prayer but I think this is a great app to help people train their brain to become the person they want to be.

title: Mostly great
review:
But why on earth do Sleepcasts, Sleepscapes, Sleep Radio, etc. count towards Stats? The only thing that should count towards ‚ÄúTotal Time Meditated‚Äù is time meditated! Not the hour of soundscape after I fall asleep.

Edit: Can someone explain to me why sleepcasts don‚Äôt always include narration? I‚Äôve been listening to ‚ÄúCabin Porch‚Äù for 25 minutes and haven‚Äôt heard a peep from Darren. Tgis happens with several other sleepcasts as well. If no one is talking, shouldn‚Äôt it just be a soundscape? And, finally, why isn‚Äôt there an option to choose Airplay from the sleepcast screen? I have to work around by first selecting a soundscape, choose my speaker in Airplay, then back out to the sleepcast I want, and then it works but this is super annoying. And, for the love of all that is holy, give us the option to choose whether or not we want soundscapes to count towards time meditated.
developerResponse: {'id': 18409040, 'body': "Currently Sleepcasts don't count towards your total time meditated. The other content mentioned does since it can be used as a background noise to meditate. However, we'll pass along your feedback to our team!", 'modified': '2020-10-12T00:27:40Z'}

title: 4 Years of Progressive Peace
review: I downloaded this app four years ago and it started me on a journey I didn‚Äôt know I was taking. I became very interested in meditation and learning about where it stemmed from which lead me to receiving my Bachelors Degree in Religious Studies where I learned about many of the roots for meditation. Taking the time to take some time for myself has given me more awareness of my mind which benefits not only me, but the people around me. Meditation, I believe, helps the most with preventing a snowball effect of emotions by noticing the bad thoughts before it‚Äôs nearly unstoppable which could ruin a whole day or weeks without even remembering what started the poor mood. Thank you Headspace for the skill of peace you have taught me ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Trouble sleeping? HeadSpace gotcha covered
review: Whenever I am tossing and turning in my bed at night I always try to clear my head and close my eyes, don‚Äôt really work, so when I kept seeing a lot of ads for Headspace I said to myself, ‚ÄúThis might help.‚Äù and it has, and my friend who said he has had trouble sleeping I texted him to try the app and he said he‚Äôs been sleeping better! And if you also have trouble sleeping you should download this app! I have been using Headspace for about a year now and I just feel better! And cause school started and I have to wake up early I use this to help me fall asleep! I am so happy with these results of my mental health and I am so happy to help a friend! Now go download it!!!!!- from your friend MadziaMeerkat <3

title: Healing through grief, loss, and heartbreak
review: Headspace has been a tool of healing for me. I initially had the intention of using it as a source to ease anxious thoughts and feelings but ended up addressing wounds I tried to ignore for a long time. I‚Äôm a little over 100 consecutive days in and I can assure you, I‚Äôve never been so clear headed in my life. I‚Äôve made it a habit to meditate first thing in the morning and that routine, alone, keeps me grounded. It‚Äôs helped me through this pandemic. It‚Äôs helped me through losing my aunt. It‚Äôs helped me through a breakup. Just hearing Andy‚Äôs voice that the ‚Äúblue sky‚Äù is always right there, soothes me and brings me back to the present. Idk if this even made sense but the tranquility headspace has brought to my life is truly unexplainable.

title: My Review
review: Headspace has helped me through a lot! I‚Äôve only had it for a few days but I swear it‚Äôs one of my most used apps! I love it so much! I am home, in the summer, with my other brother and 3 dogs all different ages and a couple different breeds. So, it gets stressful. I love hanging out with my friends but, hate doing it when I‚Äôm mad or stressed. If that happens. I go to headspace. It only takes a few minutes to calm me down. It used to take like 30 minutes to an hour. I always go on it in the morning and at night. I also do a lot through the day. I love how headspace allows you to calm down in like 3 to 5 minutes and you can do it anywhere at anytime! I love this app so much and I bet you will to! I really recommend!

title: Amazing app, atrocious customer service
review: First off- this app is wonderful‚Äî it has truly taught me many skills and helped me meditate. I loved using it so much that I had to purchase the yearly subscription and was really proud of myself for the progress that I made. Then the app logged me out, forgot all of my account history (all the previous meditations/progress I had made) and wouldn‚Äôt allow me to access my subscription. I‚Äôve spent hours trying to troubleshoot this issue and have emailed Headspace 3 times trying to fix this problem and have heard nothing back. I‚Äôm extremely frustrated with the lack of customer service and spent $70 on a subscription that I can‚Äôt use despite all of my efforts to get it to work.
developerResponse: {'id': 13273877, 'body': "We're so sorry for the trouble and for the delay in our response. We have been seeing higher than normal volume and we are answering inquiries in the order in which we receive them. You should receive a response shortly!", 'modified': '2020-02-03T21:24:07Z'}

title: Monkey Mind -> Meditation Lover
review:
I RECOMMEND HEADSPACE. 
HEADSPACE has been my APP friend for over a year. I started with the free 10 sessions and I did those 10 sessions randomly (not consistently) a few times before investing. 
It is a small investment for a volume of choices. Walking meditations, positivity meditations, meditations for reducing stress, meditations for sleep! It is all here! You choose a male or female voice and the BEST is you choose how long (5mins, 10 mins, 15 mins, etc). 
In addition to the outstanding guided mediations that have turned my monkey brain into a meditation mind HEADSPACE has these great short and very helpful videos that show and explain in a simple way what is happening in your brain and how to tame it and train it! 
Give yourself the gift of meditation with HEADSPACE. HM

title: I love Headspace, but I miss the old app
review: Headspace is fantastic. I appreciate the way it puts mediation into a do-able, flexible format; and promotes mindful living habits. I miss the way the app was organized and the way the ‚Äúbrand‚Äù was a couple years ago when they used a softer-pallet color scheme for the thumbnails. Back when the Headspace logo was an all caps font. The bold colors (especially in the sleep sections) are too saturated for my taste and seem at a discord for a company promoting stillness in the mind. I also miss the layout/menu organization that the app had back then. But since those complaints have more to do with the recent packaging choices, and not with the actual ‚Äúpackage‚Äù I still give 5 stars because the content is excellent.

title: Life-changing
review:
I‚Äôve used Headspace for a few months now and used many of the features. The experience has been life-changing. 

A good deal of the anxiety I had been experiencing daily has gone away, without any change in external circumstance. Meditation has helped me slow down and learn to breathe and be calm. I feel more agency over my mood and internal well-being. My wife has commented many times on how present I seem (and how grateful she is for that!).

Headspace Move, the exercise program, focuses on a mindful approach to physical exercise, something I had never experienced before, and it has added a good deal of joy to my physical routine. The video production and design work are outstanding, as is the coaching. I do wish, however, that there was a bit more emphasis on form throughout the workouts ‚Äì if I did not have previous experience with some of the exercises, I might be a bit lost as to how to do them properly and without risk of injury. That said, the emphasis on being gentle and listening to the body each day has certainly helped.

Thank you, Headspace, for creating a product that brings good into the world.

title: Definitely worthwhile
review: This is my second go at using Headspace. It was years ago when I first used it and I was only using the free version of it then. Fast forward to 2020 and the whirlwind of a year it‚Äôs been so far, I said F it, I‚Äôll pay for the premium. It‚Äôs incredible. Meditation, of course, won‚Äôt fix all your problems but it can help you divide and conquer yourself which then reflects outwardly. Headspace definitely provides more than enough guidance for particular aspects of our lives. I truly enjoy the voices that narrate these guided meditations (so glad they added a female voice!) And also their animations are beyond cute but also effective for elevating your practice. I would recommend this app 100 times over.

title: Our current situation
review: Don‚Äôt get me wrong this app is amazing !!! I love it because it calms me down and gives me piece. I can forget everything going on around me for just a bit. But it‚Äôs quite limited if you don‚Äôt pay. Considering everything going on around In our world a lot of people are stressed, anxious and scared. Many of us don‚Äôt have the opportunity to pay for it in these hard times. I know it probably won‚Äôt happen but It would be so freaking  AWESOMEEE if at least for a little bit this app could give us access to more stuff for free. I think that many more people would get to enjoy the wonders of this app and forget about what is happening just for a bit. We don‚Äôt know when we will be able to go back outside for quite some while.

title: Life Changing
review: I first tried this app for free a couple of years ago but then soon deleted it.  I didn‚Äôt really try.  It wasn‚Äôt until I saw Headspace Guide to Meditation on Netflix that I was able to fully grasp the concept.   I‚Äôve learned so much and continue to dig deeper on how meditation helps me mentally, emotionally and physically.   Being stuck at home during Covid can bring a lot of anxiety and depression.  This app has helped extremely, it has done wonders and will continue to help me live to the fullest.  I ask please, if you are suffering from any of these or stress or even pain, to please please do yourself a favor and try it.  Please also watch the show on Netflix.   I will forever be thankful for Headspace.  It‚Äôs a life changer. ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Great Content But the App Needs to be Fixed
review:
This app has great content, but it doesn‚Äôt work in landscape view on an iPad.  I got around this by turning my iPad on its side using the keyboard as a stand. With a more recent update, though, when I do this, the app is completely upside down‚Äîit doesn‚Äôt turn with the iPad like most apps do.  This is frustrating as I prefer using it with my iPad for a larger viewing screen.  It‚Äôs essentially asking people to turn their laptop on end to use a particular app.  

For most apps, not having landscape view is an automatic delete for me.  I really love Headspace, but it‚Äôs useless if it‚Äôs upside down.   It works best for viewing for my keyboard to be on the right, screen on the left.   I hope they fix this feature.  Just let it work in landscape view, please, so I don‚Äôt have to turn my keyboard on end. Or at least let it be upright in portrait view, no matter which end is up.

title: Ugh
review: I used to love this app and it helps me fall asleep in no time, even though I only had a few options. But I got the new update and it BOILS MY BLOOD because they made it so almost everything from sounds to meditations are only available for premium users. I understand the app needs to make money but COME ON! There was two options in the sleep meditations before but I only used one because the other wasn‚Äôt as good. Now that one I liked is gone and I‚Äôm left with the short not so good one that‚Äôs not even for the right purpose. Also, they have a whole section for the stories or ‚Äúsleepcasts‚Äù but only one is available for non premium it‚Äôs honestly so annoying. Make more stories and meditations available to normal people who can‚Äôt afford premium please!! I used to love this app but I‚Äôm trying to find new ones now

title: The same for every course
review: You do the same thing for every course it seems. I have completed 4 courses. They all teach the exact same thing. Get it tune with your breathing, if thoughts or feelings arise, note them, scan body from head to toe, let mind wander freely, bring attention back to breathing. End.   You don‚Äôt really get any other tips. Possibly the only thing is that each day you notice more times you are having the certain thoughts you are trying to get rid of, say anxiety. So day 1 notice 1 time you got anxious, day two notice 3 times. The thing is the exercises don‚Äôt change. It‚Äôs the exact same thing. So to save money just do the mindfulness exercises above for anything that bothers you and that‚Äôs it. No other special tips needed, according to headspace. Simple mindfulness breathing exercises, the same one helps for everything, period, the end

title: Best mental wellness app EVER
review: I got this app hoping to start getting into meditation, and I was absolutely blown away by it. I‚Äôve had headspace for three years, and the improvements and new features and functions they‚Äôve added really make sure you are getting an amazing experience for your money. I have the yearly subscription, and headspace has gotten me out of so many negative and dark places. Their audio clips don‚Äôt make you feel silly and are very down to earth, and all of the speakers are very soothing to listen to. I have avoided countless sleepless nights thanks to headspace, and I will continue to for a long time!! Integrate headspace practices into your daily life, and I guarantee you‚Äôll be a happier and more relaxed person for it.

title: Please Read
review:
Headspace is one of the best meditation apps ever! I wholeheartedly recommend it. Its library is so vast that there‚Äôs a meditation for every. Single. Circumstance. The sleepcasts are so relaxing and the sleep musics, radios, and soundscapes and truly magical. They pull me into another world! The workouts are great, too! And I love the new Focus section. With COVID and stuff going on, and when I have to do virtual learning, these playlists really help me concentrate. Also the High Stress progress report is awesome! Although the subscription is a bit pricey, you unlock all Headspace has to offer! You transform from pessimistic to positive, depressed to joyful, and picky to content. It has truly changed my personality to one very grateful self.

Thank you, for changing my life.

title: Worth it!
review: At first, my initial thought of the app was that it was going to be just like any other app. Hardly put together with a bunch of bugs. This app really came to surprise and impress me. Not only does it help with people who have disorders or suffer from crippling anxiety, it also has sections to simply help you build a better mindset and connection to your inner self. This app really helped me with working on myself and also helped me develop ways to embrace and release my anxiety. This app really helps to motivate you in a positive way. The app has a very wide variety of sessions that could help you develop in every aspect. Originally got it for one of my classes but i really enjoy it and will definitely continue to use it.

title: Life Changing
review: I am a preschool teacher and I have been using Headspace with myself and my classroom to introduce and cultivate mindfulness and a sense of calm into the day. I have found that both my classroom environment, children, and myself have all seen a significant difference in the short amount of time that we have been doing it. I incorporated meditation into our daily lesson plan in the mornings and whenever the classroom and myself were getting too chaotic. I‚Äôve also used it many times throughout the day with children and myself during meltdowns and extreme behaviors. I seen wonders! The brain is a muscle and we must exercise it, especially during these tumultuous times! Thank you, headspace! I totally recommend üåü

title: Absolutely amazing
review: I saw an ad for Headspace saying they‚Äôd offer it for free to anyone who had lost their job during the pandemic. I signed up right away thinking ‚Äúwhy not? 3 kids home from school, 2 parents who had lost their job it might be worth a try!‚Äù I started daily meditations back in April and didn‚Äôt really notice if it was helping a ton...but then things got very tough at home and my father passed away unexpectedly...having these tools in my arsenal has helped me SO much. Prior to this I don‚Äôt know how I would have dealt with all of that at the same time...not as well as I‚Äôm handling it now. The sessions on grieving and anxiety have been life changing for me. I truly can‚Äôt recommend Headspace enough. So grateful this exists!

title: Absolutely PHENOMENAL
review: I never take the time to write reviews (ever) but I am simply so enamored with headspace I felt I absolutely needed to! I have been using Headspace for about 6 months now (upgraded to premium too) and think it‚Äôs one of the best investments I‚Äôve made in my life. It seriously makes me feel so good - from the fantastic guided meditations, to the specially crafted sleep casts and sleep scapes for helping you go to sleep/fall back asleep/wind down, to the next ‚ÄúMove‚Äù element, I think that Headspace is doing an amazing job. I also really love their animations - whoever is doing them, keep it up! They are so cute, pleasant, and really drive the message of the animation home - really lovely incorporation! Andy (puddicombe) and his team are great people - love the app!

title: The only thing keeping me grounded
review:
I‚Äôve been living in New York City for the last year and it‚Äôs taken it‚Äôs toll on me. I have been steadily weakened from the day to day noise and congestion of the city and my work, and finally broke down a few times at the end of last year. My cousin recommended Headspace, and boy are these meditations the only things lately that are helping me keep it together. I only wish that more of the short ones had longer alternates as well. 

More than that, the meditations are inspiring and the ‚Äòmale voice‚Äô is perhaps the most calming, and grounded, reassuring voice of a human I‚Äôve ever heard. I want to cry sometimes at the sheer compassion behind his voice. Thank you for extending that compassion to us all.

title: Authentic meditation. Practice authentically & you‚Äôll see positive change in your life.
review: Headspace changed my dad‚Äôs life over 8 years ago. His regular practice helped him manage anxiety, worries, and challenging life circumstances. After at first believing that meditation was for weirdos and that I was probably too good for it, I opened my mind and gave the free 10-day trial a try. 6 years later, I can confidently say that headspace has changed my life too. The tools I‚Äôve gained from regular meditation using headspace have assisted me in navigating 3 international moves, career change, family dynamic changes, anxiety, depression, and so much more. I so strongly believe in this mindfulness & meditation that I‚Äôm now trained in the field, sharing these techniques with children.

title: 5 Stars for The Meditation. 4 Stars for the App itself.
review:
This is the best meditation app along with Calm. However, one technical thing here that could be improved is the ability to remove stuff from the journey section. Sometimes, I would go back and listen to the last minute of some meditations for the mini lecture at the end and then it would count as if I did the whole thing and just throws the tracking/numbers off in the journey section. Either add the ability to make me remove/delete from that section or even better, make the algorithm just realize that I didn‚Äôt listen to the whole thing but just the last minute or so.

Thanks so much. This app is changing my life.

title: Headspace likes to steal your money
review: I was trying to give this app an opportunity and found it useful only for the first week ; however somehow and I am not entirely clear how,  the subscription renewed for a year and there‚Äôs no way to cancel it.    Once they take your money ; canceling the subscription requires you to go to a website ;  you cannot do so within the app because the only thing they want is to make it more difficult for the user and discourage you from not turning off the auto Renew . There is a link to the website where you need to go cancel your subscription ; however the link is broken most likely on purpose. Very disappointed and dishonest I would not recommend this up to anyone.

title: Nice concept but disappointing
review:
I was very excited about this app after reading all the positive reviews.
What convinced me to subscribe was the impression of diversity on the app: lots of content, lots of different themes, tools, I thought this was going to be a great way to navigate various issues throughout the day (tiredness, lack of focus, sleep problems).
But then I realized there‚Äôs basically one concept that is repeated EVERYWHERE. Think about your body and the different parts of your body... 
It‚Äôs honestly disappointing and this is borderline deceptive. Don‚Äôt pretend you have all these angles and approaches when you are using one technique over and over again. I don‚Äôt need an app to repeat the same thing everyday no matter what my problem is, and definitely not at this price.
It‚Äôs too bad - with the proper content, matching the various options they pretend to offer, this app would be amazing.
developerResponse: {'id': 15214523, 'body': "So sorry for any trouble regarding our content!
