title: Download it! It will change you
review:
I started headspace right at beginning of pandemic and it‚Äôs changed my life. It keeps getting better and better such as with the focus and move categories. I love the different types of meditation and advice like Andy‚Äôs on techniques and feelings, etc., group headspaces, animations, sleep stuff, and Kevin harts energy shots. My only complaint is that there isn‚Äôt more of Kevin‚Äôs stuff! His energy shots prevent me from wasting time at work!

Haha but seriously this app is amazing. It has gotten me through a lot of difficult feelings and events. I‚Äôm forever thankful I read this random users post on Reddit recommending it to people at start of pandemic. I am an annual member now. 

DOWNLOAD! You won‚Äôt regret it.

title: Too much
review: I've used Headspace for about five years now, and learned some meditation practices that will no doubt benefit me for life. Andy is an incredible teacher and opened my eyes to what mediation can and should be.  However, over the years the app has become as much of a distraction as Facebook or Twitter.  You open it and are met with a barrage of distractions, offerings, and calls to action.  lt's actually hard to find your next exercise amidst the sea of offerings. Try this! Watch this!  With success it's clear Headspace is being pulled in many directions (a Netflix series too!!) but I feel like they're losing the plot a bit.  Pare it back, tone it down.  People come to Headspace for a respite from it all, not to be thrown into another endless rabbit hole of distraction; no matter how well-intentioned.  Anyway... thanks for doing what you do Andy.

title: A wonderful meditation app
review: This app brought me back to meditation after years of neglect.  I learned meditation long ago, but my practice tended to die out.  I‚Äôd get bored or busy or forgetful.  But I watched the headspace series on Netflix and found myself captivated by the new technology.  With headspace, I have access to tons of meditations, guided, semi-guided, or unguided.  There are many specialized meditations as well.  I love that the scientific benefits of meditation are explained.  One thing that helps me maintain a daily practice is the recording of how many days in a row I have participated.  It sounds corny, but I‚Äôm not eager to ‚Äúbreak the chain‚Äù.  Plus there are also group meditations.  Sharing the experience with others makes me feel part of a community.

title: This is a great appüòÅ
review: This app teaches you how to turn negative things in your life to positive things. The lessons are very easy to understand. The subscription is a little annoying but even if you don‚Äôt subscribe to the subscription you still have a lot of different lessons you can do. This app has guided lessons on yoga but you have to have a subscription to access it. This app also has lessons on how to fall asleep. If you're a fan of white noise they have videos on that as well. If you like this app as much as I like it I would recommend checking out a podcast called Headspace Studios which is made by the same people who made this app. A good thing about this app is that it has no ads.

title: thinking about getting headspace?
review: If you are thinking or interested in perhaps getting headspace‚Ä¶ you should absolutely do so! It has changed my life in so many ways. It‚Äôs apart of my daily routine now. Even if it‚Äôs only 3-5 minutes. It‚Äôs easy to keep up with and a really great experience. My mom and I are buddies on there and we can send each other little positive messages at work, school, or right next to each other at home. Or when I‚Äôm texting friends I get cute little characters from the app. You don‚Äôt need to be stressed about paying for anything there are plenty of free options! Well, I‚Äôll stop my writing here and let you download the app :)

title: Where has this app been all my life?
review:
I love meditation. Love. It. It‚Äôs my new favorite thing to do. The guides give just the right amount of prompts to lead and guide you through the process. And constantly remind you that it‚Äôs ok to get distracted as you go along. You don‚Äôt become a master overnight. 

I‚Äôve had this app on my phone for several months and finally just decided that my life needed a change. I felt stressed more often than not and overwhelmed by all the changes being forced on us in our lives. And I decided I didn‚Äôt want to live in that negative space anymore. 

After only a few weeks of using the Headspace app, I can feel a change. I feel lighter, happier, and overall find it easier to let go of the negative emotions I‚Äôm experiencing, rather than holding onto them, fixating on them and letting them run my life. 

Meditation is leading me down a path toward peace, patience and a better understanding of myself and by extension, the world around me. 

I cannot emphasize enough how much I love this app and deeply appreciate the people who created it. Thank you. This is exactly what I needed in my life.

title: Please add a Headspace in Russian language
review: Hi Headspace! I cannot thank you enough for the continuous help I get from this app. It really changed my life. The problem is that it is really hard to find a good content that is also easy to comprehend about meditation in Russian language. A lot of my friends are in central Asian countries like Uzbekistan, Kazakstan ,also  in Ukraine, Moldova, Belarus. The second language there is Russian. So if you add the Russian language you will cover not just one huge country , but around 20 others. People there are just opening up for meditation. But they get confused and give up mostly because of the lack of tools and sources. You will do a huge thing and make so many people happier and healthier. Thank you

title: I love this app
review: Do you know how much this app means to me?? It‚Äôs like my own meditation adventure Andy puddicombe (tell me if that‚Äôs the right way to spell it) is a life saver I recently broke up with my husband after 15 years together and it has been depressing and sad without him at least I have my 2 beautiful loving kids but it still has been so hard they still cry in their rooms the minute I leave and turn out the light so it has been hard to be strong for my kids but headspace has helped so much I take the meditations on sadness and it helps me. A lot and my kids took the meditation of Sesame Street this app is so beautiful and the animations are calming and spot on it is great thank you Andy and headspace team!!

title: The app has gotten to ‚Äúcocky‚Äù
review: The app use to be great there were like 3 free sleepcasts that u could listen to. But now there is only one and u have to pay for everything. Before there use to be a thing when you signed up about ur sleep schedule they also were asking if you wanted a reminder 39 minutes before your bedtime to settle in and what u are using the app for and how it was making the perfect experience for you. But now it just ask for your email name and what u are using the app for. Barely anything on there is free anymore and it is unpleasant using the app now. I use to enjoy getting on the app having the sleep casts to pick from and watching the little animations now I only have one option to listen to every night and it‚Äôs not working that well anymore. It seems the company has stopped caring about people‚Äôs experiences and only want money now. I will be deleting the app.

title: This app is saving my life.
review: Honestly, though. I was always kind of wary of meditating for reasons that I can‚Äôt even specifically say. I even tried with other apps before, but nothing really caught my attention to continually practice meditation. Until headspace. This app is so easy to use, so visually pleasing, and so beautifully insightful. I have a lot of anxiety and always overthink (like a lot of people in the world today), and since using this app and trying to mediate every day, I notice I am able to better control my anxiety and thoughts, and how I react to those anxious thoughts. I recommend headspace to all my friend and family. Thank you for creating this app because it really has been a life saver.

title: Life Changing!
review:
I began my meditation journey (again) during the COVID-19 lockdown with Headspace and I‚Äôve noticed a huge difference in how I am able to pause and observe the world, others, and my emotions and thoughts. This ability to pause has been instrumental in helping me to be a calmer, more patient and compassionate person. This has helped me through this difficult time, and I am committed to my meditation practice as a result. 

I‚Äôve started many journeys into meditation with limited success - this is the first time I‚Äôve been able to fully adapt and integrate meditation into my day, no matter how hectic or dull - there is always 3-5 minutes that I can pause and perform some mental housekeeping - clearing my mind and focusing on my breathing. 

The teachers are so wonderful and helpful and each session has a meaningful take away that builds upon and strengthens the foundations of my practice. 

This has been life changing in the most wonderful way, while our lives and the world around us have all changed in ways we never imagined. This app has helped me find perspective and peace in the midst of chaos.

title: Grateful for Headspace
review: When I first heard of headspace I was on a path of personal growth and didn‚Äôt know it yet. I‚Äôve gone into growth spurts as a person and I do believe that meditation has allowed ease, access, and gentle understanding on my journey. I rejoined the app during quarantine and it really helped me and I even shared with my child. I don‚Äôt know if there are options for meditations in Spanish, this is my native tongue. I can say that accessing meditation in Spanish may allow to rewrite neural pathways related to my childhood. I would love to see these come into existence and if I may help the team at Headspace I would just to give back & expand access to this practice to a greater demographic of people around the globe.

title: Great Self-Therapy
review:
I have been in desperate need to make space for myself in all aspects of my life: my relationships, my goals, and sense of self-worth. Although I‚Äôm taking therapy, it‚Äôs only once a week and I want more time to dedicate to my mental health. This app is a perfect alternative to making time and practicing a healthy routine with self-care in mind.

I do wish the subscriptions were better priced as many of the meditating sessions, skills, and educational videos are not at all interactive (you must passively watch them or listen to them and I think it‚Äôs helpful to feel as though you‚Äôre participating in the meditations with someone present).

Nevertheless, Headspace has been incredibly beneficial to me and I plan on exploring their options in the near future.

title: Headspace is changing my life
review:
A therapist recommended headspace to meditate to help with my disassociation. At first I was nervous and it was difficult. I‚Äôm 4 months into my subscription and truth be told I‚Äôve only just finished the first 10 sessions. But the more I work through therapy and try and learn the better I feel. Meditation has made a difference and while there is a learning curve and a healthy dose of personal accountability involved in making it a habit; it is a worthwhile habit and headspace was my favorite (I also tried calm) place to start this journey. 

Ps Idk how true this was my subscription was a gift from my mom but my therapist said some insurance companies will help cover the cost of the yearly subscription!

title: Best App
review:
If you struggle with depression, inability to concentrate or let go, and even physical pain, this is for you. I have fibromyalgia and have battled bouts of depression throughout my life. Due to all of this it‚Äôs hard for me to focus and even harder to remain present. I‚Äôve had years of therapy but can honestly say that Headspace is quickly helping me overcome my restless mind, and my physical pain. It is also helping me with my insomnia. I suspect that, in time, I may not need sleeping pills anymore; my intake of pain medication has also decreased.
I‚Äôve been meditating with Andy for only two weeks. I started on Netflix, then moved to the app and I can already see big improvements in my life. This is truly a lifesaver!

title: Sensational App!
review: I have gotten this app before, but I never put the time into my schedule to actually use it and meditate with it. But recently I have the urge to mediate more and focus on my mind. It is so calming, relaxing, and peaceful. When I am stressed or just in a bad mood in general, it‚Äôs nice to take a few minutes on headspace. Sometimes after school is nice, or before studying. As a student this is a very helpful app. It‚Äôs also great to get moving! Or fall asleep to! Or even focus too! I recommend this app for everyone, all ages, and especially students in high school, middle school, and college! It‚Äôs free, unless you want the premum version. I have the free account, and it‚Äôs just as good! Highly recommended app!

title: Perfect for Beginners
review: I‚Äôm loving this app so far! I‚Äôve tried getting into meditation many times over the years and it never sticks for me. I just don‚Äôt get it, I always felt like I was doing it wrong. I‚Äôm so glad I found Headspace! It‚Äôs super accessible for all types of people, and it makes meditation seem logical and practical, rather than some kind of magical state that I never felt I could achieve before. Plus I love the adorable British accents and the quirky style of their videos. :) I‚Äôm finally enjoying learning about meditation rather than feeling like I don‚Äôt get it or I‚Äôm bad at it. Plus there are specific videos and tools for all kinds of situations and topics. Highly recommend checking it out!

title: Lots of good content but hard to navigate
review:
I have been using headspace since 2017 and have always liked the content. It is soothing and helpful more often than not. That being said, the app has a lot more content now and it is easy to get lost in a sea of courses, videos and other details. 

For one, it‚Äôd be nice to have some kind of goal setting based on what I am going through in life. Right now, it is hard not to get distracted by the billion colorful cards and many other auto playing videos or moving images. Sometimes, that feels so counter intuitive for a service aiming to make you feel more peaceful. Overall a very nice service but I wish they improved their interface.

title: Best sleep ever
review:
I have an intense fear when it comes to falling asleep. Sleep means a new day of stress and work. But with Headspace, I‚Äôve learned to accept these worries and workloads as opportunities rather than burdens. To take in my life one step at a time and observe my anxieties rather than try and control them. This gives me a better understanding of what is really happening. 

Not to mention, the sleepscapes help me fall asleep with stories to help keep my mind off of everything else. Wind down sessions to start off to help get you comfortable for bed, followed by soothing story telling that puts me asleep nearly instantly. I love the continuations of the sleep scapes too! The second part of the Rainday Antiques made me so happy <3

title: Chaotic and Distracting Interface
review: I love the actual content of Headspace, but the new app design prevents me from meditating because its so difficult to navigate, meanwhile I‚Äôm constantly having random content (not meditations) pop up on the screen. There‚Äôs no way to ‚Äúsave‚Äù courses or single meditations to my own library anymore. I especially have trouble when I‚Äôve finished a course and want to move onto a new one. Or when I want to save a course for later. I‚Äôm lost at sea because the only ‚Äúorganization‚Äù structure is the Recent section. Otherwise I have to dig through the ENTIRE library of meditations. This is a really unhelpful interface for me. I wish Headspace would go back to prioritizing meditation in their interface, rather than all the new ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù they‚Äôve added in recent months.

title: Almost!
review:
I am an intermediate-beginner when it comes to meditation. I like the teacher‚Äôs voice and the Getting Started meditations were all helpful. I also love that there is a monthly subscription option. I have subscribed to Headspace for a few months now, and now I am test-driving a few others, such as Simple Habit, Calm, etc to compare. 

There are a few things that Headspace can improve, in my opinion, that one or more of the competitors do well. 

Make your interface more sleek and soothing‚ÄîI don‚Äôt care for cartoon characters and bright colors when I‚Äôm trying to focus on choosing a meditation. They don‚Äôt me me happier‚Äîthey distract me, and they are juvenile.

The entire app is too bright‚Äîat minimum, please design a dark mode (like the one in your sleep section) that extends to the whole app if the user so chooses. 

Please allow the ability for users to create lists: overall favorites, meditations I want to try, best for sleep, etc. I spend far too much time scrolling and hunting for a track that I saw once before and wanted to remember to return to or trying to go back to find a track I liked, especially in the soundscape section.

title: Oh my. This is my savior for nightly anxiety
review: I‚Äôm a 31 y.o female who has very bad anxiety at night particularly after taking accutane amd developing a ‚Äúreaction‚Äù (hyper- vitaminosis a) I know that‚Äôs specific but I want you all to understand the authenticity of this review. You can research how very real and terrible this anxiety can get and after just 5 minuets (2 exercises and one story) I literally feel 80-90% improvement in my anxiety my breathing is more steady my heat rate is steady, my mind is clear and weightless I feel relax (I did also drink one cup of chamomile tea), but truly it‚Äôs the app. NEVER UNDERESTIMATE THE POWER OF MEDITATION AND BREATHING EXERCISES!!! Thank you to the developer of this app and whomever is responsible for the contributing content you truly saved a life.

title: Look No Further
review:
I have tried several of the meditation/mindfulness apps. Some are pretty fancy, full of famous names and such, and I've dipped my toe in some of them, but this is my bedrock. I've been with Headspace for about three years now. The simplicity of Headspace is perfect for me. It's very flexible. So many time options, even within the courses, means that I don't ditch my practice when life gets crazy and I need it most. 

A note about $$$. I have the subscription version, because after using it for almost a year, I wanted to contribute to the support of the program, and I think it's a great value. BUT the free version is quite generous - it sustained me for months -  so anyone can dive in.

title: i love this but
review: i love this app and the sleepcasts help me fall asleep more than anything else can. you‚Äôve now made them only for members. I don‚Äôt have the money for that. stop taking away helpful devices for the purpose of making money, the resources should already be there and be provided. every time I click on something it tells me I have to pay. how would it feel if you needed something helpful to your mental health that was normally right there, and being told you had to pay for it or you have to be a member. why is basically 3/4 of your app members only? I really do enjoy the app but more and more keeps getting reserved for subscribers. At least let those of us who can‚Äôt pay the money enjoy your app for more than just basics and 1-3 minute animations, it‚Äôs ridiculous.

title: Enjoyed app until I needed to contact customer service
review: I really enjoy the app. It‚Äôs the best mindfulness app in the market. Bring that I‚Äôm in the behavioral science field, my employer offered the app services for free to employees. Port instructions, I merged my existing account and at time of renewal I get charged to my bank account. It‚Äôs been horrible to get in contact with customer service. Emails, no contact number. I just want this resolved and they make it impossible to connect with anyone. My rating would be a five if it weren‚Äôt for customer service or lack of. It‚Äôs a shame because I‚Äôm a big promoter of app. Again I‚Äôm in the field but with the stress this has caused me I‚Äôll reconsider sharing.

title: New app design isn‚Äôt meditative
review:
I have used and subscribed to headspace for over a year for stress and anxiety meditation. However their new app design seems to be taking them in a different direction. It‚Äôs definitely not good for late-night use, which I was drawn to originally with their features for sleep and calming anxiety.

Now it‚Äôs large, looping videos of food, people dancing, jerky, multi-angled camera shots...not something someone with anxiety wants to see at 3AM. Perhaps their demographic has changed as the company grew. I know for sure that walking into a counselor, psychiatrist, or meditation office, you won‚Äôt first be greeted with content equivalents like this. You‚Äôre greeted with calmness. 

I really liked headspace, and even got my wife a subscription as a gift, but I‚Äôll now be trying out other apps, unfortunately.

title: Mental Lifesaver
review: Their 1-year free trial during the 2020 pandemic mentally saved my *ss. I haven‚Äôt stopped meditating since. It‚Äôs now a daily habit, and I feel all the better about it. Not saying it will solely save you; it‚Äôs not a cure-all. I‚Äôve had other mental health services and methods to help as well. Still, their adorable animation, their daily morning Wake Up segments at the start of my days, and their Focus music when working on projects have immensely improved my daily mornings. Oh, and their Sleepcasts! I absolutely love them and have my go-to favorites at this point, and I‚Äôm barely getting started with their Sleep music and environmental sounds. All have solidified me as a regular user of Headspace.

title: All about giving
review: Headspace used to have a ‚Äúbuy one, give one‚Äù subscription program and as a poor college student i couldn‚Äôt afford a subscription. So I asked if I could be on the receiving end of the program and they gave me 3 months for free. I used the app everyday for 3 months and it changed my entire mindset. I became more focused, a better performer, and a better version of myself. That was back when it was just Andy and guided meditations. Having the app now is a world of different! I have access to tools that help me sleep, workout, and become more advanced in my practice. Thank you Andy for all the hard work upfront. It‚Äôs great to see how far you‚Äôve come!

title: Such a versatile tool, has helped me sleep better and helps me manage anxiety attacks
review: A few months ago I had heightened anxiety and although I was hesitant to try a meditation app, I gave Headspace a go. I started using the free trial and forgot to cancel for premium. Best mistake ever, now I have explored every type of meditation and tool in this app and I have to say it‚Äôs fantastic. When I can‚Äôt sleep or have a lot of anxiety, the calming voices really help me get back to a space where I have peace of mind. Not only that, this app has also helped me see anxiety in a different way and has taught me ways to think of it that help me deal with it in a better way. Thank you headspace for all you offer!!

title: Let us push pay button monthly, Appeal to many more users
review:
I like your app but won‚Äôt be going forward because of the ‚Äú auto subscription. 
I believe if you set the pay schedule differently you would set yourself apart from all the other meditation apps out there. 
Charge 4.99 per month, but let us unlock it monthly instead of this subscriber garbage. I am an average consumer. You are trying to appeal to people needing peace, reoccurring subscriptions ... no for a very large population out there. You loose a very larger percentage of consumers. Charge 4.99 monthly , but we get to Be in charge of pushing the pay button monthly. If you did this, you would become the most popular meditation app and increase your revenue 10-fold. I took the time to suggest this because I really like your app.

title: Amazing but...
review:
This is amazing! 
First thing: it helps with my stress and my migraines associated with that stress. 
Second thing: it isn‚Äôt pushy like other apps like it
Third thing: this is where it lost a star. I had this like a year ago but deleted it because I wasn‚Äôt using it. Now I came back to it because of stress, and they added a subscription system. It used to be 100% free now there are some things you CAN spend money on. Overall, it‚Äôs a great app, very helpful and I would recommend this to anyone.
New edit a while later: dropped to 3 stars. Great app but 12 dollars a month or 70 dollars per year is a bit much for mental health home therapy. I would understand if there were cycling free courses,, but everything needing to be paid for now is just a bit much for my liking.

title: ADD A QUEUING FEATURE
review:
This app has improved my life drastically! Since meditating consistently on the app, I am noticeably more well-equipped to handle my anxiety and depression. 

One thing though- I ADORE the sleep meditations, stories, and soundscapes, and I think Headspace users would GREATLY benefit from a queuing feature! It may seem like something a meditation app wouldn‚Äôt need, but I‚Äôd love to be able to put on a wind down and queue up a soundscape (or a few) to automatically follow. Or queue up multiple stories for nights when I‚Äôm feeling extra restless. It would honestly make the app perfect in my opinion!! 

Anyway, I‚Äôm thankful Headspace exists! It‚Äôs by far my favorite app and definitely worth the money!
developerResponse: {'id': 17106878, 'body': "Thank you for your review regarding a queuing feature. We'll be sure to pass along this feedback with our team!", 'modified': '2020-08-05T22:32:52Z'}

title: Love it, but...
review:
I love headspace so much, it‚Äôs helped me work out a lot of things I‚Äôve been dealing with mentally especially with my emotional state. However, I just switched from my Galaxy to my new IPhone and I‚Äôve completely factory reset my galaxy so I know being signed in on another device isn‚Äôt the issue. 

But for some reason it won‚Äôt let me log in on my IPhone. I‚Äôve deleted and reinstalled the app, I‚Äôve even changed my password thinking I wasn‚Äôt typing in the right info when in fact I was. I even turned my phone off and on, but nothing is working. I‚Äôm hoping it‚Äôs an issue on Headspaces end that way it can be fixed, because I have no idea what I‚Äôm going to do without this app with this pandemic going on.

title: Wowowow, and hello sleep! üò¥
review: The meditation sessions on this app have always been amazing, especially for beginners. The real game changer here was when they introduced sleep casts. I had struggled every night falling asleep, I couldn‚Äôt quiet my racing mind. The sleep casts successfully ended this part of my sleep routine, I play them every night and now I can‚Äôt even get past the calming exercise at the beginning without falling asleep midway through. I highly recommend trying this out if you have trouble falling asleep, it may not work for everyone but it certainly calms the mind, brings peace, inner calm and helps with full body awareness. 10/10 recommendüëç

title: Andy from headspace is awesome
review:
Love this so much. she did. At first I was using calm, calm is good but I grew up going to a church school till 5th grade. Went to chapel everyday and then when I got older my family joined a Presbyterian church for a few years.
My mothers side is catholic and Presbyterian  and my dads is Presbyterian.  So I consider myself all of the above.  
my absolute favorite about this is Andy. I love that he was a monk. I‚Äôve always wanted to visit and still do want to visit a monastery.  He helps me calm down.  I just lost both my parents within a year and a half apart.  This  helps me deal with the grieving. I love Andy‚Äôs advice. I wish I could just meet him. He‚Äôs amazing. 
Thankyou Andy for helping people.

title: I‚Äôve been able to stay with it!
review:
This is a wonderful, wonderful meditation help. I have tried and failed at meditation for years. This has helped so much!  I have been consistent for months listening to and often repeating the different tracks and I feel better and more focused during the day. The animations are entertaining and also really do provide useful tips that come to mind at times during the day. I learned about this in a mental health seminar and I‚Äôm so grateful it is and will continue to be part of my life.  Benefits accumulate in a subtle way over time. Almost unnoticed and then I see that I am doing better  highly highly  recommend 
,Mary

title: Headspace works!
review: I love the app. Andy‚Äôs voice is very soothing on the meditation sessions and Leon is a great workout instructor! I was skeptical at first because my meditation is generally unguided and I feel that lets me connect to myself more, but I had no need to worry! Headspace lets you connect and feel spiritually recharged while helping you work on certain things. I have two small problems. One being, they make you pay after a free trial. That‚Äôs hard for me being a student and not having a luxurious amount of money. And two, they don‚Äôt have many chakra focused meditations. I would love if they made a series where they had meditations for each chakra! It would help me feel more personally balanced. But really an amazing app!

title: Sleepcasts are the best
review: There is such a wonderful assortment of gentle stories that help me go to sleep. I highly recommend these sleepcasts. I really like that the stories all get varied so they don‚Äôt get repetitious. The volume during the sleepcasts sometimes seems to vary, so I find it‚Äôs best to keep them on low volume so that if there is an increase, it is not as disturbing. I have a preference for the sleep casts where the speaker is speaking in a low voice and slowly but that‚Äôs just my preference, other people may enjoy the sleep casts that are a little bit faster and higher pitched. In this very tough past year I don‚Äôt know what I would‚Äôve done without Headspace‚Äôs sleep casts.

title: Good for grief
review: If you struggle with grief, whether it‚Äôs for yourself, a loved one, or just the state of the world at present, I highly recommend meditation. I know I need to meditate to make give my mind a break from the constant burden of grief, but just sitting still for 10-30 minutes doesn‚Äôt work for my ADHD brain. Having guided meditations takes the some of the pressure off, and I find Andy‚Äôs voice really soothing. Recently I‚Äôve been going on guided runs and I find that it‚Äôs changed my mentality while running, which I also use as a coping mechanism for grief. If you‚Äôre like me, struggling with sadness and anxiety, wanting a break but not knowing how, this is a really great tool.

title: Crazy how helpful this is! Started using this year, have used to everyday since
review: I‚Äôve heard about meditation before but was skeptical about how helpful it can be. I started using the app based on a recommendation and also my own research on how to manage overwhelming situations/life events. The number one thing that kept coming up was meditation and now I know why! It has helped me manage the most overwhelming situations. I recommend to give it a try and start with short meditation times at first then work your way up if you can‚Äôt sit still for too long. The lessons and greater headspace I have gotten from meditating with this app are priceless.

title: Just what I needed to get back to my best life
review: You know how you get on a kick with a healthy diet, exercise and sleep routine. Every day, giving it your all and feeling better each day.  Then one day you wake up and just stop. No more early mornings, no more healthy shopping, no more feeling good just because you feel good. That‚Äôs where I was with my mental health and meditation when I started using this app. I used to be in a great place with my meditation practice, but years ago I just quit for no apparent reason. Headspace has helped me get back into that groove of mindfulness and meditation and I‚Äôm sincerely grateful. Thank you for helping us find our way back. Much love!

title: The most essential habit I have - but a flawed app
review:
And I mean it. As someone who has dealt with extreme anxiety since childhood, this app has changed my life for the better. I recommend this app to everyone I know and don't know. 

We are all better humans and we create a better world when we all meditate. 

I want to give this app a 5 star rating, but there is one fundamental flaw. If you get any text or phone call during your session, then the audio stops - even on Do Not Disturb mode. You essentially just sit in silence for another 20 minutes wondering if you should break meditation and check your phone - which can be a really frustrating experience. It sometimes ruins the meditation itself because you run over your scheduled time for meditation. You don't get that gentle opening of the eyes and reflect on your feelings - instead you might end up angry that the session was ruined. 

I want to continue to support this wonderful program, but after almost 400 sessions, I am considering quiting my subscription and using a regular timer instead. That way I'll never worry about my time. If they ever fix this issue, I will gladly change my review to 5 stars.

title: The only app that can really change your life
review: I started using headspace when I was in the middle of an emotional breakdown. I was dealing with a lot of anxiety and depression, something I never thought I would deal with in my my life. I felt guilt for feeling this way because to anyone observing my life, they would think I had everything I could ever ask for. It just didn‚Äôt make sense why I was feeling so so so low. This app taught me that it is okay feel that way. It has taught me to accept whatever emotion or situation that may come my way. Headspace helped me out of the deep hole I was in and I continue to use this app because it truly makes each day brighter.

title: This App Literally Saved My Life
review:
As someone who has struggled with anxiety most of my life, Headspace came along at a time when I needed it the most. Coupled with a trusted counselor, Andy and team have taught me how to ‚Äúnot borrow trouble‚Äù and be grounded at the world you see in front of you - always holding onto the blue sky analogy they frequently come back to. It serves as a reminder that the highs and lows are transient and do not define who we are or our worth.

Teaches me to be grounded in the moment and there is an extensive library of topics and even SOS media that ions that can be used to slow things down a bit when it seems unmanageable.

Highest recommendation of any app I have ever used!

title: Great app however I came her to get away from politics
review: I love this app and have been using it for 5 years. It‚Äôs a nice escape from the insanity of 2020. For the first time I‚Äôm starting to see politics and race issues now being incorporated into the app so the one place I can go without having to distance myself or wear a mask or hear about how one race is horrible and other races are there victims is now starting to dabble in this. I‚Äôm hoping this isn‚Äôt where headspace is headed but if it is then I‚Äôll just have to find somewhere else or just meditate without the guidance. It‚Äôs there app and they can do what they want with it so we will just see.

title: One word
review:
one word; Surprising. out of all the meditation apps i have downloaded this so far has ben the very best! Absolutely love it.... and it‚Äôs netflix show ‚ùóÔ∏è It helps me fall asleep easier at night and gives me a better sleep üí§This app makes me in a mood like refreshed and ready to have a good day of kindness. Just that feeling after meditating is so peaceful and relaxing. Another thing is it‚Äôs so so helpful when you at first don‚Äôt really know how they say ‚ÄúBeing distracted is normal so don‚Äôt worry‚Äù I am myself a app reviewer and i review apps. One thing though there is so many things that cost money in this app but there is a handful off things that don‚Äôt so i will deduct a star for in app purchases. This was my app critic review
 
Jocelyn

title: Nice
review:
Took some time for me to commit to using this, because it seems like the problems I have need an immediate and urgent fix, and so whenever I used to start headspace, I would get impatient and stop because there is no immediate change, result, or answer. 
This application is helping me see that an ‚Äòanswer‚Äô is not an actual solution for the problems or pressing issues of the mind. Though you may try to desperately seek it to settle the mind. Space is what you need - from your emotions, thoughts, feelings. Head space.... solutions are made with problems. It‚Äôs the in between from problem to solution where the mind/human experience gets involved.

title: Pay wall for sleep access is ludicrous
review: I've had immense trouble sleeping during the pandemic and started using the sleep meditations nightly. During the first few months I could pay the monthly fee just to listen to the same single sleep meditation every night but eventually I couldn't afford it anymore. At the free level you are locked out from all but a handful of sleep meditations and obviously they are not very good ones because they have been deemed worthy of "free" value. So I listened to the same one at the feet level every night until eventually they locked that one behind the paywall too. Sorry but I can't pay $12 a month just to access one of the only things that soothes my insomnia during the nightmare that is life right now. For an app that promotes mindfulness this whole offering is pretty absurd.

title: Great for beginners
review: I think headspace is a great way for beginners like myself to start meditating. It Also includes a neat feature to remind you to meditate. I believe meditation should be part of everyone‚Äôs day and routine no matter how hectic your life is, even if it is difficult sometimes. This app helps start meditations and give you the tools to start doing it alone, when you don‚Äôt have any assistance. I‚Äôd recommend it. I mean this honestly, there‚Äôs not a lot of things I‚Äôd genuinely recommend and do so enthusiastically. I won‚Äôt barge it into conversations or anything, but if it comes up, I‚Äôll definitely advise at least checking it out, or trying the free trial.

title: Deleted after mystery plant
review: So I downloaded the app, took a couple of breaths.  Gave them my email...then asked towing up for a membership.  Skipped past.  It made me take more deep breaths.  At this point I realized this is a breathing app.  I‚Äôm pretty sure I already know how to do that, since I‚Äôve been alive for 40 years now.  Next step, mystery plant identification.  Now this sounded fun.  Spent 5 minutes watching someone tell me, in order to identify a plant, look for a sticker or tag on it that says what it is. You can also type in google what features that plant has and maybe google can tell you.  üòÇüòÇüòÇ.  It was at this point I realized that this app is for morons.  Oh in case you don‚Äôt want to pay for this, I can give you some tips.  To prevent chocking while eating.  First try chewing the food with your teeth.  Second, take smaller bites of food at a time.  Lastly, drink water to help wash it down.

title: Absolutely amazing
review: I often have problems with my emotions, sometimes I can laugh hysterically for absolutely no reason, start shouting when someone asks me something . So this problem 1: Most of the time people give me weird looks, thinking I have a mental illness ( which I don‚Äôt, I just have a really short fuse). 2: this makes a lot of stress and anxiety, and most of the time, I can‚Äôt handle the pressure and break. But when I came across this app, I downloaded it right away, I didn‚Äôt know it would work like magic, for one exercise it helped me lower my panic levels and stress. I would give this app 6 stars if I could, I really do love this app.

title: Enjoying this
review:
I have never meditated even though I‚Äôve always thought it would be very good for me. I just didn‚Äôt know how to start. My daughter inspired me to try Headspace and I‚Äôm really loving it. I‚Äôm only on day 5 but by day 2 I was already seeing the benefits and most importantly it seems to be helping me with my sleep. 

The only trouble is is that sometimes I find it hard to navigate. To find the things I had previously used and enjoyed. I wasn‚Äôt really sure where I was supposed to start so I just tried searching through and finding stuff. I do wish there were step by step instructions and maybe there are but I do t know where to look for them.

title: Don't remember a time I felt this calm
review:
I do the meditations during the day when I remember but I listen to the sleepscapes every night to fall asleep and I wake up feeling energized and ready for the day. I don't like the ones voiced by women and some of the guys because I don't find that calming but there are a few really great ones that help me fall asleep 100x faster that if I didn't have it. I recommend this app to everyone it's awesome!

my only issue is that it NEEDS a two-step verification!!!!! someone keeps using my account and i‚Äôm so irritated. please please please add this. i don‚Äôt understand how any platform can not have this available to their users

title: ‚ÄúFree‚Äù
review:
It‚Äôs not fully free, there are only very few courses that are actually free, I mean, the app itself is great (at least the ones I used, which were the only free ones) but if I need something to help me sleep in the middle of the night, it‚Äôs just frustrating because I can only listen to one sleepcast and music over and over again! Honestly, I wouldn‚Äôt mind watching an add to unlock some of the sleepcasts but having to search through endless locked choices to find a free one, and then realizing that there is only one and only one option that you can choose from just does the exact opposite of what this app is trying to do! 

I think what you are trying to do is great, and the app is great in its self, but it caused , me more stress than it helped. I hope you consider some changes to this ‚Äòfree app‚Äô. Thank you

title: Limitless Potential
review:
This app has helped me find a strength and stillness within myself I thought I had permanently lost. On a personal level, it has helped me find peace with myself, those near to me and my work life. On a community level, it has helped me accept people in very different situations and with very different styles and beliefs. On a global level, I believe this app and the wisdom it facilitates can help bring the world to a more understanding and harmonious state. 

I am deeply grateful for everyone who has been involved with headspace‚Äôs development, distribution and all those people using it for any and all of the three levels stated above!

Thank you headspace team!!

title: Best app I've ever purchased
review: I was never someone who could meditate. I've had countless professionals try to guide me through it and figured it was just something I could not do. I  living with PTSD and decided to give this app a try, at the recommendation from a friend who uses the getting back to sleep after a nightmare track. This app saved my life. I am not sure why this works so much better than a professional but I am meditating and can even now meditate without the app playing. The voice brings a sense of calmness, compassion, and safety that I've never felt before. If I could rate higher than 5 stars, I would give as many as I had.

title: Unexpected Wonderful Addition to Life
review: My partner in business introduced this app to me one day when I was very stressed about a topic. He said before we talk let‚Äôs take a second and listen to this. It was day 5 or 6 of the basics. We only meditated awkwardly together for 5 minutes but I was immediately hooked. And now 3 months and over 1700 minutes later I have what will likely be a wonderful new addition to managing life. I really can‚Äôt say enough good about it and would encourage anyone to just try day 1 of the basics. Like a great book, with your thinking mind as the hero, you won‚Äôt be able to put it down. Thank you Andy and the team at Headspace.

title: Thank you Headspace!
review: As a total beginner to meditation, I had no idea what I was getting into or if this would actually help me. This past year with the pandemic and other things recently occurring in my life has send me down a path of feeling very stressed and anxious, letting fear and worry take over my mind. Since beginning my journey of meditation a few weeks ago, I feel much calmer and grounded throughout the day. I feel more hopeful again for the future and feel like I can get past my struggles finally. Thank you at the team from headspace so much! You guys have no idea how much of an impact you are making on the lives of strangers.

title: Grounded
review:
The monthly price is worth the benefits. 
I started 3 days ago,
And mindfulness is not always easy to start alone, nor it is easy to benefit from if you aren't doing it correctly. The mindful trainers that voice over sessions are very calming, providing affirmation after each session and each 10 minute session really does revitalize me. Taking the time to oxygenate the body and exist for a moment in the dense chaotic world we live in is an oasis that can be mastered and I'm ready to continue my journey of mindfulness. As a dental student it seems hard to be not stressed. This app has helped me find peace again and connect to myself as well. 
Thank you!

title: Amazing
review: I haven‚Äôt really tried a whole lot of meditation apps or other things related to that. But headspace has been amazing. I have only been using it for a couple days now but with ought fail a session of ‚ÄúRainy day antiques‚Äù has helped me fall asleep. With school starting and me being way off schedule since we haven‚Äôt really been able to leave the house (Covid-19). It‚Äôs helped me get on schedule and get better sleep. Plus I have been doing daily meditation sessions. By just taking ten minutes out of my day to focus on myself and relax I have been feeling great and even more focused. Headspace has really helped and I‚Äôm glad I got it.

title: Just Love It!
review: I am a senior amateur athlete (age 68) and really appreciate the outstanding service, content quality, and variety of functional areas provided by Headspace.  These features are superb in helping to alleviate stress and improve focus during the current challenges facing the world population.  I especially enjoy the training sessions and the sleep sessions.  I have been challenged for the past 6-10 years with getting a good night‚Äôs sleep; however, I am slowly make progress through multiple, daily meditations; including the soothing music features.  Thank you for continuing to evolve to meet our needs, Headspace!  Keep up the great work!

title: Helps me stay calm and fall asleep
review: Many of us are dealing with anxiety, fear & helplessness during the Covid-19 pandemic. We are flooded with it in the news and on social media, so it‚Äôs always on our minds. It interferes with our sleep and stifles our joy as we miss being with our family & friends. For me, using my Headspace meditation & sleep app helps. I fall asleep each night using the sleep tools. If you haven‚Äôt tried it, you can use many features for free. I get the annual subscription to the full content, but just try it out. If you‚Äôre learning to meditate, Andy‚Äôs soothing voice really helps as he guides you through the various meditation techniques.

title: Astonishing resource
review: Very impressed with the quality of information and teaching in this app. Suffering from chronic stress and worry I feel like I am losing the ability to calm myself. There is just stress and issues to be solved  on all sides. I found this through Chelsea handler life will be the death of me where she interviewed the founder.  I feel like a baby learning the most simple basics here but it is working already. Starting to have a little gap between what my choppy stormy mind is doing and realizing it‚Äôs just a little storm of thoughts that I can pull back from and watch go by. Thank you Headspace. You have done something truly wonderful here.

title: This app has single-handedly changed me as a person
review: I began using Headspace to meditate but it wasn‚Äôt consistent so I didn‚Äôt see the value in it but in the past few months I‚Äôve been using it pretty consistently and there wasn‚Äôt a single moment where I realized it but I‚Äôve just noticed small things like I don‚Äôt get upset on the road anymore or I give myself time in stressful situations instead of giving knee-jerk reactions. These small changes have made all the difference. Is meditating super easy for me now? No. But it‚Äôs gotten easier and the way Andy talks you through it is very soothing. I could not recommend this more!

title: Entirely worth it, this is the best app I have on my phone to date
review: This app has singlehandedly allowed me to get better sleep, become more confident, and relax when I‚Äôm in a stressful situation. However, this is not a ‚Äúmagic‚Äù app. This app teaches you the skills necessary to meditate on your own. It is a ‚Äúteach a man to fish‚Äù par excelance type of app. Through it, I can go to sleep in 2 minutes or less at night, be rejuvenated during my day with a 5-minute meditation, and even call a company for my first ever job interview with a meditation for confidence or anxiety. This app is not able to be encapsulated in one review, but the 5-stars may as well be a given!

title: on everything get this app
review: okay this is like the first review i‚Äôve ever taken the time to write about an app on my phone. headspace hit different for REAL. i started using it in 2018, about three years ago, and it‚Äôs changed my life. like if you dedicate yourself to a daily practice, even of small increments and become aware of some of the changes that begin to take place, you‚Äôll see so many shifts in your own consciousness as well as those around you. it‚Äôs not a miracle fix to every problem, but it soothes out some of the wrinkles of the mind which can really be a nuisance in today‚Äôs world that moves at a breakneck pace.

title: A shoulder to lean on
review:
I love headspace! It‚Äôs simple to queue up, easy to navigate and there when I need it. I started using it to build a meditation practice- it‚Äôs still not a strong habit yet, but it‚Äôs been a helpful tool when I need it! It also doesn‚Äôt bombard me with reminders (and guilt) if I don‚Äôt use it for a while. 

I love the voices on all of the recordings. They‚Äôre casual and comforting while guiding my mind. 

I‚Äôve been getting a lot of use out of the sleepcasts these days to help with restless nights. The app recently redesigned their sleep cast menu- i love that I can easily select between a male or female voice, a choice that is important to some listeners like me.

title: Charged me twice in a week‚Äôs time
userName: just tryin to get some sleep
review:
I subscribed to this app last week at the monthly rate to try it out. Then last night it would not let me access my paid account without ‚Äúsubscribing‚Äù again, but this time charged me the annual amount with no trial time to figure out how to fix the issue. I am infuriated. That definitely doesn‚Äôt help me sleep at night.

Update: after this review their customer service was great about figuring out why that happened. They helped me contact Apple to get a refund for the larger of the two charges. It‚Äôs still frustrating that you can long on so many ways and therefore get charged multiple ways. But I did appreciate the follow up. Just be careful to log on the same way every time.

title: No more premium
review:
Now since this has helped me a lot with insomnia injury stress and getting back to gym and not stressing in math it helps and has good meditation though I have two things I would change. First, I wish they had  a video about coping mechanisms especially since mine is popping parts of my body mainly fingers which most people know isn‚Äôt good for joints. I do symmetrical things with my fingers everyday and it worry‚Äôs  my mom which I wish had a way to change. Second no more premium because I can barely unlock things without it and now the few things unlocked I need PREMIUM to do it. This just raises levels
of stress and is to much money. This just gives me no reason to meditate because I can‚Äôt meditate on what I need to medatate.

title: Healing of meditation
review: Doing mediation everyday has really helped me so much.. I‚Äôm no longer restricted with my negative thoughts and anxiety, but I am now able to free myself from those thoughts and be more at a calm set of mind because of this app. It has helped me realize so many things in my life, that I either had to change or get rid of to make it better and I‚Äôm honestly so happy now and at peace. I‚Äôm only in session 9 of the basics still, but that just shows how much it has helped, there‚Äôs not a feeling out there more peaceful then after meditating, having that clear, calm, and soft state of mind.

title: Super helpful; extremely happy!
review: This is one of the best investments of 2021. As a beginner, I find the instructions very helpful in training the mind to be calm and happy. Even 5-10 minutes of daily practice makes a lot of difference throughout the day.  Of course it takes time to see lasting changes in ones behavior, but I could feel noticeable changes from the first day itself. It is positively impacting my work and personal life. There have been times when I didn‚Äôt trained many days in a row, but then going back to the basics course makes it ever so easier to get back on track. Love the app. Thanks Headspace.

title: Thank you
review: First, if you are considering this app, do yourself a favor and download it.  Whether you were interested in meditation, experiencing depression, need a little nudge in your life, or you‚Äôre in a deep dark place, headspace is an amazing app that anyone can benefit from. I was in a dark depressive place in my life and tried therapy, medication, AA, yoga, church, and everything in between. Some of those things were affective and some weren‚Äôt, but by far and away headspace was the best thing to happen to me. I can‚Äôt recommend it enough, and it is truly amazing what can happen when you truly learn to live in the present. Thank you headspace.

title: Slick but lite weight with a heavy pricetage
review: Headspace does a lot of advertising, I have had depression and anxiety most of my 50 years.  I decided to give it a try.  I thought some of the meditation were very simplistic, and not espcially useful.  The annual supbsription of almost $80 is very high for the quality of the media.  You would be better off looking for professional CD or even podcasts.  Headspace claims to have clinical proof for it's program.  Having a background in healthcare sales I would like to see a professional overview of thier claims.  Just a simple meta-data review by a third party would be useful.  Save your money and look around, for the price of the subscription you can pay less and get much better content.  I think this program was devised for type A people who want to feel like they are doing something for thier mental health.  Serenity Now!

title: It grounds you, and helps you enjoy every minute of life
review: have found this meditation app to be life changing. It is an excellent tool for beginners as it coaches you step by step on how to achieve a state of meditation and stillness. I have found myself to be more aware of my feelings and my responses to them, I am also more aware of the emotions and reactions of those around me. This has helped me increase my emotional intelligence and to better manage interpersonal relationships. In addition, I find myself enjoying the present more than planning for the future. Overall a very worth it application that has made me a more balanced individual.

title: Premium is not what it advertises
review:
I bought the annual premium membership for Headspace recently. I had thought I will get access to all the meditations in the app. But I can only play the 1st session from any meditation course they have. This is a complete disappointment. 
I have now waited for 3 days after sending Headspace an email asking if something is wrong at their end because of which I am unable to access the meditations and I have not received a response. So maybe this company does not have a customer support.
Now that there is no way for me reach Headspace or cancel my membership , I am stuck. So please check out the reviews before you buy a membership with Headspace. 
I will now look out for alternative meditation apps. Hope no one else gets ripped off by Headspace when all we want is some calm in this Covid times.

title: Such a helpful tool
review: I have been using headspace for a couple of years now and it has been such a helpful tool for me. I haven‚Äôt tried a lot of the newer resources, but the daily meditations and meditation packs are so good! I love Andy Puddicome‚Äôs soothing voice and down-to-earth commentary, and how using guided meditation helps me stay on track and integrate meditation as a habit into my daily life. The focus playlists have also been a lifesaver. Kindness‚Äôs playlist is pretty fire. The yearly subscription is expensive but was worth it for me this year in a very stressful job. It‚Äôs the best meditation app of any I‚Äôve tried by a long shot. Highly recommend!

title: Thank you, Headspace!
review: Back in April 2020, I‚Äôve been under quarantine and been seeing my mental health to decline, thanks to repressed memories of accidents and my Dad‚Äôs harsh punishments. (He‚Äôs a jerk, but I still love him.) When commercials for this app started to pop up back in Fall of 2020, I‚Äôve been thinking this is a great idea. Almost a week ago, I downloaded it after I had a troubling time with my homework. I gotta say it really helps. I‚Äôve been feeling slightly better. Andy is a great coach to help me get back into happy Daniel again. Headspace might be my #1 favorite app of all time. 5 stars! Definitely recommended to those whose mental health is on the decline!

title: Coming Back Home 2 Headspace
review:
When I first started Headspace I don‚Äôt recall any videos or animation, only Andy‚Äôs voice. My vision of Andy was of a laid back surfer dude from down under with long bleached blonde curly hair. I drifted away only to come back to fantastic animations, exercise gurus, and a very bald, very big Andy!

I‚Äôm slowly coming out of my pandemic lockdown rut. The 10 week Gratitude series caught my eye, mind, and heart. It never occurred to me to give myself gratitude for all I have survived. This wondrous knowledge being shared on a global level is thrilling to be apart of, allowing me to thrive in ways I never dreamed possible. There‚Äôs gratitude in finding inner peace and so much more.

title: Lost Its Greatest Strength: Simplicity
review:
I‚Äôve used Headspace since 2017, and Andy‚Äôs guidance through many, many meditation sessions has been tremendously helpful to me. 

However, I‚Äôm troubled by the recent trend in the app‚Äôs development towards busyness and garishness. The explosion of sections ‚Äì the focus, the workouts, the sleep stuff, the group meditations, etc ‚Äì and especially the fact that opening the app leads to pop up ads (John Legend is who I‚Äôm seeing right now) and then takes me to an autoplaying video (the current one is about adopting a house plant, which is a ridiculous thing for a meditation app to be offering) has significantly detracted from my experience. What used to be a simple, spacious UX that matched the calming effects of the meditations has started to feel like a Guy Fieri Restaurant in Times Square. I‚Äôm overstimulated, and I can‚Äôt figure out what it‚Äôs trying to feed me, but I know it‚Äôs raising my blood pressure.

The core Headspace offerings ‚Äì guided meditations and animations explaining those meditations ‚Äì are great, and I was happy to put my money down to subscribe to access those. I urge Headspace to do less. Simplify. 

Unless Headspace returns to its simple roots, I will be cancelling my subscription and looking elsewhere for an unadorned meditation app.

title: Amazing amazing amazing!
review: Hands down the most impressive and comprehensive app I have. The amount of new content released on a regular basis, all of which is a hit (at least with me), is incredible and helpful. I look forward in the morning to see what the ‚Äúwake up‚Äù has in store. I am finally starting (excitedly so!) an exercise routine with ‚ÄúMove.‚Äù And I‚Äôve been using the themed mediation sessions for years‚Äîthese sessions have helped me with my mental health by gaining perspective on my thoughts and how to react (or rather, not react) to them, and have been an invaluable tool for when I just want to slow down. Thanks for all the hard work, Headspace!

title: Moments of peace
review: Whether you are looking to build a habit of meditating daily, or need that occasional peace, or just looking for 5 minutes wherever you can, this app has helped me develop and build something I‚Äôve used throughout my day. If I‚Äôm stressed at work I take a second to breath and ground myself using techniques I learned here, I‚Äôve used it to help me fall asleep, and I used it especially after therapy sessions when I need to just love myself. It has been such a useful tool, even though I‚Äôm not regular it encourages me to keep trying to make it more of a u conscious habit. This is a great investment and worth the subscription!

title: 10 min animal clips
review:
THE BEST IDEA YET - love, love, LOVE!! It‚Äôs great because there is no narration, no animals are dying, it‚Äôs just peaceful and takes ZERO brainwork, haha! I wish there was a way to make some of them a little longer because when I am winding down, I have to watch 5-6 clips to get myself tired. But I love the quick break - I get 10 min breaks at work so what a perfect to time them and spend them! PLEASE add more videos!! Love the baby animals... or any of the sleeping animals! Super cool just watch the animals in the wild just ‚Äúbe‚Äù. 
Love this addition, great work!! 

AND THANK YOU FOR MY UPGRADE!!! It‚Äôs nice to see a supportive company when times are anything but!

title: Thank you Headspace for completely changing my life.
review: I never thought of meditation as something I‚Äôd be completely ecstatic talking about, but this app has taught me so much about my own mind and how cluttered and chaotic it often times is. It seems that no situation is too difficult if I just focus on my breath and look up at that blue sky. I owe so much to this app, it‚Äôs made me much happier as an individual and has unknowingly brought happiness to those around me. It has held my hand since day one and continues to teach me how to be present during the most difficult of times. Thank you Headspace for making everyday an amazing one!

title: Resisted but now I‚Äôm here
review: I have known about this app for years and gave into resistance (aka I never got it, came up with many reasons why I didn‚Äôt need it, etc). Then in 2020, everything was lining up and headspace just seemed to be something I was meant to have in my life...man I don‚Äôt regret it one bit. Right now I‚Äôm doing the headspace 365...wow.... that‚Äôs all I can say! This app has allowed me to be aware of my physical body, how to not be mad at the fact that I have thoughts, in fact it has helped me see them with this loving kindness and also allowed me to create more space within my mind. I can‚Äôt recommend this app enough.

title: Headspace deserves 5 stars, the app doesn‚Äôt
review:
I‚Äôll start by saying that the Headspace content is amazing and well worth the price. I‚Äôve been paying annually for three years and it‚Äôs money well spent. With Headspace, the practice of mediation feels accessible and fun. The service itself is 5-stars. 

The apps, however, need refinement on some platforms, in particular iPad OS and Watch OS. The iPad forces the app to play in Portrait only, which means you have to turn your head sideways if you‚Äôre using the iPad‚Äôs Magic Keyboard. Also, videos like Mindful Earth play well in this format. 

I also find the Apple Watch app very disappointing. I‚Äôve tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app, but it only shows a 1 minute Breathe Mini meditation. Shouldn‚Äôt this just relay what‚Äôs available on my phone? I‚Äôd love to use the app to trigger frequently used exercises like Walk in The City or Creative Writing. 

Also, why isn‚Äôt there a TV OS version? Some of the videos like Mindful Earth and Move would play so well on a television displays.

Again, I really love Headspace and I hope that they continue to improve the user experience across all iOS platforms.

title: My daily companion and best friend!
review: I‚Äôve been using Headspace for a few years now, and the app seems to only get better. From the beginning, I fell in love with the beautiful and unique design, as well as its smooth user experience, and wide range of meditation options. I use this app everyday, during many different scenarios, and it‚Äôs seriously helped me to understand meditation better and solidify my practice. I love the meditation courses, the detailed animations, as well as the Sleepcasts that often help me to fall asleep when my mind is restless. I recommend this app to anyone interested in meditating, independently of skill level.

title: Would be five stars, if it wasn‚Äôt for ‚Äúswitching off‚Äù
review: Love this app and all the features and meditations. The sleep casts have been super helpful during this past year. I would give it five stars if it wasn‚Äôt for the wind down exercise of ‚Äúswitching off.‚Äù  That language seems so unhelpful. It‚Äôs not a feeling (like relax or soften), it‚Äôs not a visualization (how do I visualize my legs switching off?  Do they go dark?  Or just look dead?). The word switch is a bit harsh and has a variety of meanings that aren‚Äôt very calm. It‚Äôs really hard to understand how those words were the right choice. And it‚Äôs on so much of the sleep related content!  Other than that, though, I love it all :)

title: Crisis
review: I have heard this word.. over and over and over again.. day to day, all day long. It is starting to affect me mentally, seeping into my core. I feel like the crisis is not just within the outside world but starting to invade me internally. I‚Äôm doing my beat to work out and take walks and realize there is still a world out there. Im trying my best to feel like a good parent and spouse although I cannot work due to being high risk. I am trying. You‚Äôre free trial has really helped me to stay sane and remember the good things this ‚Äúcrisis‚Äù is actually offering. There are no words to describe my gratefulness but in plain english.. Thank you. Truly.

title: Can‚Äôt find anything I need
review:
There‚Äôs no keyword functionality for searching for the thing you need in the app unless you know exactly what it‚Äôs called. The layout is completely non intuitive with all the meditations and music now hidden in the magnifying glass which I would never think to click. The ‚ÄúToday‚Äù tab is...useless. And the meditation tab is redundant given that this app is primarily for...meditation. Yet most of the meditations are hidden now and their categorization makes no sense and there‚Äôs no way to favorite or save your most used functions so you don‚Äôt have to search for them somewhere in the app every time.

This app used to be very simple to navigate and now it‚Äôs almost too frustrating to even use. I get irritated every time I think about opening it which is the opposite of what I need. Trying out peloton instead.

title: Incredible.
review:
I don‚Äôt leave reviews unless I am 100% HAPPY with the app/product. This app has changed my life. It provides a fantastic way to calm your mind and to focus. I also never buy an app until, again, I am SURE of it. Family recommended HeadSpace to me and I was instantly hooked. I had watched/followed along with the Headspace meditation videos on Netflix and was in love with the way it helped me clear my mind. 
If you‚Äôre even considering this, or looking for a way to clear and expand your mind and relationship with yourself, download and consider buying the full experience on headspace. Such an amazing app!

title: This app is life changing!
review: I started out with the Headspace episodes on Netflix and it inspired me to download the app, and it‚Äôs worth every penny! I realized I struggled a lot with insecurities and anxiety but after a few weeks of meditating daily I realized that there were deeper feelings causing those issues. It really helped me discover, cope with, and emotionally evolve to deepen my self love and my relationships with others. I am a more balanced, happier person and a lot of my frequent mood swings and frustrations have lessened dramatically, I am able to let things so easily and be at peace. I most certainly will be a life long meditator thanks to this app!

title: Good But Not Great -  Subscription will not be renewed
review:
Headspace is the first app I downloaded and subscribed to. Its good but not great as I discovered when I downloaded Breethe shortly thereafter. Both apps are similar but Breethe tends to update their material more often. Particularly the sleep casts. Having paid for both, I find myself 9 out of 10 times using Breethe. So I will not be renewing the Headspace app. at the end of the current subscription period. 

Tip for Headspace: Provide new sleep cast stories and get rid of that stupid whisper cast. Its barely audible, which makes it annoying. We can turn the volume down on our end to make any cast lower but that whisper cast does not seem to ever become loud enough.

title: You Want This On Your Phone!
review:
I‚Äôve had Headspace for a few years now and it is one of the most useful apps you‚Äôll ever download to your phone.

Having all of the wisdom in guidance that this company has to offer regarding mental health available in the palm of your hand anytime you need it it‚Äôs a wonderful! Every time I‚Äôm feeling stressed, overcome with anxiety, depressed, unmotivated or overwhelmed I turned to Headspace and by the end of a guided meditation I feel significantly better. It‚Äôs one of those apps where the more you use it the more you get out of it, but it‚Äôs always useful even if you haven‚Äôt meditated in a while.

title: Many options for finding peace
review:
This app will not only help you learn how to meditate, but also why continually educate you why meditation is important in our lives.  

They offer many, many short course which we can all allow time for in our busy lives (as a single mother of two I feel qualified to make that statement), but also many nighttime programs to help you sleep, and many courses to deepen your meditation practice.

I wish the free app had more to offer, but I dived in and bought the annual subscription and I am glad I did so as an investment in me.  Like a gym membership - but better!

title: Get you some!!
review: I‚Äôve been using this app for over 2 years now. I go back and forth between calm app and headspace 2 or more times a day. I love meditation and being aware of myself from head to toe to inner feelings and emotions. I‚Äôve learned to be still for long periods of time and enjoy every moment of it!! I find myself using the techniques throughout the day at different places, in line at the gas station, waiting for my food at fast food stops and just sitting in my car to have time to myself. Thank you Andy for all the help you‚Äôve given me and the rest of the community!! I am truly grateful!!üòä

title: Help within Imperfect Practice
review:
I never write reviews but this app beckons me to at least place a few words affirming its aid in my existence. I am prone to depression, perfectionism, and looking at the past as a template to fix my now and beyond‚ÄΩ Headspace has provided me with valuable tools to better understand my ‚Äúpersonal‚Äù thought processes and how to manage.  With only 10 minutes a day I have noticeably changed. Not saying that I‚Äôm not a works in progress but in spite of the composition of my thoughts I‚Äôm progressing. 

With grace, gentleness, love, and compassion for myself I come back to meditate everyday. Self medicating each day one breath at a time.

title: Completely helpful
review: During quarantine everything becomes more stressful, with Kim Glass and her stress relieving yoga sessions and the male voice of basics, and of course the morning wake up to teach you how to make things easier in the difficult life we live in today. Everything on this app has brought me peace and given me the gift of sleep as well with the sleep casts. I have become more involved in self care which is very important. I recommend this app to anyone but especially beginners like myself who had a distaste for mindfulness in the past, this has changed my perspective and I greatly appreciate it.

title: I love headspace! üß°üßòüèª
review:
I really enjoy using this app, but here are my 
critiques. I wish you could download sleepcasts that would be exorbitantly helpful. I deal with chronic pain so I was exited to see a coarse on pain management upon doing the first few sessions I quickly realized it isn‚Äôt geared towards dealing with chronic pain. I am guessing the people that are going to be doing 30 sessions on pain management are most likely going to be dealing with chronic or longer term pain. I think many people including myself would benefit if you created a coarse designed toward people who suffer with chronic pain. Other than those things headspace is a amazing app and I highly recommend it to anyone.
