title: A gentle guide to mind training
review: I‚Äôve tried many mediations apps and found headspace to be the only app to capture my attention and be a genuine and successful learning tool. They teach you how to meditate step by step, offer courses for any goal or state of mind, have an extensive library of physical exercises and sleep music and an interface that‚Äôs really lovely to look at and interact with. I most love their meditation courses guided by Andy with easy to understand techniques and a clear context and goal for why we meditate. Headspace is like a warm blanket I want to wrap myself into making it easy to turn to first thing in the morning.

title: A better day, bit by bit
review: The headspace app has become a tool to make every day incrementally better. The beginner meditation guidance has helped me to slow down for a little while in the evenings and shake off my work day. The (perfectly boring) sleep stories are excellent for settling down my racing mind if I wake up during the night. And I really love the focus music playlists, especially the low-fi focus beats. I‚Äôm really glad I started using Headspace... it makes my day just a little bit better, which enables me to turn around and be a little bit better to everyone around me.

title: I love this app
review: This app combined with the yoga I do daily has definitely changed the way I process my day. I love the coverage of different common topics they have in the app. The one thing I wish they added was a meditation series for grief. I think all of the anxiety stuff is great and the anger meditation is helpful but grief as a series would be helpful to everyone, because everyone has grieved over something or someone. It also is such a complex emotion that it would have to be a series to work through over the course of several practices. I know it would definitely help me. Keep up the good work! üíõ

title: Healthcare worker
review: This app was offered for free to all healthcare workers at the beginning of the pandemic. I can not express how helpful this app has been to myself and family. It‚Äôs a great resource that can be used through your day. Wether you are ready to start your day, need something to keep you focus or help you wind down at the end of the day, Headspace is all you need. It was created so beautifully and easy to navigate. Everything about it is perfect. I even use it for my little one (2yrs old) at the end of our day. The storytelling feature for kids is a plus. Highly recommend it!!

title: Life Changing!
review: Headspace has literally changed my life. For over a decade I was unable to get into a regular meditation practice b/c I was striving for a blank slate of a mind and feeling like a failure when I couldn‚Äôt do it. These meditation courses taught me that mediation is actually about the practice of turning inward versus about the result, and the guided practice helps me maintain focus. Thanks to Headspace I‚Äôve meditated almost every day for two years now. Meditation led me to realize my drinking was a problem, and I am now 19 months sober. That‚Äôs just one of the many realizations and positive life changes meditation has given me. I‚Äôm so grateful for Headspace.

title: Helped me get control of my life
review: I got this app for free because my school did a partnership with headspace and paid for or memberships. I am so grateful. I have been struggling with anxiety and depression and insomnia and this app has greatly helped me battle that and feel like I am in control of my life, particularly when it comes to sleeping. My only feedback is that I wish it was a little cheaper as I don‚Äôt know how to pay for it when I finish college (but I want to!) and that there were more opportunities for journaling and personal reflection in the app, or at least guided prompts to write about in my own journal. Great app!

title: Got me through the worst time of my life
review: Last year I started using Headspace again after the death of my nephew and also my best friend of 30 years as well. Covid isolationism is hard too. I have been doing meditation for many years and yoga for more. But this app brought me back and guided me through the grief process and all that goes with it. My sleep is improved and I‚Äôm feeling more joy than ever. It‚Äôs worth it if you commit to using it a few times a day or at least daily. I have tried all the mindfulness apps and Headspace and Buddahfy are the very best.

title: I use this app every day!
review: I love the headspace app. I usually use it for getting to sleep but have recently been using it for meditation and movement as well. The sleep music has been a godsend for drowning out my boyfriend‚Äôs snoring; and the sleep casts help me calm my mind, get tired, and fall asleep quickly. I love that some of the sleep music lasts all night that way when my roommates dogs are moving around the house it doesn‚Äôt wake me. The only recommendation I would like to give is to give a last listen to date on the sleep section!! I know it would be beneficial to me because I use it so often!

title: Mental health is important
review: This app has helped me a lot. It‚Äôs not an immediate transition, but you begin to take steps back during the day and realize that your overthinking. The noting technique was what I‚Äôve held onto the most, and taking deep breathes. I mostly use the app to help me sleep. I like to have something to listen to and guide me to relaxation. I definitely recommend this for EVERYONE. My sister was very hesitant, but she has also begun to love it. Mental health is so very important, and in today‚Äôs society it is easy to forget about that. After using this app for a week, I bought it without hesitation. I‚Äôm so happy that I did.

title: Worth every penny
review: I downloaded the app while I was going through a rough mental health patch and looking for a bit of clarity. I was hesitant to subscribe and thought I would just ride the free trial period out and probably delete it afterwards. I did not at all expect the relief that was to follow and have now been using the app for ~ 3 months. It has been an amazing experience from the sleep meditations to the guided SOS sessions like before an interview to the courses that help you create a practice that will last and tailor it uniquely to you. I could not recommend this app enough and am incredibly happy I took the leap.

title: How dare you?
review:
Excuse me? I RARELY ever write reviews but your lack of thinking forced me to write this. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, this app is lovely considering I‚Äôm only using what‚Äôs free and I‚Äôve made do with the little that I had access to but come on- I‚Äôve been using Midnight Launderette to help me sleep because it was the only free night pods and I‚Äôve been using it for MONTHS. 

I come back and all of a sudden it‚Äôs not free anymore? I‚Äôve gotten to used to it and maybe that‚Äôs my fault but I don‚Äôt know how I can use this app again considering the got rid of the best think I was using it for. 

I feel compelled to delete this app. It feels unfair to the people who have used the free features and gotten used to them- only to find out they‚Äôre no longer free. I don‚Äôt know, I am just too upset. Someone respond to this make sense of it.

title: A Wonderful Meditation App for All Levels
review:
I‚Äôve tried a number of different apps to help me with my meditation practice, and Headspace is the best I‚Äôve used. Not only are there meditations to help you address basic mindfulness and meditation practices, but also meditations on mindful eating, anxiety, sleep, and a host of others. Both the male and female voices are calming and helpful with doing the guided meditations. 

The basic courses are particularly helpful for people trying to get into meditation and understand the value of doing meditation. I‚Äôve also been enjoying the Headspace 365 program that provides daily, structured meditation practice.

title: It‚Äôs good but too expensive
review: So I have been using headspace. I have had to do the same session over and over again. I wish that it would be free so I can try all of the sessions without having to pay a ridiculous amount of money. I think that having to pay for an app that helps you to be calm and close to falling asleep. I have issues falling asleep so I got this app but it wasn‚Äôt worth it because I have to pay to use most of it. I am only 14 and I can‚Äôt pay for it. I wish that is were to be free. Instead of having to pay a ridiculous amount of money for an app like this. So don‚Äôt get this app if you don‚Äôt wanna pay for it try and use other things that are free to use or try.

title: Inherent conflict of interest
review:
I like to meditate. I also benefit from the extrinsic motivation of having a daily notification reminding me to meditate, and seeing my streak climb.

But here's the issue. I go somewhere with no signal, and now I can't meditate, according to the app, because I didn't think ahead and pre download ... an audio file containing silence. Kind of nonsense, if you think about it. There goes my 29 days streak.

Next up is the fact that it's pushing some John Legend collaboration? And a hinge collaboration? I have a hard time with this commercialization. Actually, it seems pretty much the opposite of what a mindful interaction with this app should be, to have a modal pop up with an ad telling me to go do some other thing. Not cool.

title: Small habits add up
review:
I have been using headspace for over two years. I love headspace more than other mindfulness apps because of the compelling mini courses, constant innovation (new features such as The Wakeup), and helpful animations. I am also a huge fan of Andy‚Äôs work and background as a monk - I have read his book on meditation (also highly recommend as a booster to using this app).

The app is very user-friendly, and even fun! Meditation through Headspace has changed my life as a young professional to stay mindful of my emotions during work and progressing in my career to clarify moments of stress.

title: I‚Äôve been using this everyday for years
review: I can‚Äôt say enough about how much this app has helped me. I finally switched to the premium membership about a year ago and I highly recommend it, worth every penny. I‚Äôve found it best to pick a time everyday that you can dedicate about 10 minutes to yourself, and complete an exercise on the app. Once you expand your meditation practice, and build the skills Andy teaches you, it will bleed into every aspect of your life. While it can help in a crisis, it‚Äôs most effective if you strengthen your meditation skills to help prevent future mental crisis.

title: It‚Äôs worth the subscription
review: I‚Äôve always been one to want to meditate but never really knew how to go about it and found difficulty finding benefits in meditation until i found this app, I‚Äôve have it for at least a year now and I‚Äôve improved so much both spiritually, mentally, and physically and its so helpful. I honestly can‚Äôt imagine my life without this app cause it is just like therapy but affordable and effective. I‚Äôve also improved a lot with my relationships in my life including my relationship with myself, and I honestly cannot describe how much it has helped me. Thank you

title: Great place to start
review: I have tried to meditate for years, but never could develop a routine. When I found myself anxious and wasting hours on my phone to distract myself, I heard about this app (sounded completely ridiculous to buy an app to use your phone less, but there it is). And from the beginning, the change was immediate. From starting the day, to taking a break, to falling asleep this has been transforming. I finally understand meditating and have a daily morning routine. I‚Äôm not perfect but I can see easy ways to focus and decrease stress dramatically. It‚Äôs worth it!

title: Grounded
review: I have unfortunately been on a divorce journey. Those who‚Äôve been there know the chaos our mind and body endure. Headspace was a lifesaver, and continues to be. Through the guided meditations I was able to sleep again ‚ù§Ô∏è. Starting my day with a meditation has helped me to calm my raising mind, reducing the raging anxiety. I am also a teacher struggling with this Covid culture. It is heartbreaking as well. Headspace has allowed me to put those worries into perspective as well as to share the meditations with my students. Thank you Headspace and Andy, you have helped me, and my students, more than you can imagine.

title: The courses are game changers
review:
I‚Äôm quite impressed with this app. My sister gave me a free month subscription because she‚Äôs been blown away at the transformation she‚Äôs had using it. I‚Äôve historically meditated for 10 minutes with just breath awareness but these specific courses have helped me just after 5 days!
Amidst the pandemic and being pregnant during the winter in New England, I‚Äôve been struggling mentally. Getting this subscription now has been perfect timing before losing my mind. 
SUGGESTION: I wish it was easier for me to get to the courses I‚Äôve started. It took me a couple
Days into the Managing Anxiety course to remember how I got to the course at all. The grey button on the landing page to ‚Äúview course library‚Äù is light grey and easy to miss. I missed it the first few times and then forgot where I had previously seen it the next time I used the app. 

Keep up the great work. As a scrum master and a UX design enthusiast, you make me want to work at Headspace! Love this app.

title: Love being able to share this with the ones I love!
review: Amazing tools to teach mindfulness, meditation and tools to help throughout the day, like the focus music are awesome! Then when you want to go to sleep at night there are tools for that as well! Get into a bad place and need quick help to calm down, there‚Äôs tools for that as well! Headspace has really benefited me in great ways and continues to in ways I didn‚Äôt know it could or that I needed.  It is also awesome that you can share it with your family and it is so adorable! Some the best money I spend all year! Glad to have Headspace.

title: The practice does matter
review: A colleague urged me to try mindfulness through Headspace because it had worked so well for him and I was sharing my own frustrations with my scattered mind with him. That was almost two years ago. I have missed days more than once, but I then do it the next day and the day after that and so on to reset my routine. Now I can feel myself able to stay calmer and to recognize the signs when my mind is running off. I can usually call it back by focusing on my breathing. So it works for me and I feel better. What more could I ask for?

title: Amazing app that can solve any problem
review: This app is awesome. I got my father to download it and he uses it now to deal with stress and work. It has so many different courses for any problem you could have: Anger management, happiness, managing stress, restlessness, basically any problem you have. On top of that, they even have a sleep icon! It comes with relaxing natural sounds, calming music, and sleepcasts, which are like audio documentaries that are VERY relaxing. I use the sleepcasts all the time to go to sleep. They also have some sweet animations and advice that you can watch. It‚Äôs really worth paying for.

title: Love it ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüòçüòç
review:
I love this so much! It‚Äôs the best app ever! Haters back off. I love this so much! Aaahhh I can‚Äôt stop using this app. Ok I will stop saying how much I love this. One suggestion. Can you make more emojis? Thank you other then that I love it.

EDIT: I have been reading reviews and one said Andy is on caffeine before courses and people with accents you can‚Äôt understand. And Kevin Hart? What‚Äôs wrong with him. They block out the bad words. I don‚Äôt see any of this stuff. I still love it it helps me get up in the morning and helps me fall asleep. Still five stars for me.

EDIT: Andy‚Äôs on caffeine?!? How can you tell. Still reading reviews and keep reading the one that says Andy is on caffeine. Before courses. But I still love it still five stars for me. I‚Äôm gonna take a nap and use headspace right now.

EDIT: can you make more emojis/ stickers and more Kevin Hart videos/ energy shots I think that is what they are called. Still love the app idk when I won‚Äôt like the app it is the best. Love it üòç

title: 12/10 recommend
review: I have struggled with insomnia for as long as I can remember as well as panic attack disorder that is mostly prevalent at night. This app has helped me so much with the range of meditations, soundscapes and so much more. I am now falling asleep faster than ever, sleeping through out the night. It truly has helped me to quiet the chatter going on in my daily life to allow me to sleep more soundly. I have recommended this to so many friends and family‚Äîwill continue to do so!  Thank you Headspace for helping me clear my headspace so I can sleep and practice mindfulness with meditations! ‚ô•Ô∏è

title: ITS A NECESSITY
review: Ive learned to filter my thoughts and almost sit back and watch my thoughts and ideas just kind of ride though. I don‚Äôt have thought spirals anymore. I don‚Äôt have as bad anxiety anymore. I have been able to control my mood and what I let affect me or not. I also have become much kinder to myself as well as others. I feel like I‚Äôm able to relax in my body much more. Headspace has gifted me a peaceful mind. It‚Äôs kind of almost like adderal over time because everything just kind of quiets and your brains doesn‚Äôt feel like it‚Äôs running in a hamper wheel over and over.

title: Grit and a Growth Mindset
review: This app makes meditation bite size... it‚Äôs easy to begin meditating because it‚Äôs only just 3 minutes out of my day as soon as I roll out of bed... I know as I make a habit of meditating i feel more and more confident to go longer. I love the cartoon videos... when I think of the meditation message that was shared on how to think of the mind and what‚Äôs going on, I can actually remember the lesson details just because the cartoon was so cute. Thank you Headspace for making my goal to strengthen my brain and thought control easy, it makes me feel accomplished every day. ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Was excited but then...
review: I was really excited to try this but then, after submitting all my info and setting up the schedule, it would only let me access my chosen meditation by activating my 7 day free trial. Some of us are not able to afford a monthly or yearly subscription because keeping a roof over our heads are a little more important right now. It would be great if things like this were actually free with all access unlocked from the beginning. I understand we are all in the business of making money and you can‚Äôt get something for nothing but at the same time, I really want to improve my sleep. 4 hours a night isn‚Äôt working for me so I need something to help me. I can‚Äôt afford this so I guess I‚Äôll try something else.

title: Great lifestyle companion app!
review: I really like this app because it allows me to focus on my process of everyday life. I tend to do too much research on meditation and then I noticed that I never do anything because of the time wasted looking for the best experience. Headspace has everything organized in a way it‚Äôs simple and easy to follow. I love the animations (they make me smile) as well as the ‚Äúwake up‚Äù. I also I like that the app has the exercise courses as ‚Äúday 1-28‚Äù that keep me moving. It would be cool if Headspace could also add yoga videos/courses as well :) but in any case it‚Äôs a great lifestyle companion app!

title: I'm Finally Meditating!
review:
This is a great app that makes mediation so much easier than it has ever been before, whether I tried it on my own, or with a group. Thanks to a newspaper article on Jimmy Fallon that said he used Headspace to help him meditate! When I read that, I knew I had to try it! All my creative juices often keep me from meditating, but with this app, it teaches me how to embrace my thoughts - and breathe. üôè  This is a wonderful, non-judgmental approach to meditation. 
The morning ‚Äúwake up‚Äù videos are great! No matter what time of day I listen to/watch them! So fun to have Kevin Hart talk to me about once a week!! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Headspace helps me so much
review: I joined Headspace about 3 years ago when I was going through some stressful life changes.  I did meditation daily, and continue to do so with good benefits.  Over the past year or two they have added delightful additions to the program which I enjoy so much:  sleep music and return-to-sleep meditations, a daily wake-up video, music to help focus, special meditations to help through the pandemic, meditations for kids, nature videos (wonderful), and more.  I have repeated several of the meditation packs, and honestly do not know what I would do without Headspace.

title: Life changing
review: Headspace has completely changed my life. I‚Äôve had it for quite some time but it wasn‚Äôt until I disciplined myself, starting in late September of 2019, into using it on a regular basis that I‚Äôve been able to unlock its potential. It has completely changed the way I view anxiety (which is the reason I began meditating in the first place), myself, and other people around me. I‚Äôve seen the way it‚Äôs pushed me and forced me to grow in remarkable ways. I am not the same person I used to be when I started using it. I am forever grateful for this appüíï

title: Life changing!
review:
I did not believe in meditation and ‚Äúheadspace‚Äù I have had a very rough last couple of years with family and commitments, let alone pandemic like everyone else. I found myself being very impatient, exhausted and just plain disinterested. I received the email about Headspace offering free to healthcare workers and decided to try it- what could it hurt!?! 
I cannot say enough about the changes in my life, my routine, interactions, health, etc. It was nothing like I thought meditation had to be- makes you comfortable, is informative, real-life advice and support. Just amazing!! Thank you!

title: Thoughts on meditation
review: I was one who was recommended meditation for years but couldn‚Äôt manage to sit down and try and frankly felt frustrated by the suggestion. The pandemic and being furloughed required me to access whatever was available to me to manage my anxiety day to day. Headspace hands down saved/changed my life during these difficult days. It‚Äôs not an easy solution but a slow growth relationship to a presence I have not yet experienced in my life and creates a better me for those I encounter. Finding this relationship is the best gift to come out of the adversity.

title: I wasn‚Äôt a believer but now I am
review:
Prior to the Covid 19 pandemic I had limited personal experience with Meditation. In my counseling practice, I often refer clients to try meditation or mindfulness strategies to support mental health needs. My only personal experience with meditation was through yoga.

I struggled with clearing my thoughts when meditating. Since a colleague shared this resource with me I have grown to enjoy meditation. The Headspace app has provided me with insights, tips and support as I grow in my meditation practice. I‚Äôm grateful to have this tool to support me as I‚Äôm supporting others struggling with mental health needs.

title: Headspace fan!
review: My daughter showed me headspace. When she was at collage playing Rugby, the team would have meditation time together. They would listen to headspace. We started to try it. Now we are hooked! It so fun to see all the new stuff available on the app and it‚Äôs cool to see it on Netflix!! I‚Äôm so grateful that you guys work so hard to provide me a space to help keep my thoughts on track. The part on Netflix about the guy enjoying his cup of coffee, has helped me to recognize that I enjoy my morning routine and cup of tea. Anyways just wanted to say THANK YOU!!! I‚Äôm soooo glad I found headspace!!

title: LOVE THIS APP!!!! - 1 suggestion
review:
I‚Äôve been using headspace for about 2 years now, I used to think meditation was over hyped but once you get into the groove it‚Äôs amazing!! Also, as a college student, I really appreciate that you offer a student discount for headspace premium! 

My only suggestion would be if you made a daily 5min meditation to start the day that was unique for every day! I really enjoy starting my day with a quick meditation and I‚Äôve been using the ‚Äúwaking up‚Äù meditation, but I‚Äôve been using it so long I‚Äôve almost memorized it!!

Keep up the amazing work, I love this app!!!!
developerResponse: {'id': 18926946, 'body': "Thank you for your feedback, we suggest checking out Today's meditation, which changes daily. Feel free to send us a note to help@headspace.com if you have any questions!", 'modified': '2020-11-05T19:55:27Z'}

title: Basic Guides are wonderful!
review: I like how it guides us through daily ‚Äî I‚Äôve surprised myself by sticking to it and realized that I stick to it because I truly enjoy it. I like being able to customize for 3, 5, or 10 minutes (though I usually opt for 10) in case we are running late one day or only have mental energy for a three minute guided session. I think all workplaces should provide the premium version for free for employees like mine does, as I had never tried Headspace before the offer and it has led me to a more productive life in and out of work. Thank you!

title: Wish the subscription wasn‚Äôt as expensive
review:
I love the app. Everything about it. My only complaint is the pricing. 

The subscription is very expensive if you‚Äôre not a student. I kinda understand where your money is going. The app is very high quality. But I just wish it was cheaper so I‚Äôd be able to justify spending the amount of money a normal subscription costs once I‚Äôm not a student anymore. 

But besides that. The app is awesome. Andy does a great job at helping you learn and practice. IMHO this app is better than calm. I‚Äôd rather get my meditation lessons from a monk than LeBron James.

title: Reformed insomniac
review:
It used to take me at least two agonizing, overthinking hours to fall asleep every single night. After the first two weeks of practicing meditating, all I had to do is slap on an eye mask and listen to the Goodnight wind-down, and I'm OUT before the 15 minutes is up.  
The selection of other sleep aids is unparalleled and unique in a way that makes me excited to try out new ones when I have time to take a slower ride into slumber.  
I can't believe I used to live like that. 

Also, their nighttime frog recording ACTUALLY sounds realistic -- this is very rare

title: Premium Review
review:
I work at Starbucks so I get the premium version of this app free.
I had started meditating before I got this app, but this app really took my practice to another level. I‚Äôm starting to take my mental health more and more serious and this is exactly what I needed to guide me in the right direction. 
The different categories in the ‚Äòexplore‚Äô tab are helpful and I really love the animated videos and how they break down things in a simple way for easy understanding ie the ‚Äòmonkey mind‚Äô video.
 I love everything about this app and find myself looking forward to my ‚Äúheadspace‚Äù every day.

title: Head space is amazing!
review: I think head space is amazing, I focus on the sleep part of it and it helps me fall asleep so easily! Whenever you put more new things into the sleep era, I get really really happy. I do have one suggestion though. I think you should add at least one new video to sleep every day. (I have done all of them three times already and I think that will keep me going. I also think it will help a lot of other people that are focusing on the sleep era. Thank you for taking your time to read this and I hope you do what I suggested. Bye!

title: Approachable & Realistic way to learn meditation
review: I‚Äôve been using headspace for maybe a little over a year- off and on, here and there. Whether I‚Äôm having a hard day at work, feeling anxiety wrapping around me, or unable to sleep headspace has helped me learn to take little moments of mindfulness. It has also helped me learn to notice mindful moments throughout my day where I wouldn‚Äôt have previously noticed them. I recommend the app to all my friends, whether they‚Äôve never meditated or have been doing it for a long time it‚Äôs an super approachable and helpful tool.

title: Great App for All Your Well-Being Needs
review:
My company paid for a one year subscription (COVID). I really enjoy the mindful workouts included in this app. It makes working out more about health and well-being rather than aesthetics. In my opinion it‚Äôs better than having your workouts on You Tube with all your other distracting videos. I‚Äôve explored new lofi-beats in this app and very much enjoy them. I‚Äôm still enjoying exploring all the features and figuring out ways to include them in my everyday.

In the future, I can see myself paying for this app myself.

title: An accessible way to start meditating without feeling bad at it
review:
I‚Äôve tried multiple attempts at meditating in the past and the feeling that I should immediately be better at it, or more intuitively sink into it, made me quit before I barely got started. Sure, that was all in my head, but isn‚Äôt that the point? 
Headspace lays out your concerns and reminds you they are normal all throughout their courses. The concepts, practices, and reasons behind them are laid out in clear and concise ways, without ever feeling talked down to. I‚Äôve extremely grateful to have this app.

title: I LOVE this app. Some usability/UX issues
review: Great app. The content is excellent, the illustrations, visual design, and overall production is top quality. As a UX Research & Strategy professional I'd love to point product designers to Headspace as an example of great design, but it needs to address some important usability issues such as discoverability of courses and expert guidance clips. In general, the content needs a better organization strategy based on user research. The counter of hours meditated is too abstract to consider it meaningful for the user. A visual of the stats of individual progress overtime may be more valuable. I hope they bring more UX Research expertise to the core team!

title: Just so it
review: Been doing headspace for about two years. Started it during the early days of a divorce. It helped me keep a clear and calm head. With discipline it becomes an amazing skill and something you do for yourself that improves the quality of your life in every area. It‚Äôs simple to use and never ever harsh or judgemental or anything. All about calm and betterment - often when you need it most. Takes discipline at first to do regularly, but after 30 days it becomes automatic and you look FORWARD to it!  Good luck and just jump in. Do something for YOU.

title: Headspace has changed my life
review: I‚Äôm a student and saw an ad for headspace being only $10 a year!!! i was blown away‚Äî as a budget yearning and pretty emotionally naive being, i got it. This app was what helped me see that I needed to reach out and talk to a therapist and then later get on medication. It‚Äôs been a part of my daily and nightly routine for over a year. I love love love this app so much!! It‚Äôs so insightful and really creates such an amazing space in life within a 5-20 min mediation. If your looking for something to help you be more conscious, aware and present in your life, this is a must have app!!!

title: Grateful
review: As a mental health professional by vocation and a person who is continuing to work during this global crisis, I‚Äôm deeply appreciative that Headspace has been a grounding, centering part of my morning routine. I‚Äôm beginning to branch more into other meditations than the basics, and finding them challenging in very fruitful ways. It has also been helpful in bringing me back to old practices which I haven‚Äôt really engaged in with any degree of discipline in the last 7-8 years. Thank you Headspace for being such a blessing to myself and many others, especially during this time.

title: Calms Me Down
review:
Presently my wife was taken physically from me.  She was rushed to the hospital.  And now she was transferred to a nursing facility.  There she will be staying forevermore. Her illnesses will not allow her to come home.

We are married for 17 happy years.  And now I am alone.  Every day of our marriage was like a fairytale. Love abounded because we truly found each other at later in our lives. I remember my son telling me that if I didn‚Äôt ask her to marry me....he would never come to visit me.  He said that he had never seen me smile so much in the 22 years I was alone.  So the rest is history.  Never have I felt so fantastic.

Now I have an empty home.  When I wake up in the morning I turn to kiss her.  But I kiss her pillow instead.  And because of the virus we are not able to see each other.

So your meditation program has helped me to cope.  My daughter has been helping me to meditate as she does.  So thankful I have this to calm me down.  üôèüèæ

title: Life Changing
review:
- User of about 17 months
The daily meditations provide helpful insight on how to the train the mind. I feel like I learn a different life lesson everyday. In the past year, I‚Äôve noticed that my anxiety has decreased tenfold. With different courses such as anxiety, focus and anger to help improve your own mental weaknesses. When an anxious thought pops in my head, I let it go almost instantaneously. It‚Äôs almost automatic at this point. Of course, a few anxious thoughts tend to stay longer than others. But this is the meditation journey itself. Next step, not acting on my anger!!

title: Great!
review:
I‚Äôve been using Headspace for over 6 years now and the app has become more and more developed through the years.  The animations are great and have really educated me on what meditation is truly about.  I went into meditation thinking one thing but learning something completely different.  
Also, I sent in a suggestion a few years ago and they actually included it.  I thought that was awesome.  I haven‚Äôt tried any other apps so I can‚Äôt really compare.  I‚Äôve just been so happy with Headspace I didn‚Äôt see the need to try anything else.

title: Changed my life
review:
This app is so easy and fun to use that it feels like a game when you start. It‚Äôs the perfect introduction to a lot of deep topics. It covers topics such as happiness, focus, depression, relationships, and anger to name a few. It helps you have way healthier relationship to your mind and your emotions. Such a worthwhile investment, this is amazing.
If you are searching for some more clarity or peace in your life. Take the time to sit down with yourself. I‚Äôve been using this app for over 4 years now, almost daily, and by god it is the best money I have ever spent. Hands down, bar none.

title: A person with everyday struggles
review: Headspace is an amazing app because it offers a clear and direct instructor taking you through the meditation. My own mental health has had its up and downs but through headspace I have been able to see my thoughts for what they are, thoughts. I would love however to see headspace add a section for college students. College for me so far has personally been one of the most confusing and amazing times of my life. However, having a college section on the app would be so helpful, especially what‚Äôs going on today.

title: Lifesaver. Literally.
review:
I started using Headspace a couple of months ago after learning of their offer for furloughed/laid-off workers. I usually sleep every other night; that has always been very typical for me. Between so. many. other. things. going on, I was at my breaking point.

I cannot praise this app enough!
First of all, THANK YOU for extending that to those of us who were furloughed, etc. So generous! Even if I didn‚Äôt like the app, I‚Äôd still leave a positive review because that is just so kind of you to do.
But even better... I actually sleep more than I did prior to using HS! I love the sleepcasts the most. Having that many options to choose from means  that there is a voice or atmosphere for every mood! Brilliant!
The app has not crashed on me once. Not once. I don‚Äôt remember the last time I could say that. Lol. 

I will 100% renew when my year is up. Absolutely no doubt about that!!

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

title: Amazing
review: I‚Äôve never really been one to even think of meditation until my father suggested trying it to help with my lack of focus and sense of self. Before I really started meditation I felt as though I was just sort of going through the motions of day to day life, not really noticing much and just kind of stuck in my own head. Meditation has taught me that regardless of how you may feel in the moment things can and will get better and that you should enjoy and be present with everything you do. 10/10 would recommend to a friend.

title: To many things are locked
review: As you can see from the title there are way to many things that are locked and it‚Äôs kind of annoying. I know that you guys want to get the money for the trails but I don‚Äôt think you should have that many things locked. When I try to go to sleep and find one there is only 4 things I can choose from so I have to keep on replaying them each night. It helps me sleep I just really think you should unlock some other things so the people who are stressed and don‚Äôt have the money can still use this app and have a lot of choices. It‚Äôs a really good app though.

title: Excellent Meditation App, But Needs Proper iPad Pro Version
review: I love this application, and on my iPhone it‚Äôs beautiful. But, on my iPad Pro, it‚Äôs just a scaled up version of the iPhone app, and an app of this quality deserves a proper iPad Pro version, complete with landscape support. I want to be able to use this on the go (iPhone) as much as at home/work (where the iPad Pro is my daily computer). Please consider making a beautiful, fully functional (landscape, multitasking, split view/side view, etc.) iPad app. Thank you, otherwise this app is amazing and I recommend it everyone for cultivating more mindfulness/awareness and equanimity into their practice.

title: Overlooked
review:
Today across the healthcare organization I work at, we received an e-mail regarding the awesome offer from you to use headspace through 2020. As a long term headspace user, I was so happy to hear you offering such an amazing offer when it‚Äôs most needed.
Unfortunately, I am greatly disappointed that the offer excludes SO many workers in healthcare that have an ESSENTIAL job, even if they aren‚Äôt doctors or nurses. You have excluded workers who are putting tremendous amounts of effort and risking exposure in the frontlines such as administrative staff, environmental service workers who are cleaning and sanitizing rooms, nutrition services and many more. Even without a medical degree, these workers are helping in greatly overlooked ways to ensure we all make it through this pandemic. All these individuals could too, use some head space.

title: Cost
review: Don‚Äôt let the cost of this deter you. (I have literally no affiliation with headspace professionally or incentive to market for them). If you pay for a gym membership or bought your self a set of select-tech weights for your home gym then you have paid significantly more money then what Headspace is asking for. This app is a tool that can help you strengthen your mind and find peace. $13/mo. Or $80/year is a killer deal. You are funding the ability for the people at headspace to continue making this tool better for YOU! Make your money worth something more!

title: Very Calming and Educational
review: I Headspace has taught me how meditate and has become an important part of my mental health. It‚Äôs taught me a lot about how to approach my thoughts and has helped to improve my overall outlook. I highly recommend Headspace and wish they would use it in schools to teach kids how to meditate. downloaded this app to learn to calm myself through meditation. What I got was an app that not only teaches me to meditate but it‚Äôs become a useful tool for reinforcing my positive mental health. I highly recommend this app for everyone. You‚Äôll get the most benefit if you keep an open mind.

title: Wow, this app is amazing!
review: I am currently a healthcare professional working during the COVID pandemic. I am so thankful they have made this available and accessible to those of us working in healthcare. It has been a dream to help me go to sleep at night and to cherish moments of calm. I have taken a meditation class before and having this as a tool has been so so helpful. I plan on continuing using this app when all this is over because I‚Äôve never had anything that helped me fall asleep so easily. Thank you for taking care of us during this crazy and chaotic time!

title: Changed my life!
review: I‚Äôve struggled with anxiety for 20 years and have always had trouble sleeping because of it. Whether it was falling asleep or waking up in the middle of the night, my anxiety made it extremely difficult to shut my brain off and just sleep. This app has changed my life! I utilize the sleep casts and other exercises every single night and I sleep soundlessly. If I do wake up in the middle of the night anxious, the app has helped me learn how to combat those busy thoughts. So grateful for this app and how it had taught me to overcome my sleep problems.

title: If you start your day with a meditation session, it will set the tone for the rest of your day.
review:
I contrasted my prior anxiety-filled day with the day I did a meditation session in the morning. I feel like it made a huge difference in the quality of my day. 
Remember that meditation is not something that you do just for a time block out of your day, it‚Äôs something that you carry with you into your day with a positive quality of mind.
Of course, when you choose to meditate is totally up to you. Find what works for you: your individual recipe.

title: Life changer
review:
I rarely write reviews but it‚Äôs high time I write one for Headspace. 
I laughed at the thought of meditating some years back, the thought of sitting still in silence sounded like a bit of a joke.
Almost 4000 minutes of meditation with Headspace later and I‚Äôm a completely different person.
I can honestly say as my meditation has progressed so has my income, peace of mind, lowered anxiety, depression and has even helped me reach higher fitness levels believe it or not. Extremely grateful to headspace and all those involved. You changed my life for the better!!

title: Changed my life!
review:
Buying the premium subscription has literally changed my life. I now notice ‚ÄúI‚Äôm beginning to feel stress‚Äù and can decide how to respond instead of being stressed but not really noticing or addressing it until I‚Äôm completely stressed out. 

462 day streak and counting! Often I will only do a 3 minute meditation. I know that I can always at least find 3 minutes in my day to sit still and even that small amount adds up over time and really helps. When I have the time I‚Äôll do 10-20 minute sessions. 

Strongly recommend!

title: The app is amazing!
review: I will say 5 reasons why headspace is so good. 1 after a long day all I have to do is go on the app and relax. 2 you can do meditation to sleep and focus. 3 For a app to help you relax this is the best one I found. 4 If your a very stressed person all you have to do is download this app that is for all ages and enjoy relaxing. 5 The last reason why I think this app is amazing is because it really helps and I get reminders to meditate. Also the app gives nice positive words throughout the day. These 5 reasons is why I think headspace is a amazing app.

title: Peace
review:
I‚Äôve been using headspace for about five years or almost 25,000 minutes. Headspace meditation practice has helped me develop a third eye where I‚Äôm able to look at myself objectively and question certain behaviors that are compulsive. This allows me more consciousness of those behaviors and a an opportunity to make better choices which allows for a more tranquil and peaceful existence. Currently, I‚Äôm trying to practice having a beginners mind so I‚Äôm not so distressed by the news and advertising cacophony on mass media. Thank you to all the folks at Headspace.
Joe

title: improving user experience
review: I use Headspace all the time and I love both the app and the interface; however in order to improve the user experience I think it would be in the best interest of users if the app could add capability for Airplay so that workouts could be streamed on Apple TV or music could be streamed on HomePod. Additionally adding a dedicated Headspace app for Apple TV would be amazing for the times when I‚Äôm looking for mindfulness without the distractions. Lastly if there were a way to view an archive of the daily wake ups, that would improve the user experience even more. Thanks for the great app headspace!

title: Fantastic coping!!!
review: I started using Headspace at the beginning of the pandemic. I had never been able to successfully meditate before. This app made it so easy with lots of options for how long, various topics, teaching techniques, I‚Äôve learned so much! I went from meditating 10 minutes a couple times a week to mediating 15-20 minutes every day for over 8 months straight! I highly recommend this app to anyone wanting to learn to relax, deal with stress or other difficult feelings, become more aware & present in life, live more fully.

title: Bring back sleep meditation!
review: I use the free meditations as I can‚Äôt afford a subscription atm. I‚Äôve used the sleep meditation for months and it‚Äôs become a bit of a necessity. They‚Äôve now taken it off the free options. I just think it‚Äôs a bummer to become so heavily dependent on something as a tool for my insomnia to have it held hostage. I‚Äôve always loved this app and it‚Äôs helped me so much for my mental health but it seems so corporate and cold to cut someone off from something so important so their treatment. Especially when some (myself included) already pay an arm and a leg to treat their mental illnesses through the American healthcare system. I‚Äôd say use what‚Äôs free while you still can.

title: Open minded
review: This app lets you take so many different approaches to meditation. There‚Äôs no right or wrong way to meditate. I never write reviews, I always look at that. But I wanted to take the time to write a review, because when I do use this app for meditation, it helps my brain feel so much calmer and clear. It‚Äôs relaxing and rejuvenating at the same time. If this is your first time trying meditation, try the free version. If you‚Äôre looking to progress your meditation magical super human powers, I recommend getting the premium version, I think it‚Äôs worth it.

title: Great way to learn about meditation.
review:
After the this app has really helped me to learn about meditation and myself. I enjoy using this app every day in the morning to start my day. Definitely give this one a try if you‚Äôre looking for a guided meditation. daily stressors of life have taken a toll, Headspace has allowed me to regain a sense of self. The app is easy to use and explains meditation in a user friendly way. The short cartoon sketches, show what we can expect from meditation and our minds. 
I would recommend this to anyone who wants to begin meditation.

title: Good content, but homepage page is anxiety inducing
review: I love the meditations and my life is better for them. However the homepage is too chaotic! My adhd brain can‚Äôt handle that much stimuli, it‚Äôs giving far more info than you need. I wish there were a more clear separation between the types of content they offer, with individual homepages for each option (as opposed to a homepage with all of them crammed into one. Why is the fitness on the same level as a video of somebody making candles?? I just want a level 1 guided meditation sheesh) I won‚Äôt lie: i find myself using the app less because of this chaos!

title: Ongoing issues
review: I love headspace because it‚Äôs really helped me with anxiety and stress. There‚Äôs one BIG issue though. I‚Äôve been using headspace for about a year and a half and there‚Äôs been 3 different times since then where I‚Äôve logged into my account and it logged me out for whatever reason and tells me that there was a problem and they had to log me out. This doesn‚Äôt seem like a big issue but it has messed up my subscriptions. I‚Äôll pay for a year and get the billing then it will say I‚Äôm on a monthly subscription and try to charge me for every month. This is very frustrating and shouldn‚Äôt be an ongoing issue I have to deal with. I haven‚Äôt tried any other meditation apps but I would highly recommend looking into others before using this one.
developerResponse: {'id': 19655118, 'body': 'Sorry about the trouble with accessing your original account, it sounds like you may have a duplicate account. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we can further assist.', 'modified': '2020-12-09T20:51:18Z'}

title: 100% Worth It
review: This app exceeded my already high expectations. I tried out premium and I would definitely recommend. The options are limitless and there is a a topic that fits every situation you may be in. There are short and long options for whether or not you are under a time crunch. There are also just clamming nature videos for when u don‚Äôt necessarily want to meditate, but you need some calm and focus. There are workout and yoga for when you want more body awareness. There is still more that I am still yet to discover!

title: Encouraging
review:
I‚Äôve subscribed to Headspace for several years. I‚Äôm ‚Äúnot good‚Äù about meditating; I‚Äôll go months without it even though I know it‚Äôs helpful when I do meditate.  Even so, the messages and mindfulness are enduring. 

One of the features I really appreciate are the encouraging notes that come through every day. They‚Äôre so low pressure; there‚Äôs nothing about the notes that make me feel guilty - rather, they‚Äôre just an additional benefit. I do find value in the messages. 

Another helpful feature are the sleep sounds. The 8 hour ones are especially helpful to me overnight. I‚Äôd love it if they‚Äôd develop more 8 hour ones.

Today, I had a date to meditate with my friend. This year we‚Äôre an ocean away from each other. We both feel the loss and we‚Äôre both having some trying times. Our shared meditation was a really positive expression of our connection. 

I absolutely recommend Headspace.

title: Absolutely love except this!
review:
Headspace is my fav app for picking up motivation and i also like the exercise videos. But my absolute fav part of the Headspace is the Sleepcasts. I sometimes i struggle with insomnia so they help me sleep.
I would love however, if a fast forward button or something was implemented because I like to browse the sleepcasts and wish I could just skip the breathing exercises and get to the stories. Also, because there is no way for me to rewind the story alittle, there is only an option to completely restart the entire thing:(

title: Pretty good but...
review:
The app is pretty good and has lots of cool content. However, I found that I don‚Äôt use that much and I didn‚Äôt want to pay the almost $100 fee to access it. Of course I forgot to cancel the subscription and was automatically charged for it. Now I‚Äôve been trying to talk to someone to cancel it but the emails seem to go to a black hole. If you are counting on getting any sort of customer service don‚Äôt subscribe. They don‚Äôt answer to emails or offer an alternative method to contact them. (I‚Äôm trying to post here to maybe catch someone‚Äôs attention)
Note: there‚Äôs all the talk about being aware of your breath and letting things go. I wonder if that‚Äôs what they are expecting me to do...meditate until I forget that I‚Äôm $100 short for a product I don‚Äôt use.
developerResponse: {'id': 13273976, 'body': "We're so sorry for the trouble with canceling your subscription. We have been seeing higher than normal volume, but we're answering requests in the order in which we receive them. You should receive a response shortly. Thank you for your patience. ", 'modified': '2020-02-03T21:33:32Z'}

title: Relaxing
review: Rather than take you through complicated ways to think and move too fast, this app meets you where you‚Äôre at and provides beginners courses for techniques then treats it as a mindfulness journey. They introduce mechanisms and techniques that you can practice on your own, at work, at school, or on the bus. And their sleep aids are wonderfully relaxing, and don‚Äôt cause you to be too conscious of falling asleep. It with every night, without fail. I love this app so much! And, by the way, definitely worth it to subscribe to premium. Thank you, Headspace!!!!

title: Miss the old headspace
review: I feel like Headspace has gotten away from its core purpose - to help me meditate. I almost feel stressed trying to use the app anymore, which I find ironic. You used to be able to just go into the app and meditate. Now I have to filter through tons and tons of other content (workouts now!?) just to do the thing this app was designed for. I like the different kinds of meditations for different situations, and some of the learning tools are good, but the developer has gotten distracted from its core business imo. It feels like they fell into the trap of trying to grow at all costs and forgetting the simple concepts that made it great to begin with.

title: Really wants to nag you
review:
As a meditation app Headspace is awesome! I love the variety of mediations, animations, sleep scapes, and more!

But almost every day I open it, it pops up a request for me to turn on notifications for something - notifications for bedtime, notifications for meditations, notifications for mindful moments...

I don‚Äôt want these. I have them all off for a reason. Having more things on my phone alerting me all day long isn‚Äôt going to help me relax. I‚Äôm fine if you tell me once, but why do you keep nagging me to let you nag me more? Why can‚Äôt you take ‚Äúno‚Äù for an answer? I‚Äôm already paying for an annual subscription, what more do you want from me?
developerResponse: {'id': 16226996, 'body': "Thank you for your feedback! We'll make sure that it's seen by the right team for review.", 'modified': '2020-06-26T00:37:32Z'}

title: Life changing!
review: I never thought I would be a meditator, but headspace has changed my life. I truly mean this, it takes a while but you will thank yourself. I am not someone who normally pays for subscriptions, but if there was one subscription I could pay for, this is it. I am so impressed by all the coaches, and even the free version is amazing! You can tell the creators aren‚Äôt trying to make a quick buck, they really care about you. I love the wake up and all the mindful moves. Thank you to everyone at headspace! I am forever grateful!

title: Meditated for years and this is still so helpful
review:
This app helped me to easily build a meditation routine. There are live group meditations, lots of topics, even short meditations that tell you
What ages are appropriate. Thank you Andy and headspace. You are doing a great service to the world. Happy to pay for my membership.

-one month update... after meditating for several years here and there nothing has been able to make me stick to meditating like
This app. There are specific courses for what you need personally. It‚Äôs helped me quit smoking, get better sleep, and I like it so much that I do it 2-3 times per day. Always in the morning after I get up and walk my dog.
And most evenings too. There are even quick ones I can do at work on short breaks to re-center. Blown away by the app and I literally feel calm now in nearly any situation after a few deep breathes. Can‚Äôt say enough about this app!

title: Unethical dark patterns to keep you paying
review: Make sure you only use the App Store for subscription if you pay for anything. Otherwise the only emails you‚Äôll ever get from Headspace will be the typical marketing and survey emails all software companies send and the email receipt for the automatic charge after they collect your money. They will never (ever) send you an upcoming renewal warning (but Apple‚Äôs App Store will if you pay through them ‚Äì because Apple is ethical about that sort of thing). When you go to cancel the subscription, they attempt to hide the ‚Äúcancel auto-renewal‚Äù link by setting it apart from other links on the account page and making it low-contrast gray (all other links are dark orange on the page).

title: Good App, one small suggestion
review:
I love this app, I‚Äôve been a subscriber for 2 years. I like the variety of options. The sleep casts are so useful. 

One thing that could make it better is if I could bookmark sessions. Sometimes I find one that I know would be helpful at a different time or that I had been looking for last time but doesn‚Äôt fit my current needs. It would be nice if I could bookmark them or something. I know I can download them but I don‚Äôt have enough memory space on my phone for that. Thanks!

title: Needs new Sleep material
review: So I‚Äôve paid for the app, I‚Äôve been using it for almost a year. I like it, I recommend it to everybody. But it‚Äôs kind of a bummer because they never update the sleep options. And the wind downs are SO similar to one another it gets frustrating. Same with the SOS meditations. They both get old after a while. I realize, it‚Äôs meditation, which theoretically I could do myself. But I bought the app to help keep me on track. So when it feels like the only new thing is the daily meditation which always ends in ‚Äúopen your eyes‚Äù it feels like a bit of a high price for nothing new month after month. I wish there was more variety. Please add some new sleep wind downs and new SOS meditations.
developerResponse: {'id': 17169854, 'body': "Thank you for your review regarding the Sleep content we currently offer, we'll be sure to pass along your feedback to our teams! Feel free to send us a note to help@headspace.com with any questions you might have.", 'modified': '2020-08-09T20:34:03Z'}

title: Engaged and Indebted
review: This is a great compliment to Headspace and also my mom who introduced me to this app with a subscription almost three years ago. I did meditate in college but since I‚Äôve lost my marriage, I needed to focus more on myself and this is such an easy way to do that daily practice until I have more time on my hands after my second wedding! So thank you for the money videos because they‚Äôve got me thinking through my purchases right now and why I feel so dejected after losing my job this year.

title: Life changing!
review: Andy, thank you so much for creating the Headspace app!  Incorporating daily meditation since the beginning of 2020 has been truly life changing for me.  I continue to learn how to observe my thoughts/feelings without judgment, which has served me really well in real-life situations.  For someone who has always been a perfectionist, daily meditation has shown me that I am a work in progress (which is totally A-OKA) and perfection is merely an unattainable illusion.  I can‚Äôt wait to see how my meditation journey unfolds over the next year.  Thank you so much!!

title: A better version for the iPad PLEASE!
review:
I absolutely love Headspace! I‚Äôve had it on my phone for years and it‚Äôs been so helpful in so many lovely ways. I just recently got an iPad and was a little shocked to find that the app isn‚Äôt quite as nice on the iPad as it is on the iPhone.

 I know it‚Äôs so small, but I use my iPad primarily in landscape mode. I have a keyboard case that makes turning it vertical a pain. I would love if Headspace had an iPadOS - friendly version that supported different screen orientations. 

Other than that, I wouldn‚Äôt change a thing! Keep on keeping on, y‚Äôall!
developerResponse: {'id': 19761696, 'body': "Thank you for your feedback, we'll be sure to pass this along to our team! If you have any other suggestions or questions, feel free to send us a note to help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2020-12-14T20:28:28Z'}

title: Best app for these troubling times
review: I get this app for free through work, and I have to say... if it wasn‚Äôt able to, I STILL would pay for it. This app has incredible resources. There are so many meditations. It helps me so much with my anxiety, and occasional insomnia. When I‚Äôm desperate to calm myself down, I turn to this app. The voices are soothing. The content and quality of what this app offers really can‚Äôt compare. I really think everyone needs to at least try this app out because in these times we need it more than ever!

title: Silence at Last
review: I have adult ADD. For years I‚Äôve medicated myself within inches of my sanity just trying to get a little peace and  quiet in my mind. Spent hundreds of dollars on everything from prescribed medication to legal cannabis products. Nothing works. Then I started using the headspace app. All I need is f15 minutes in the morning and fifteen at night and I‚Äôm good for the whole day. I get so much done and can genuinely enjoy being around people because I can keep up with the conversations. Don‚Äôt waste your money on drugs, get a little headspacez

title: Great app...1 flaw
review:
This is a great app for if you are really just feeling like you have enouph time to listen to one recording and being in a comphy space. I really like it because you can choose the person who talks to you and you just get that ‚Äú im free‚Äù sensation....its great!

One thing that makes me mad is that it always asks me for the pro version and i am not allowed to pay money for apps so it is really anoying my parents when i am with them and it asks me if i want to pay...but overall great app and all my friends lobe it too

title: Fantastic
review:
This app is truly wonderful for beginners and for more experienced meditators, too. There are many ways you can use the app‚Äîfor sleep, for meditation, for exercise, etc.‚Äîbut it still feels refreshingly and reassuringly simple if you only want to use it for one of those things. As a Buddhist, I feel that the meditations do a good job of embracing the very simple foundations of Buddhist meditation and mindfulness, yet without naming it as Buddhist or of any other tradition, and yet without contorting the practices into something they‚Äôre not. 

Good, all around.

title: So amazing!
review:
I love this app and everything they‚Äôve done for healthcare workers during the pandemic. It‚Äôs been a lifesaver to listen, breathe, and process everything that is happening!

My only wish is that you could put things in a ‚Äúqueue‚Äù because often times I‚Äôm drifting to sleep or not sleeping soundly yet when a sleep story ends and the abrupt stopping of sound wakes me again. It would be perfect if you could queue up some sleep music or a sound scape after a sleep story ends!

Overall, I highly recommend this app!

title: Payment
review: I have such bad anxiety and having trouble keeping myself content and in control throughout the day. I make my life a living hell everyday because I can‚Äôt focus long enough, control my anxiety, be active, OR focus on my mind and body. The first few sessions, I felt amazed at it. But I am unable to get a job (due to recent move to Canada) and am unable to purchase the sessions on this app. I would make it 5 star, but it only provides 2 sessions before you have to pay. Does anyone else know where to get an app similar to this that doesn‚Äôt require payment to help me?

title: MUST HAVE A TRIAL TO ENJOY
review:
The review I read was clearly I paid review. It really bothers me because I read it and was excited to finally find something of quality I didn‚Äôt have to pay or sign up for. I downloaded and immediately you have to make an account. After doing that it shows you all the features however they all have locks on them. When you click on the lock you are prompted to start a trial. I just downloaded brain wave tuner and used that because it is free and it put me right to bed. That is no endorsement I‚Äôve used it in the past got a new phone so thought I would dry something new. Well back to the old and reliable for me. 

P.s I rarely write reviews I just don‚Äôt like when people deceive and waste time.

title: Love this exercise
review: At the beginning of the year, I started my journey with the headspace guide to meditation on Netflix, watching an episode a day. I‚Äôve quickly gone up to doing two short and one long sessions a day and have seen improvements in so many areas of my life. I feel less stressed, less anxious and more accepting. My relationships with the people in my life are much better. I feel better rested and more energized. I have to say, headspace has improved my life in ways I did not even expect to have happen.

title: Good, but a little repetitive
review: I like that you can adjust the length of the meditation, and sometimes which teacher it is. The only thing is every meditation is the same. Only the little thought of the day at the beginning of each meditation changes from day to day, then your 10 min of meditation is exactly the same. I would like it better if they had you visualize different things or referred back to what the message of the day was in some way. But I‚Äôve used the app every day for almost a year, so it‚Äôs at least easy to be consistent.

title: Amazing
review: I have tried, over the years to start a meditation program but was not able to find something that was well organized with an easy path to follow. Son plays college sports and has been exposed to several different meditation programs as a way to boost performance. He recommended Headspace as a great option for getting started with meditation. After spending the last week committing to it daily, I can confidently say that he was right. Highly recommend the pay version of Headspace! A++++

title: Amazing
review: I was introduced by my membership with WW. I was having so much trouble with getting and staying asleep. Headspace has totally transformed that. The night stories are amazingly calming and I never get past the first five minutes without falling into a deep slumber. I am even now able to go right back to sleep if I should need to get up to use the bathroom during the night.  I so much look forward to it until my body starts relaxing the minute I pick up my phone to listen. I am so happy. Thanks so much.

title: Good Mediation App - Good Business Value
review:
Headspace is a good meditation app.
That‚Äôs why it is so highly rated again and again.
For those that say things negative because it costs them $1.39 a week ..... welcome to the real world. It‚Äôs a business. It‚Äôs a good business.
When you start working for your living you will like to get paid, just like everyone else. You get what you pay for, and Headspace is a bargain. 
Skip a coffee at your coffee shop once a week and you can pay for two weeks of Headspace, and get a better value.

title: Life changing!
review: I have tried several guided meditation apps and Headspace is by far the best. Andy has a great, nonrobotic, no nonsense, but very kind and gentle style. I think it is fair to say that daily meditation has changed my life, and Headspace makes it enjoyable and easy to do. I have gained so much wisdom on interpersonal relationships, I‚Äôve become much less reactive, much less anxious, spend much less time ruminating and over analyzing, and am all around a happier, more balanced, and more confident person since using Headspace. It is well worth the expense.

title: Love the meditations, wish there were more female voices
review:
I love this app! I suffer from pretty bad insomnia, so this app has helped immensely. I also have been getting in the habit of daily meditation. 

With that, I wish there were more female recordings. To be completely honest, the male voice is not as comforting to me, and I can‚Äôt even listen to the male voice at night. There‚Äôs female options, but some sounds I like only have a male voice. I hope this doesn‚Äôt come across as rude, but it would just be nice to have both a male and female voice option for the same sounds in the nighttime sleepcasts

title: Helps a lot
review:
This app has helped me through some of my worst days. I have been dealing with anxiety and depression ever since I returned from deployment and this app really helps me to stay grounded. The other day I found myself having really dark thoughts and non stop worries. I was able to come back to reality and focus on the here and now.
 I‚Äôm learning coping mechanisms and skills to identity and address certain situations. 

I would strongly recommend this to more service members dealing with mental illness or who simply work in high stress environments.

title: Everyone should meditate
review:
Before my spiritual awakening and discovering my God, I thought meditation was for eastern religions, Buddhism, Hinduism, but I was wrong. I am a Christian, although it‚Äôs not preached on I have had a lot of affirmation in the Bible for it. I believe that any belief system can change a life. But Jesus is alright with me.  Mindfulness meditation allows me to open up to prayers and how to let go of control and give up to win. be more aware of others feelings but overall just how to stop take a breath and take life one step at a time. 

Blessings

title: Helped but paid
review: This app, in all honesty, is quite beautiful. Eves voice is very soothing and actually did help me fall asleep. The only thing that is hindering me from giving it five stars is that most of the activities have to be bought. I think with stresses and worry we deal with in our day to day can take a very big toll on us and this help could really help with that but not everyone can pay for a subscription. If someone truly does need help sleeping, I think helping them should come at no cost. But that‚Äôs also just my opinion. Great app over all though

title: Life changing for my mental health
review:
This app has completely changed my entire mindset and taught me how to control both my anxiety and ADD. Because of headspace I have learned how to manage these two things naturally. The guided meditations make it possible to calm down, ground myself and focus.

The library of categories contains a wide variety. It‚Äôs nice that it can be used any time of day anywhere. The voices are THE most amazing; they are so comforting and soothing. I‚Äôm so thankful for this app for improving my mental health and keeping me sane. It‚Äôs worth every penny.
developerResponse: {'id': 18787133, 'body': 'Sorry to hear about the trouble with the courses not playing. Please send us a message to help@headspace.com and we can further assist. ', 'modified': '2020-10-29T17:39:29Z'}

title: I am more of myself
review:
I found this app two years ago and have only increased my daily meditation time and regularity since. First, I needed help dealing with my anxiety, and I‚Äôve so enjoyed every pack and daily mediations. The small thoughts Andy gives us at the end are truly my favorite. 
I don‚Äôt care much for the exercising videos so far. I find the coaching a bit dull and the workouts could be more carefully thought out‚Äìtaking our bodies from standing to on the back in second then back up. In yoga, I really appreciate that every pose flows from one position to another and I‚Äôd like to see that in the exercises on this app. 

As for the sleep mediations, they have saved my life. I suffer from insomnia and minor panic attacks, and this app nearly always does the trick. 

Thank you, Andy and the Headspace team, for creating a generous, simple, and easy way to understand and practice meditation.

title: To much stuff that are locked
review: You see, I love this app. It helps me with a lot of stop like sleep and anxiety. But one day I was mad and wanted to cool of so I went on the app and searched up ‚Äúcalm down.‚Äù Which, did come up, but everything was locked. I can‚Äôt pay, it‚Äôs too much money and I have a lot of stuff going on so I can‚Äôt spend the money on the app. I would like to say at least unlock some stuff for other people to use because in my opinion it really isn‚Äôt fair for other people. I am new to this app so if there it unlocked stuff please let me know, thank you.

title: Not well thought out
review: I download this app so I can fall asleep quicker and I heard good things about this app. Now I am being forced to buy ‚ÄúPremium‚Äù for sounds to fall asleep to. Like how dumb do you think that sounds? Paying money for music at 13 dollars a month?? Why the heck would I do that for stuff that I am just trying to improve. I get it that they want to make more money, but asking people to pay for the only thing they asked to get from the app just seems kind of ridiculous. I would suggest putting some free ones and making the rest ‚ÄúPremium‚Äù. Thanks for reading this review I just think it‚Äôs a little dumb.

title: I love this app
review: I really thought I just could not learn to meditate until I got this app.  I am no expert by any stretch but I am definitely getting the hang of it and feeling the benefits. As someone who also uses the app at bedtime to help me get to sleep, my only complaint is that while I LOVE several of the sleepcasts, I wish they were longer.  The part where the person is talking about the lovely place that you are ‚Äúvisiting ‚Äú stops too soon and then the abrupt ending actually grabs my attention and wakes me up when I was almost drifting off.  Other than that it‚Äôs an awesome app.

title: A New Old Way To Come Back To Myself
review: Meditation is an ancient practice that has served humanity regardless of time passed or fluxes in society. It‚Äôs no wonder, then, that by updating the method for transmitting the lessons, more and more people are able to benefit. In a world where we can desperately use more kindness, it behooves us to begin finding kindness for ourselves. This is where Headspace begins. I have no doubt that Andy and the entire Headspace team have already changed the world through the individuals this app has impacted. Thank you Andy. Thank you Headspace.

title: What about gender parity?
review: My daughters like to listen to Headspace sleepcasts to go to sleep at night. It‚Äôs helpful. And, for whatever reason, the female voices work better for them than the male voices, so much so that they literally ask for ones that are ‚Äúdone by a girl‚Äú. Here is my complaint. Headspace has more than DOUBLE the number of male voiced sleepcasts than female voiced sleepcasts.  24 vs 11.  What decade are we in? I thought maybe they would realize it and that new content would trend the ratio back toward equality... until the latest content release, which made the ratio even worse! This isn‚Äôt acceptable, and I‚Äôm ashamed to expose my daughters to an app that perpetuates the dominance of male voices in the media.  It would be so simple to fix, Headspace.  Disappointed in you.

title: needs more stories!!!
review: i absolutely love headspace. i especially LOVE the stories because they really help me to sleep and calm down. the only thing i‚Äôm upset about is the fact that i only can listen to one story. i would be fine with any other amount, but just not one. it can be hard to fully calm down and relax when i have already heard the same story several times. i just wish that this app had more than just one story because i genuinely love the voice of whoever does the stories, and i‚Äôve tried other calming story apps, but i keep coming back to headspace. i just wish i had more stories!!!

title: privacy questions? Go away.
review:
I suppose that if they cared about privacy it would be easy to answer privacy question (e.g. ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt use any external SDKs that can collect any data from your device‚Äù). Instead, to summarize a long story of trying to get answers from them (as a paying user) Headspace‚Äôs approach is ‚Äúgo away‚Äù. If you don‚Äôt care who‚Äôs doing what on your phone, even if you are a paying user, this might work for you. If you still think of it as ‚Äúyour‚Äù phone, maybe not as much.

Update: headspace obviously don‚Äôt bother to read reviews, had they read it they would know I‚Äôm writing this after they‚Äôre ‚Äúsupport‚Äù made me realize how bad they were at privacy (or at providing the service I bought for that matter).
developerResponse: {'id': 14908556, 'body': 'So sorry for any concerns surrounding your privacy! Have you had a chance to reach out to our team at help@headspace.com for any questions you may have? ', 'modified': '2020-04-25T19:44:45Z'}

title: Missing Something
review: This app is wonderful. It has helped me tremendously when many other things I have tried have failed, but there‚Äôs a big issue that I have that also has an easy fix. I find it incredibly surprising that none of the meditations go over 20 minutes. I feel like this is significantly hindering my progress in my meditation journey. I am ready to do longer ones. I am craving longer ones. I think at a MINIMUM, the options should go up to one hour. There should be something to work up to if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre looking for. 5 stars once this becomes an option though!

title: I LOVE this app but..
review: I love headspace so much it has helped me to fall asleep calm and clear my mind. If you are someone who needs help winding down or meditating or sleeping etc. you should definitely get this app. My favorite thing to listen to to help me fall asleep are the sleepcasts, they‚Äôre so peaceful and calming.. but however I don‚Äôt like that you have to pay for all of them except one, so so far without paying I can only listen to rainday antiques, and i like this one a lot but I would like to explore the sleepcasts more. ‡∏Ö^‚Ä¢Ôªå‚Ä¢^‡∏Ö

title: Had trouble with Membership but they fixed it
review: I was trying to get the membership but could t for some reason until K emailed them and, though they got back to me a few days later, they still fixed the problem and even gave me a discount. Meditation has also been transformative and very relaxing. I discovered this through Netflix and sure glad I did. The layout of the app and especially the website is a bit confusing but the meditation is great.

title: Life changing, I highly recommend it
review: I love it, it‚Äôs helpful, I enjoy and accept life so much more now. I can connect with others and myself in a different level. Now I understand the nature of things and I see them from a different perspective. A better one. I didn‚Äôt have any experience with meditation but 3, 10, 15 minutes a day of headspace have been a beautiful positive change in all aspects of my life. Thank you so much, this is really contributing to make this a better place to live in.

title: Great app for beginners
review: This app is a great way for beginners to take up meditation. They really explain the purpose of the exercises and how you do them very thoroughly. I‚Äôve been using Headspace daily for 3 weeks now, and it‚Äôs so easy to build the habit. All the meditation sessions are guided and there are sessions that focus on specific things like anxiety, stress from work, loneliness, or depression as well as sessions just to practice.
