title: Finding peace and my quiet place
review:
Headspace has been my beacon of light in a time of much confusion anger and chaos
I start my mornings with it and end my days with it
Grounding me in the peacefulness of being able to separate my thoughts from being a reality and see them as just thoughts 
I now stop before I react and choose how I will be present  in that moment Not üíØ but so much better than I was
It has helped me make some really hard decisions and clear out some very toxic people in my life 
Thank you Headspace I will keep learning and growing with you 
Johanne

title: Balance
review: This app is adorable, however my run streak counter is off, sometimes if I do more than one meditation a day it ticks off a new day- but it still shows the first day I started, I don‚Äôt know how it manages the wibbly wobbly timey winery stuff, but all in all a good experience.

title: Feeling peaceful
review: When I start my day with Headspace, I‚Äôm reminded of how peaceful I feel compared to days when I‚Äôm too hurried to take the time. It makes such a difference in how I go about my day. Thanks, Andy, and everyone involved in making Headspace so helpful and relaxingüòÅ

title: Love it!!
review: Okay, so, this app is one of the best apps I have by far. It‚Äôs helped be get better sleep, feel happier, and much more. But, for some reason, on the rain radio, it plays ‚ÄúRainday Antiques‚Äù. I mean, I love the story, but it wasn‚Äôt what I was looking for, just wanted to report that bug. Thanks!

title: Lifesaver
review: My days are much more calm and mindful when I have headspace as a daily companion. One thing I would ask for, though, is to be able to ‚Äúscrap‚Äù or ‚Äúbookmark‚Äù my most frequent exercises and those I would like to visit later.

title: Love this app
review: I have used this app in the past and recently came back to it. The student discount is great and I like all the new features that have been added. These meditations are a great break in my day and easy to integrate to become a little more mindful.

title: This app has changed my life for the better this year
review: I am able to go through life with more serenity and wisdom because I‚Äôm able to take a few minutes everyday to calm myself and focus. Thank you.

title: What a blessing!
review: Working in mental health you would think that I would be better at caring for myself. I gave lip service to self care in reality. Headspace has given me a structure that I use several times a day. And with all that is going on in the world, the timing was perfect.

title: Useful guide to better mental health
review: A kind approach. Gives tools to feel better and take more control of your thoughts and feelings during difficult times.  Helps address patterns of negative thoughts and feelings.  Opens the mind to embrace positive change.

title: Best meditation app
review: I‚Äôve been using this app for meditation for years! Their approach is the best because it‚Äôs not intimidating at all. It‚Äôs so easy to use any time of the day, with meditations that are as short as 1 minute, or as long as an hour. Very helpful in helping me manage anxiety.

title: Great! But...
review: I have sleeping problems every night, when music or an audiobook don‚Äôt help me to sleep, ‚ÄúRainday Antuques‚Äù does. But it is the ONLY free sleep cast. It always works, no joke, but I can‚Äôt keep listening to the same thing over and over. Getting a night of sleep shouldn‚Äôt cost me money. I am a young teen and have no way to pay this. I just want to be able to sleep.

title: Love it!
review: I love this app. It has really helped me on my meditation journey and to sleep. The only thing I find lacking is the inability to create your own playlist. I wish I could cue up sleep music to play after my sleepcast so I don‚Äôt have to go through my phone when I wake up in the middle of the night.

title: I wouldn‚Äôt know.
review: Headspace had great reviews so I was like let me try it. Almost everything was locked. I really thought oh maybe, this app will be the one. Maybe, but I wouldn‚Äôt know because everything was locked. If your a person looking for an app to spend money on this will be the one. If your a person not willing to spend money move on to the next app(aka me) this seems like a good app for stress,sleep,etc.
developerResponse: {'id': 17585219, 'body': "We suggest checking out out complimentary sessions to try out the app!  Here's what's included in the free trial: https://help.headspace.com/hc/en-us/articles/115008192928-What-s-included-for-free-", 'modified': '2020-08-30T19:52:57Z'}

title: Great app...but it won‚Äôt get 5 stars until it usable in landscape
review: Come on Andy. It‚Äôs 2020. Anyone with an iPad uses it in landscape mode probably 80% of the time. And most people sitting and meditating are now more likely on a tablet than a phone. Get with the program. Get landscape mode so we can stop having to prop the iPad on a pile of pillows.

title: Amazing
review: Headspace has been a life saver during the pandemic and stay at home orders.  The sleep options have guided me to sleep or back to sleep on days with high anxiety. It is such a comfort knowing there is help that works and it makes you feel good, unlike prescriptions.

title: Thank you
review:
Thank you for opening up your services to healthcare. You have no idea how much it has helped me with my anxiety. During this crisis, I want to help others the most I can, and by helping me with my anxiety, you have allowed me to do so. 
Thank you.

title: My favorite meditation app
review: I have used Headspace for over 4 years and I continue to love it.  I have tried a couple of other apps but this is still my favorite.  My kids enjoy the kid‚Äôs meditations, I love the different emphases and techniques, and the sleep sounds are a great addition.

title: Too many notifications
review: I turned off all notification options within the app expecting to receive ..... no notifications. I received a notification the next day. It‚Äôs a stressful amount of notifications, ironic for a meditation app. There should be a way to turn off ALL the little ‚Äúreminders‚Äù from within the app

title: Mediation
review: A lot of people think meditation is just some old monk thing they see in movies. But it really helps and I believe it can benefit anyone who is willing to let it. This app allows everyone to give it a try and makes it easy for people to learn.

title: Headspace is the best!
review: I have used headspace only 5 times and I love it, I used to be a big ball of stress but after I started using this app it has really helped me deal with all of my stress. I love this app and recommend it to anyone who just needs a moment to yourself.

title: Not helpful
review: I tried Headspace for about two months. I like some things about it but the real meat of it (the daily mediations and courses) were just a bunch of mumbo jumbo for me. I got very little out of it .. it seemed like they talked in riddle and said so many words that meant nothing. It‚Äôs much more meditation than any helpful substance. I found Shine and Bloom to be exponentially more helpful if what you need is mindful thinking over tons of breathing.

title: Love it but....
review: Could you please release an update for a dark mode? When I open the app in the middle of the night the white background is blinding. Other than that I really enjoy the app, my son falls asleep now to stories every night!

title: my favorite app
review: i downloaded headspace almost three years ago during my freshman year of high school and have used it almost everyday since. i made my way through all the free options quickly and got the annual subscription. this has been the best app purchase that i could recommend! although i have fallen off habit a few times it is always so easy to come back and they are always updating their selection. it has grown so much as an app and i am so happy they decided to keep updating it!

title: More than relaxation
review: This really is a life skills tool! Bite-sized modules for when time is short, longer for when it's not. "SOS" sessions for when you need them. And aural aids like music to focus, and "sleepcast" stories and sound makers to guide you into sleep. An extraordinary little app; a gem!

title: Noah
review: I‚Äôve been using the headspace app for several years. I have found it to be most helpful for my mindfulness practice. I employ other resources as well. Thanks to this approach I continue to make progress with self awareness and understanding. Peace be with you and the world.

title: It just keeps giving
review: I‚Äôve consistently used headspace for just about 4 years now and it provides an excellent intro to meditation. I e also appreciated their other videos and workouts, especially during the pandemic.

title: One of the best apps ever
review: I was never a believer in meditation or mindfulness. But I am now. I can see the difference it makes. Headspace make sure easy to do and fun. I love the music and additional features as well. It‚Äôs a great app to get to bring a concentration on the mind into your life.

title: So happy I downloaded this app!
review: This app was recommended to me by a friend, and I am so glad I downloaded it.  If you are looking to get into the practice of mindfulness, or are a veteran meditator and are looking to expand your practice, this app is for you!  There is something for everyone.

title: Used to be good
review:
I used to like this.  There was a clear meditation focus and path for each time I opened it.

The app is now over-complicated and busy. I came in after a while for meditation, and the path is gone, replaced by a bunch of tabs, and a quarter-to-half screenful of animation, and seeming advertisements for things in the app.

Please re-introduce a simple mode. I don‚Äôt want to feel sensory overload when tying to meditate.

title: Seriously?
review: Okay, this is not just for you but most meditation apps. Why is mostly everything locked by an expensive paywall? I know you do need money but don‚Äôt lock mostly everything behind a paywall. It‚Äôs frustrating when you are trying to find something to help calm your anxiety, but it‚Äôs locked behind a paywall. I have a suggestion, add ads mainly for something and give access to more stuff then lock it behind a paywall.

title: really?
review: okay listen. i‚Äôm a 13 year old teen who struggles with anxiety. and i would LOVE to try the different things in this app! however.... my mom doesn‚Äôt have extra cash just lying around. and i‚Äôm 13. during quarantine. it‚Äôs not like i can get a job! please just make at least a few more sleepcasts and music tracks free :( i can‚Äôt make money and it‚Äôs unfair that almost everything is locked unless you subscribe.

title: Saved my life
review: This app has been instrumental in helping me deal with crippling anxiety and depression. I have never been able to really mediate but this app has given me the basics needed to mediate and now I‚Äôm on to improving my life through different other meditation practices.

title: Best Meditation App
review: There is a reason this app is rated so highly. It eases in skeptics and doesn‚Äôt have instructors with annoying voices (Calm!). Strong amount of beginner and advanced programs, and new content being added regularly without being overbearing. Great job.

title: I am getting settled!!!
review: My anxiety was soooo out of control when I found this app!  With the coaching and the calm reassuring voice of the coach,  I am gaining a new respect of anxiety and I am learning how to understand the feeling and not allow it to control me !!! Thank you   Head space!

title: Great App, but Popups
review: You guys have a ton of features. It‚Äôs great, I‚Äôm here for it, and am glad my money is developing some great material. Now, could you make the experience a little less annoying and let me go about it on my own without showing me a popup for something different every third click?

title: Better mindset for the whole family
review: I started using Headspace 2 years ago, and now my son loves it too! We both calm our squirrely minds with it, and it gives us a better way to start and end our days.

title: Just started...
review: And I already feel amazing! I recommend this app to everyone. I haven‚Äôt paid for it yet (I‚Äôm on session 7) but after this trial run I will for sure be using this daily and happily pay for the use. Great job to the developers!

title: Great App
review: I love this app but it would be much improved if I had the ability to bookmark my favorite sessions. I am not interested in having meditation ‚Äúbuddies,‚Äù but I am interested in finding my favorite content quickly and easily. It would be great if the app were updated to meet these needs.

title: Love this app and the company
review: I‚Äôve never left a review of an app before, but as someone who‚Äôs struggled with anxiety their whole life I can‚Äôt praise this app enough. Headspace had done an amazing job at making excellent mindfulness instruction accessible. Genuinely helpful for leading a better life.

title: The first day !!!
review: I can honestly say the first day i used this app i instantly felt a PIECE of calmness after my session. I would really recommend this with people that overthink and have really bad anxiety like myself. Thank you Yes Theory for recommending this app cause this truly is a blessing in disguise.

title: Wonderful!
review: I‚Äôve only hade headspace for a few months never used it until today. It changed my whole day, maybe my life. I listened to a session with a teacher on the app, amazing made my body feel so nice, so much stress was gone. Get this app! ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Headspace Meditation
review: Headspace is a great app for people and it‚Äôs good for our body. It helps decrease metabolism, lowers blood pressure and improve heart rate. Everyone needs to try this! It will help calm people when they‚Äôre stressed. But this is my opinion so I‚Äôm not forcing people to try it, but to give them an idea.

title: Just a week in and already...
review: I‚Äôve worked this into my morning routine, simply 10-15 minutes and it has GIVEN me more time and space.  I‚Äôm a week in and I already feel a difference.  Andy‚Äôs voice works well for me.

title: Make This a Habit
review: I‚Äôve had headspace on my phone for years but never really made it post off my routine. I‚Äôm trying to do that now and I recommend everyone do the same. Mindfulness is proven to be effective in regulating emotions and it pays to practice often.

title: It has it all we need
review: About 2016 my friend Ricardo Picon recommended me in Brooklyn NY. Next morning I did my first meditation and truly connected with Andy. 5 years later I still meditate now switch to Spanish version to try I bet there‚Äôs something special on Andy‚Äôs calm.

title: Always coming back for more
review: I keep finding new uses for this app. Whether it‚Äôs my daily practice, curiosity about what the Wake Up will teach me today, or because I‚Äôm struggling to sleep at night - I‚Äôm grateful for the content this app provides.

title: Well done
review: Enjoy and benefit from numerous features including the morning wake up, daily meditation and focus music for work.  I was signed up and started over a year pre Covid - the site continues to evolve and is truly a part of my daily routine.

title: Starting Headspace
review: I downloaded this app to help me feel more focused in school and at home. Even after one session, I feel more relaxed and aware of my surroundings. I recommend this app to anyone who experiences a lot of stress, or anyone who wants to improve their lifestyle.

title: Favorite feature
review: This is a really good and basic meditation app with some pretty hefty instruction. I really like you can change the length of your meditation it doesn‚Äôt change the material just changes the space in between. Pretty cool.

title: Totally changed my life
review: Headspace introduced me to meditation 5 years ago and I‚Äôve been using it pretty much every day since. There  has been no other thing in my life that has improved my mood, focus, energy, or happiness. Eternally grateful

title: Wonderful app
review: This app is beautifully made, reasonably priced, and has been wonderful in helping me start a meditation progress. My only complaint is I‚Äôd like to be able to reset progress for when I want to start a meditation over.

title: Best meditation app
review: I love headspace. There are many programs to choose from depending on the way the body feels. For me the anxiety guided meditations have been great. I also appreciate the small reminders that pop up on my phone every day with positive and uplifting messages.

title: Lifetime meditation?
review: Please bring back the lifetime payment! That was my hopes when a friend recommended me the app, plus if you add a way to download the sessions that would be awesome. Im a merchant mariner and if I could download some of them when i don't have service that would be nice. 30 days at sea are not easy... with meditation I can keep my mind clear of any stress that I have.

title: Headspace is awesome!
review: I‚Äôm only getting started, but I really enjoy it. It‚Äôs been very helpful already, even though I‚Äôve only used it a handful of times. Easy to use and doesn‚Äôt take a lot of time, and results help later in the day.

title: Love this app!
review: I use this app to help me fall asleep every night. It has an amazing range of sleep options, and the meditation videos feel comfortable rather than forced. The free version is good but I recommend the subscription if you have trouble falling asleep. It‚Äôs a lifesaver.

title: Hire an audio engineer - you HAVE the money
review: A de-esser isn‚Äôt meant so literally - you‚Äôre not trying to surgically extract every last S the female voice speaks.  You‚Äôre just trying to tone it down a bit.  For instance, it‚Äôs face... not fay, chest not Chey.  I feel like you‚Äôre using the de-esser to translate from English to French and it‚Äôs getting in the way of my zen!

title: Grateful for Headspace
review: Headspace gives me just enough every day to strengthen the habit of daily mediation allowing the sunlight, happiness, peace of mind to shine from within and enable a better me to live and work in the world. My practice isn‚Äôt perfect and that‚Äôs why I use Headspace - it keeps me on the journey.

title: Watch out for Auto Renew
review: Watch out for their auto renew policy. Paid for a year subscription. Didn‚Äôt realize the terms said they would auto bill you for the next year. Stopped using it months ago. Tried to contact them to cancel, with no response. Still no response a week later. I now have this for another year or they have my money and won‚Äôt get back to me.

title: Good app, voice is not soothing
review: Like the app. Teaching meditation is simple . Purchased the all once I read the book . I say the app is awesome , but Andy‚Äôs voice is not soothing at all . While meditating his coaching interruption bring away the focus . The voice is not soothing and calming .  Suggestion to Bring few voice actors with gentle , soothing voice .

title: Pick up anytime
review: I can pick this up at anytime and get the immediate feeling of calm and purpose back in my day after just 12 minutes of Headspace meditation‚Ä¶ thanks for laying out this program so efficiently, it is very user friendly

Also, how do I change some of my times to get notifications at 5:30am instead of 6:00?
Thanks.

title: Change my life

title: This is great!

title: Headspace review thing

title: So Helpful
review: I use the free content exclusively. It‚Äôs enough to use again and again. It never gets stale. I love that this app exists. I am a certifiable phone addict and since Headspace is on my phone, it‚Äôs that much easier to break away from those habits.

title: Over a year now!
review: Been using this app for over a year now and love it! I‚Äôve tried other meditation apps but this one connected with me. I like the visualization they use when explaining techniques. Highly recommend!

title: Give it a try
review: I have tried and failed to get into meditation in the past. With the intense anxiety of living and working through a pandemic, I tried it again. Now 70 days in, it‚Äôs been a big help. Very accessible and convenient.

title: Life changing
review: I was introduced to headspace by my husband and it has truly changed my life. The guided meditations make it easy to follow and meditate where I could never do it alone. I also love all of the different courses you can choose from.

review: I‚Äôm in real estate and it can be very hectic and all over the place. I feel more in control of my emotions and thoughts after a meditate. I am more patient with my family after just 10 minutes of headspace. It‚Äôs awesome!

title: Headspace- good or bad?

title: If you want to get into meditation, this is very helpful

I deleted it, and a few moths later, there was only 1 free meditation. Is there any way to lower the price? Maybe make it free?

title: It‚Äôs ok
review:

title: Just beginning
review: I‚Äôve been meaning to do this forever. I read a review of headspace which said it‚Äôs the best meditation app among many. I am on day 6 and find it helpful. I‚Äôve made a commitment to do at least 41 days. Many good options on this site.

title: Diverse, effective, and educational
review:

2) There is a diverse collection of narrar tor√°. Everyone should be able to find a comfortable voice listen to. 

3) The wake-up and courses are super educational!

title: Getting through it
review: This is the easiest and most straightforward way to adopt meditation as a daily practice. There is something for everyone and it‚Äôs easy to make part of your day (beginning, middle or end).

I‚Äôve used the panic and stress options, the basics and am really pleased by the daily darhma talks.

review: Suffering from ADHD, anxiety and depression, I started meditation in martial arts and really enjoyed it.  I found Headspace as I learned more about meditation and it is simple and great for all types of mind adjusting.  You will feel better the more you do these meditation.

review: I‚Äôve tried meditating several times before but could never get into it. I watched the guide to meditation on Netflix and really liked how Andy approached and guided the meditations so I downloaded the app. I‚Äôm really enjoying it and definitely recommend!

title: I wouldn‚Äôt want to live without Headspace.
review: Seriously, this is working for me. My headspace is more spacious and less worried and cluttered with inane thoughts.  Started with fundamentals, then Anxiety and now Creativity.  Works well for me and I have tried other meditation or mindfulness products.

title: Tangible goals for development
review: They‚Äôve created a solid and simple format for me to practice daily meditation with small focus talk and 10 min practice that has launched me in to months of achieving my goal to meditate and find a new way to quiet and calm amidst the storms of life and the mind.

title: Mind changing

Cancelling the subscription meant the automatic loss of my money which I also thought not ok. I‚Äôm sure they have their reasons. 

I can see how it might help others and its not a good interface. It just didn‚Äôt help me. I don‚Äôt like voices interfering with my meditation.

title: This is awesome

title: Truly helpful

title: Fantastic
review: Love it. Still. It will change your stress and anxiety level for sure. When I can get my time in before everyone wakes up and my busy day starts it just make for a better day and a better me.

title: Calm in the Storm

title: Helpful even if you think you can meditate

title: Life Enhancing

review: Over and over again this app malfunctions in mid-session.  What good is it when you‚Äôre trying to get into and maintain a ‚Äúzone‚Äù-like state when you‚Äôre worried that maybe the app has crashed on you again?  As it is, even if it worked perfectly it stretches incredulity by offering a snake-oil like remedy for almost every imaginable affliction-  including cancer!!!  This is shady.  I‚Äôm sticking with Waking Up and 10% Happier.  I want a refund!

title: Use it for my dietetics practice
review:

Highly recommend!

Elle with Elevated Nutrition and Wellness

title: Fast acting and effective
review:

 In the medium term, it requires patience and commitment. Yet it‚Äôs very flexible and common sense. Easy to fit into your weekly schedule

title: Wish it was free...
review: I got really excited to go try this app after seeing an ad for it. Once I downloaded it and saw that you have to pay to listen to basically anything, I was really disappointed. I could understand having somethings be paid only and some things free to everyone. The whole point of the app is to help people with their wellness so to charge for everything is a negative for me. title: Clears my mind
review: Help a me to clear my mind before and after work to let me relax and enjoy my day. It helps to eliminate the stress that I feel with easy to follow sessions as well as having group sessions to experience this with others

review:
For me, the whole app falls flat. I was hoping to find mediation sessions that involved no spoken lessons. I found a single one minute breathe-along type class I enjoyed but I couldn't find anything else. 

If you want a therapist in your ear, this might work for you. 

I was looking for a self-guided introspection and mental rest, but to me it felt like each meditation is a class I should take notes in.

title: Headspace Review
review: My review is that I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT! But, yes there is indeed a but... I don‚Äôt like the pricing. Especially during COVID a lot of people, like myself don‚Äôt have much money but they are struggling with mental health, I just wish the app was free for subscription. Now I‚Äôm only on limited things on the app.

title: Absolutely amazing! Perfect for meditation beginners!
review: So thankful that LA County offers this for free for now, but I will definitely buy in the future! Helpful for someone who is just getting into meditation and the sleep casts and wind downs are essential for me now. I highly suggest giving it a try!

title: Great for sleep
review: I‚Äôve always had such trouble sleeping, but using the Headspace sleepcasts has made a huge difference in my life. I feel so thankful that I decided to try out the trial, I am definitely keeping it. I especially love listening to Simon and Dora.

title: Excellent! The best app I‚Äôve encounter for learning and keep meditating
review:
Love this app. It's hard to find a good meditation app with all that's out there. This one I recommend for being so real and so adequate for the purpose of meditating. Lots of different scenarios and very, very, very good advice. 
Try it.

title: Wonderful app, but
review:
Being able to adjust the soundscapes would be a really great improvement. Choosing between 45mins OR 500mins is pretty extreme. A sliding scale or intervals of hours would be really nice. Hope you‚Äôll see this and take it into consideration.

Xx

title: Changing my perception
review: This app has been helping me be more patient and understanding with others and kind to myself. I would highly recommend it to anyone serious about changing themselves.

title: Love this app
review: This is the only app I subscribe to and it‚Äôs worth every penny. It has really helped improve my to my day-to-day life. It has so much to offer from movement to sleep and everything in between. 10/10 recommend.

title: Great start of the day

Joey S

title: I LOVE THIS APP

title: Good for self management

title: Headspace

title: Fantastic app
review: The meditation is fantastic. I have definitely improved my overall mood using the meditations. The wake up is a great blog to watch in the morning to start your day. I highly recommend this app.

title: So helpful!

title: Amazing!
review: It definitely works wonders, I recommend if you do choose to purchase a plan, stay consistent by using the app before you go to bed or generally speaking, pair the activity with something you do on a day to day basis.

title: Cannot recommend enough

Headspace is an amazing tool to learn mindfulness. The new today feature makes it light and easy to get into it.

No better time then now to start using.

title: Amazing

All I want is the daily meditation, I‚Äôm really not interested in everything else, at least not right now. How about a few tiers that unlock different parts of the app?

title: Best meditation app out there

title: Life changer

title: Suffering from featuritis and personalities over principles
review:
A cannonical issue with any "brand" is they always feel to add more.

Marketing and MBAs clearly have their clutches in this app now.   We have tons of new "features" that have nothing to do with the basics of meditation.

The basics of headspace, which are fundamental to mindfulness are now hidden.   They are there but now you have one hundred things obscuring accessibility including annoying pop-ups for celebrity content.   

Hopefully the Headspace team will find a way to come to their senses and eliminate all these chaotic bells and whistles that have nothing to do with cultivating mindfulness, serenity.

title: The Greatest App of All Time

The absolutely love the animated videos and guided courses that work in different areas ie. Anger, focus, sadness, relationships. There‚Äôs so much to explore and learn in this app.

The one item that would make this a 5 star app would be to allow the app to work in landscape mode on an iPad.

title: Diverse voices
review:
Several sleep casts only feature BIPOC voices when they‚Äôre tied to stereotypical roles.

For example, Carlos (spanish accent) only featured in El Mercado. Brian (Asian accent) only featured in Temple Rain. Kim (African American woman) only featured in Salon Nights.

Including diverse voice actors across all the sleep casts could undermine the typical tropes western cultures have historically imposed on ‚Äúother‚Äù identities. 

There‚Äôs an opportunity to challenge the historically prejudiced stereotypes that maintain that certain identities can  only exist  if fitting into well-worn mischaracterizations. 

Please reconsider how to cast voice actors.
developerResponse: {'id': 20561838, 'body': "Thank you for feedback and we're sorry to hear you‚Äôre not completely satisfied with our voice talent choices in the Sleepcasts. We aim to be extremely inclusive in how we find our voice talent, but we will also make sure your suggestion is passed on and heard by our teams.", 'modified': '2021-01-21T19:43:24Z'}

title: Whut?
review:
I‚Äôm not sure what headspace is about.

Stress relief?
 Sure.
 The breathing exercise is excellent. 
Meditation?
 Okay.
 I‚Äôm a Zen Buddhist; this program is like Zen, minus the Buddhism. 
Sleep facilitation?
 Here‚Äôs where it gets tricky.

I don‚Äôt see a way to set up a get-to-sleep regimen.
 Having to fool with a computer (iPhone) seems antithetical to getting to sleep.
 Why can‚Äôt I set up up a ‚Äúplay stuff like XYZ,‚Äù and have done with it?

That‚Äôs all for now...

title: Wholesome & Effective Wellness Hub!
review: This app is versatile, fresh and wellness focused with a clean, approachable and attractive aesthetic. I love it! I have been using it for a long time and it pleasantly gets better and better with time. It really helps with anxiety, sleep trouble, anger and now so many other areas of challenge in life. I think there‚Äôs something for everyone‚Äîregardless of background‚Äîto benefit from in the app. My partner and I enjoy doing meditations and Move exercises together. They seem to always be adding more and improving in ways that I previously had silently wished they would. As for possible improvements, I‚Äôd really like to be able to ‚Äúshuffle‚Äù or choose a random sleepcast, specifically. Also, it would be nice if I could rewind the sleepcast, as sometimes I miss the beginning or certain parts while I‚Äôm settling in, or still have stuff on my mind from the day and don‚Äôt want to go through the whole wind down exercise again. Another suggestion‚Äîand this may just be an issue with my older Apple TV‚Äîif I could airplay the video along with the audio (Move exercises, The Wake Up) that would be fantastic as right now only audio plays on the tv while I have to watch the fitness instructor from the phone. One last thing, how about Apple Watch compatibility? That would be delightful and I would use it even more often. Any small flaws or teensy inconveniences aside, it‚Äôs still well worth the small fee to support the people who make this great service available to us.

title: Headspace is my favorite app !
review: I have had a subscription to this app for a very long time. I first started using it for sleep.  I could never fall asleep... I would toss and turn for hrs, sometimes all night and not even get a min of sleep. This was extremely frustrating and it was affecting many aspects of my life in a negative way.  I have chronic back pain, and I could never get comfortable, so I thought about this pain all night. My mind racing, knowing that I had work in the morning and I was just miserable.  So, I started using the wind downs.  I incorporated that with a beginners course on meditation.  After some time and practice, I was beginning to see real improvement.  Then I added the sleep stories, I didn‚Äôt think they would work at first, because I believed that the story would have me too focused on the story and not fall asleep. Again, after a week or two, I was falling asleep before the story ended.  Then I did the pain course...to help me understand my relationship with pain.  It did wonders. Over months I was dedicating at least one time a day to meditation.  I also have anxiety, and have been working on that.  But there is so much more on this app. Yoga, healthy eating, music, and a lot of helpful info and meditations.  I have tried other apps while using this one. Some were pretty good and some just weren‚Äôt for me. This app is honestly an app I can‚Äôt live without.  I love it!  I am living a healthier lifestyle and also sleeping so much better. I recommend this app to ANYONE & everyone.  They add new courses and different aspects to it all the time.  I will NEVER cancel this app.  I have begun to look at life different. My mood is more positive, I am focusing more, and I encourage anyone looking for a place to start a meditation journey to start with this app.  There‚Äôs so much information and I can‚Äôt go a day without it.  It‚Äôs the best out there!

title: I never really knew how to meditate ‚ÄºÔ∏è
review: My son bought me Headspace for my birthday ü•≥ last year after I had talked with him about a perceived crisis I was having. My son is 38, I am 68 and we are very close. He said ‚Äúdo you meditate?‚Äù I thought then said ‚Äúwell no I wouldn‚Äôt know where to start.‚Äù When my birthday rolled around he told me he purchased a year of Headspace so I could learn to meditate. That is the most thoughtful gift üéÅ I have ever received. I was feeling like I was having a meltdown starting on the inside, so I started the impermanence process. My day starts better with the little bit of time I devote to myself. There are many issues I am working on and the more I examine the list in Headspace I see they have a session for each issue. I am certainly on a journey that is aiding me with the tools and skills to manage issues better. I use to have a difficult time getting to sleep and now I put on Rainday Antiques to help me sleep and I have yet to hear it to the end... I am sleeping very well. With the discipline of having the breathing to center me and give me a moment or two to get a perspective rather than react I feel much more in control. I am so not there yet (where ever there is üòÇ) and I feel that Headspace will always have a session for me on this wonderful journey my son gifted me.  After a bit of Headspace I feel able to meet my day with the idea every day is a journey of something different and exciting to explore. I thank Headspace for being a wonderful part of my life‚Äôs journey.

title: Sounds cheesy but this changed my life, and it still continues to as I use it everyday
review: Headspace‚Äôs meditation teachers taught me so much about mindfulness and I‚Äôve been mediating afford two years as a high schooler. And Andy was a former Buddhist monk, so I learned sooo much about mindfulness that it‚Äôs improving my quality of life A LOT. There are so many things I want to say but I want to keep this short. Even though mediation sounds ‚Äòdumb‚Äô for some people, Headspace is the very opposite; it gives me mindfulness tips and follow up with a mediation, making the mindfulness lesson more memorable, and what I learned so far (and all of them are so freaking helpful) are: observe thoughts instead of reacting and getting carried away with them, if we‚Äôre reacting to thoughts we are keeping the emotion alive, adding more fuel to the fire; let‚Äôs thoughts come and go, with a gentle or effortless focus; having a daydream sense of mind let‚Äôs us take things less seriously and it gives us more freedom, and sooooo many more (I can‚Äôt remember all at the moment). But some improvements I‚Äôd want to see are: being able to review the daily mediations in the ‚ÄúToday‚Äù tab, because they are so freaking useful and I want to keep listening to them, I don‚Äôt want them to be just ‚Äúdaily‚Äù, I want it to exist in the library forever; another improvement is that it‚Äôs kind of expensive for high schoolers, and since I‚Äôm a high schooler and I think this app should be used more by students, I think it should have a reduced price for high schoolers as well (thankfully I got a free one-year trial and I‚Äôm waiting for the sale, because I‚Äôm paying using my own money).

title: Flashy but needs more depth
review:
I have used three meditation apps including Headspace, so I know what‚Äôs out there. I settled on Headspace because I thought it had a much larger gallery of meditations and most meditations are customizable to the point where you can even change the voice style (female or male). I liked it at first but I‚Äôm growing frustrated because each meditation ‚Äúlesson‚Äù seems to all be the same. Whether you want to meditate for anxiety, self-confidence, kindness... you will be doing the exact same guided meditation. The only difference is the excerpt at the beginning of the meditation is about whichever topic you‚Äôre meditating on. I personally think each one of these meditations could be much more tailored. Anxious people can‚Äôt sit and imagine a wave of light washing over them. Anxiety often causes shallow breathing, racing thoughts, tension. The best meditations for anxiety is plenty breath work & someone talking you through a meditation while incorporating soothing reassurances about overcoming anxiety. Another app I have used is very good at this and I‚Äôm thinking about switching back for this very reason. They have less meditations but at least they‚Äôre all unique. 

If you‚Äôre looking for a flashy app with a pretty interface but not much beneath the surface, this app is for you. I hope someone from the Headspace team reads this because this app would be amazing if the meditations were genuinely as tailored as they appear to be on the surface. I‚Äôm so tired of being told to focus briefly on my breathing and then picture ‚Äúlight‚Äù washing over me for the next 10 minutes. Meditation is so much more than this.

title: Design based, not function.
review:
I was very intrigued by the fun graphics and seemingly simplicity of the app. However this app seems to focus on design rather than actual function. The meditation modules sometimes do not sync up with your phone‚Äôs audio system. Meaning, you have no idea wether you‚Äôre still playing or where you are at with your meditation. It goes from a surplus talking, to minutes of silence all within seconds. They seem to teach you the lesson before settling in which does not make sense because you‚Äôre not in a settled mind to absorb the lesson. Every single module follows almost the same exact pattern and reuses the same 2-3 visualizations (pin break light, liquid sunshine, body scan). The enunciation of some words are very harsh and non soothing, and they very rarely give you a female option. The ‚Äúdaily programs‚Äù only work if you watch them back to back to back because they refer to the previous day instead of giving a brief recap (makes sense for some people, not for those who have had an entire day and a half go by before they could meditate). I‚Äôve only found one of the night time stories to have an ambience that wasn‚Äôt overpowering and distracting - the nightmare SOS meditation has a terrible voiceover, it is way too harsh of a voice for soothing nightmares at 2AM. 

This app frustrates me as soon as I open it and starts off my meditation with a very negative view. I personally would recommend the Calm app to anyone who struggles with these same issues. The usability and function of it works a lot better than this app. You‚Äôre able to scrub scroll, it gives you preset background music (so you know you‚Äôre still playing), the meditations aren‚Äôt repetitive with the same exercises, and if the accents distract you as much as they do to myself - calm provides several accents and multiple gender options for EVERY module (not just a few like headspace). I would recommend the Headspace app for children or anyone who prefers a visual experience/is an extreme beginner to mindfulness and meditation.

title: Good app
review:
I have heard of apps similar to this one before and figured I would give it a try to relax me since with finals are just around the corner and deadlines are getting closer. I decided to put my goal at reducing stress and anxiety and the first thing I got was  prompoted to a ‚ÄúFeeling overwhelmed‚Äù talk down to get myself relaxed and calm. The voice was not all that calming and relaxing, but he did have an accent that was very mesmorizing that helped let go of some tension. 

After setting some goals for myself Headspace created a list of things for me to accomplish throughout the day and the first thing was to take five deep breaths. What I loved about this was the music was very calming, but still had some upbeats it helped with when we were holding, breathing in, and exhaling. Another great component was there was a little face that would do the exercise with you and when you would inhale it would smile.

The way this app relates with anxiety and panic attacks is, I think this can be beneficial to help get our heart rates down, get us to focus on other things, and help us relax. I think this would be incredibly useful in situations of discomfort of nervousness, I know this would help me and many others. Breathing methods help center us, by doing the five breaths with the app helped me feel more in control and calm of what I was doing. I have shared this app with my family, as I know they have been going through some hard times lately and they could use something to relax and destress them. 

Stress can be hard to manage, and a lot of the talking ‚Äúpodcasts‚Äù seem to help with trying to get you to let go or trying to find other things to distract ourselves with so we dont become too overwhelmed. Overall, I think this app has some benefits it helps calm you, center you, and puts you at peace. It certainly helped my anxiety be more managable while doing assignments and it helped me get in the right direction for the next couple of hours with my work and overall wellness. I can definitely see myself using this in a store to distract myself from my anxiety because this type of stuff can be grounding.

title: Good and Bad ? 1 star or 5 stars ? ü§î
review:
Was thinking of giving it 1 star‚Ä¶ below is why‚¨áÔ∏è

Headspace is truly a wonderful app.
It has evolved through time with new features made for every kind of person. New high quality content is constantly added. 

I started meditation and mindfulness through Andy‚Äôs book, ‚ÄúHeadspace Guide To Meditation and Mindfulness‚Äù and it was a game changer. Eventually I downloaded the app and, sometime after, I started paying annual membership. I do so without regret because of what the app offers. The opportunity to access guided meditation by teachers such as Andy is incredible!!  Everyday life is a fight, the world is going fast, our lives as well‚Ä¶for me, the app has become an necessary aide for motivation and resources. 

Precisely this is why I almost gave it 1 star. Everything is so magnificent it has generated dependency.  It is so good, that now it seems very difficult for me to meditate without it. It is as if I‚Äôve lost my ability, will, and/or discipline to acquire headspace on my own. Makes sense? Maybe. Foreseeable? Most likely. Inevitable? Not really. Could be just me? Definitely. As of writing this comment, I will actively work to put in practice meditation and mindfulness on my own again.

My advice for anyone reading the review is to go for it. Try it out, learn the basics and reap the benefits !!!  but be careful to practice being present and dealing with your mind without having to use the app. I believe the app can‚Äôt become essential in our lives. Good luck !

title: please, give yourself the present of meditation
review:
Learning meditation through Andy and the Headspace team has been life changing. 

I‚Äôve learned so much through the app. Some things that I‚Äôve been learning recently are: 
1. Change is the only constant in life. Each moment in life is never the same as before. Being more present in each moment helps me embrace change, especially when ‚Äúbig‚Äù changes arise. Big change, small change. It‚Äôs all basically the same. What matters more is the calm awareness of change and the compassion for self and others that follows. 
2. Dealing with distractions, restlessness, anxiety. These things often manifest as feelings or mental chatter in my head. I‚Äôm learning to note these feelings and thoughts as they come, simply as feelings and thoughts, which gives me the headspace to choose to engage with them in a calm manner or set them aside and return my focus to whatever task is at hand. This has also helped me immensely with time management, falling asleep, combatting impulsiveness, etc. 
3. Other things I‚Äôve been learning, but now I‚Äôm going to list them because this review is getting long: Discipline, consistency, appreciation, regret, anger, stillness, exercising and eating mindfully. Honestly I could go on and on. 

Do yourself and those you love a favor by growing in awareness and compassion through Headspace. Honestly if everyone used this app, the world would be a slightly better place. There should be a clinical trial on this published in JAMA. Can I be hired to do this? ü§ì

title: If you‚Äôre overwhelmed, Headspace can probably help
review:
Headspace is a great supplemental tool to use if you‚Äôre looking for emotional and physical well-being whether you‚Äôre having a typical bad day, you‚Äôre having trouble sleeping, or you‚Äôre having a major life crisis. Of course it‚Äôs not a cure-all, but I‚Äôd definitely say it‚Äôs a help-all. It‚Äôs helped me in managing anger, fear, anxiety, sadness, grief, loneliness, being over-excited for events, ect. It‚Äôs even been of one the tools I use to calm my mind and help prevent migraines if I feel a small one coming on. 

Personal experiences:

One night, back when I was pregnant, I was panicking from the grief of my mother dying of brain cancer, and that night I felt I could barely walk because of the overwhelming emotions I was having, but prayer and headspace helped me calm myself enough to function again that night. 

When I moved to a city after living my whole life in rural areas, headspace and prayer were what helped me overcome the feelings of being trapped and anxious. I started out with the free trial which was great. Then I was gifted the premium and I enjoyed that, though I wish it was always free ;). I‚Äôm back to the basics now, and it is still helpful.

Overall, headspace has helped me calm down on a regular basis to levels I didn‚Äôt think were possible for me. Headspace along with counseling have led the way for me to overcome negative thought patterns I‚Äôve had my whole life. 

Headspace has taught me mindfulness meditation and helped me accept myself and appreciate my present reality. These techniques has showed me how to be as calm and clear headed as God intended when he created our bodies and minds to have those calming mechanisms such as deep breathing and visualizations already built in. Headspace can just help you discover those. 

Headspace changed the way I help myself and my children cope with strong emotions. It‚Äôs helped me be more present and grounded in my own life, and that‚Äôs huge for me. Thanks, headspace.

title: Ten months in and I have a lot to say
review:
I started using headspace in April 2019. 
TLDR: The app is phenomenal for learning how to meditate, and more specifically for teaching the techniques used and giving you a guided experience. It‚Äôs also great for keeping you accountable with streaks. It can get repetitive and glitchy at times, but overall I recommend the app to people pretty often. 

The long version 
Pros: 
‚Ä¢I love the daily headspace meditations and the fact that it‚Äôs a new topic every day, but I wish the intro pieces were a little bit longer. They‚Äôre great insights/perspectives, and I would benefit from more of that on a daily basis. 
‚Ä¢Headspace on sleep has been life altering at helping me get to sleep. Guided progressive relaxation and a specific task for my mind help my mental and physical reconnect and prepare to sleep. 
‚Ä¢The pain management pack has really helped me come to terms with chronic sciatic/back/leg pain and learn not to fight it, which makes it worse. I‚Äôve learned to accept it as an unpleasant reality and acknowledge the pain, which in turns helps to lessen its intensity. 

Cons:
‚Ä¢The meditations get repetitive. Doesn‚Äôt matter what class pack or daily headspace you do, it‚Äôs essentially the same technique each time and it gets kind of old. Again, i‚Äôd like to hear more of the insights Andy has and it‚Äôd be cool to mix up the techniques a little more, even between days of the same pack (e.g. light visualization one day, body scan one day, progressive relaxation one day). 
‚Ä¢Sometimes in the sleep meditations, hearing the voice come back startles me awake again and TERRIFIES me so that I can‚Äôt calm down again for a while. 
‚Ä¢Sometimes Andy is just too chatty for me during a meditation. On the other hand, the longer meditations aren‚Äôt really beneficial, it‚Äôs just a prolonged version of the shorter ones with awkward timing of the ‚Äútasks‚Äù within the meditation. There‚Äôs no additional content at the beginning, and sometimes the body scans or breath counting segments get waaaaay too long and i totally lose my train of thought. Alternatively, often the body scans are waaaaay too short in the shorter meditations. 
‚Ä¢The app is glitchy. It‚Äôll log you out at random, it cuts off and closes completely during the middle of my meditations sometimes (especially with the Headspace 365 pack).

title: Have loved for years but not the new 2.0 version
review:
I should have reviewed this app years ago. 5 stars for sure. I‚Äôve recommended it to so many friends and have given it as a gift many times as well.   

I took a hiatus much of this last crazy year (ironically when I prob needed it the most) and when I recently came back, I see the total redesign with a ton of new content. So now we are scrolling through all this content, tons of media, noise, and suggested to set a myriad of notifications?!  Is this conducive to a quiet mind? No. In fact, every time I open the app I end up feeling super anxious.  I thought it was a one off, but it‚Äôs happened each time. It‚Äôs too much noise and it‚Äôs too chaotic at the time in the morning when I‚Äôm trying to start my day off right by focusing on presence, quieting the mind, and setting my intentions before leaping into my crazy day.  Now, instead of being a respite, a place for grounding, this app mirrors much of what life looks like these days and all social media apps.  Honestly, this really feels like Headspace ‚Äúsold out.‚Äù

Once you dig around and find what you‚Äôre looking for, Andy‚Äôs soothing guided meditations are still there, and I do love the ambient noise and low-fi tracks that have been added. I get it. You‚Äôre trying to corner the market on all things zen. Gotcha. There‚Äôs a BD team making very different decisions than our beloved yogis and zen masters. So....

In the spirit of both staying true to the mission AND in consumer satisfaction (which is of course, good business) I will offer the perfect solution, instead of canceling my membership (yet) bc Andy is the best. Create a customizable home page. Let me drag over only the things I want on my page.  It would be what I see when I open the app and no need to navigate elsewhere if I don‚Äôt want to.  I would personally choose to keep it uncluttered and super simple with my mediations and maybe some music. Others may do something diff. To each their own.   And when I‚Äôm not in mediation mode, maybe then I‚Äôll choose to dig around the other media and content to check out your new stuff, and drag and drop new favorites to my page.  But opening this app and seeing this chaotic stream of content is not sustainable for me, and I cannot imagine that I am alone in that.

title: Build a practice
review:
Out of mini other apps, YouTube videos, books, podcast, etc., I have found is the easiest way to establish a regular practice. Best part that‚Äôs easy to choose the amount of time from as little as three minutes forward. The little guide at the beginning of each practice helps keep it fresh. Highly recommended for new or experienced meditator. 
Recently I have been watching the headspace series on Netflix and like how it illustrates how meditation can help all aspects of your life.

title: So many meditation and relaxation options
review: So many meditation options. Great App and program. Lots of free meditations available on YouTube. Check them out!

title: New Way of Living
review:
Thank you Andy for introducing me to sleep meditation. I‚Äôve never meditated before but this Covid crisis has changed many of our lives. Being introduced to headspace has changed my life and I‚Äôm so grateful for your voice, your influence and your ability to let me calm down and go to sleep.As a healthcare provider with many new stresses your entire team and many topics has gotten me through the past 18 months.Thank you Andy
MARIAN

title: perfect for my mentally ill butt
review: mediation has helped me with ptsd and adhd. it‚Äôs not a cure but it helps me refocus and not be so in my head. it‚Äôs perfect for me.

title: Can‚Äôt fall asleep
review: At night I stay up until 11:00. I look up a YouTube video of how to fall asleep fast. I see an add for headspace. I downloaded it and it didn‚Äôt have anything for me to fall asleep fast. At least I didn‚Äôt see that. It also only put in text. I mean it didn‚Äôt say out loud what was on the screen. Raven when it did explain, I heard an  up soothing voice. Sorry about that one, but if you want to sleep fast this isn‚Äôt the app for you.

title: Tried & true
review:
I have been using Headspace for approximately six years. I really like the basics you can start off with as well as the various topics. They have grown a lot, to compete with other apps I‚Äôm sure. I repeat series as well; there is always room for growth. 
I have briefly used other meditation apps but this is still my favorite. I sort of feel like Andi is my personal meditation buddy.Me and my mom talk about him like we know him: ‚ÄúToday Andi said...‚Äù 
I‚Äôm also interested to look into some of the other people that are featured‚Äîe.g., Kevin Hart & John Legend‚ÄîI just have not done a lot of that yet

title: It was too good to be true.
review:
12.99 a month or 70.00 up front for a year? 

This app has been a bright light in a dark time for me. But as all things do, it has come to an end due to the recent subscription update that restricts data unless you cough up money. 
Pretty sad.

title: Dark theme :(
review: Headspace is great. I‚Äôve been using it since 2019 and it essentially introduced me to meditation and mindfulness practices which I am eternally grateful for. However, the one complaint I have is the dark theme. I use the dark theme on my phone, but with headspace I prefer the light theme and I wish there was a way to set the dark/light theme within the app itself because I find myself constantly switching to the light theme specifically for this app and then back when I‚Äôm done using it. Thank you for this app and I hope you see this review and make dark/light theme setting within the app itself similar to the way YouTube has theirs.

title: Unimpressed - not helpful for sleep
review: I don‚Äôt meditate but this was recommended to me for sleeping. It unhelpful. The wind downs have these really annoying breathing exercises that are the opposite of relaxing and even more annoying to listen to the counting. It sounded more like a fitness class countdown. Countdowns from 1000? Even more annoying. The voices aren‚Äôt that soothing. Eve is okay and I typically enjoy foreign accents but there are exceptions for me (cockney, Aussie). No offense but usually you find at least multiple voices that are soothing. I did enjoy the Cat Marina sleep story but that was about it. I‚Äôd rather listen to V on Snoozecast or the hypnotic voice of Tracks to Relax. The soundscapes are also not very good. The sleep music is even worse. It‚Äôs jarring and they all seem to have the same tones. I‚Äôve given this 3 weeks and it‚Äôs actually making my sleep worse so hoping this 30 day money back guarantee is legit because I‚Äôve exercised it. I bought directly from Headspace so there ought not be any issue, but these other poor reviews have me concerned. I‚Äôll update this review if it becomes problematic. The team behind this app should add me to a research panel. I‚Äôd really like to see them improve the sleep portion of this app.

title: Not working.
review: For the last week, I have tried to click ‚Äúexplore headspace‚Äù and it refuses to work. I love the netflix show and the youtube channel and I thought the app would be great too, but it has continued to refuse to work.

title: Love the format/ short med times
review: Great app! Have tried Insight, Calm, and now Headspace.Somehow this app makes me eager to return each day, and I have been consistently coming back to enjoy the  calming effects !!

title: Great app for those who like to spend
review: I saw this advertising on YouTube and I was playing some music to go to sleep when I decided to go and download the app. I ended up figuring out that almost everything was locked. Now I hate apps that are free and then ask for you to pay a large amount of money. And I get it you need money and if you want to pay for headspace plus that is fine. But a note to the makers. Have more things available for those who don‚Äôt want a subscription.

title: Took my money and closed my account
review:
I am an immigrant with neurological condition. I signed up for a free a subscription using a code from a podcast to help me manage. They asked for my card numbers and I gave them.  I cant access my account . I reached out to their tech support and tell them about me and my problem with the app. They then closed my account. I cant get any answers - refusing to solve my problem. They are fake nice. 

UPDATE: 1 month - my account got charged! I did not allow them. I kept asking Aymane (IT tech) to help with ticket #ticket (2079180). . Did not listen - I kept being charged!! 

Please stop!!
Aymane | Headspace(Headspace)
developerResponse: {'id': 22173750, 'body': "Sorry to hear about the trouble with your account, we'd be happy to follow up. Unfortunately, we are unable to locate your original email. Could you please share your ticket reference number so we can follow up?", 'modified': '2021-04-11T22:07:30Z'}

title: Life Changing
review: I first download headspace about 4-5 years ago because it was recommended to me by a therapist. Its was life changing, helped me tremendously with everyday anxiety. This app taught me to enjoy meditation, and I love the benefit! Every time I meditate I feel more grounded. They teach you how to meditate and have meditation course for just about anything. This app is seriously life changing. if you get anxiety a lot I 100000% recommend it, they have a wonderful course to help you be at peace with those feeling/thoughts.

title: They charged me when I hit ‚ÄúStart free Trial‚Äù
review:
I have tried the free features of this app in the past, I follow the Podcast on Spotify and I have no doubt that headspace is great, but the motivation to leave this poor review -temporarily I hope- comes from a different aspect of my experience.

Today, just about 6 minutes ago, I finished a 3-minute session and after being seduced by the ‚Äústart your free trial button‚Äù I decided to go for it and test the premium features for a while. What I didn‚Äôt know is that It was going to charge me immediately for a ‚Äúfree trial‚Äù?

I love the app, I appreciate Andy‚Äôs vision and the hardworking team behind every aspect of this ecosystem, but I am disappointed that I was charge a whole ‚Äúanual subscription‚Äù and being honest, I am more stressed than before I even started the free 3-minute session.

I see no button to contact support. I find no space where I could solve this situation and It would mean a lot to me If I could be refunded. 

I was planning on writing a different review after trying the premium features and few minutes after, a sudden twist and here we are. How could I enjoy my free trial when I didn‚Äôt get what the ‚ÄúCTA button‚Äù didn‚Äôt delivered what it promised?

I hope somebody can contact me and help me. I would in return update this review to reflect what I originally expected to try after a couple of days.

review: You barely get any options because you have to pay for most of it.But other than that it‚Äôs been very helpful and good.

title: I can sleep!
review: I have great difficulty turning off my mind for sleep. With the sleep cast I barely make it through an episode without drifting into high quality sleep.if I do wake up I turn it on again and drift right off. My favorites are the Cat Marina, The Midnight Launderette, and the Hummingbirds. I also watch wake up and working on meditation. Today I will explore movement.

title: Headspace has blossomed but...
review: I love Headspace, and in the past year they have increased their offerings tenfold: the WakeUp, high quality short videos about people and nature. The offerings on meditation have also increased as well as sounds for sleep that I have used many times. My only beef with Headspace is they had me on auto renew for $99 a month. I did not know that until the charge came through on my Amex. What made it worse is while on YouTube unrelatedly I saw a new customer discount with all the bells and whistles for about half what I paid. I took a picture, contacted them and never got a straight answer. I know it‚Äôs common practice for SaaS products to offer discounts to new customers, but they should honor the price if an existing customer sees it. So I have kept the subscription but I am ripe for new options. Loyalty is a two-way street.

review:
Subscriptions like this can now be shared within a family if the developer switches on the option.

This would enable a family of 2-5 to pay one $69.99 yearly fee instead of each person paying full price (which is ridiculous!)

It‚Äôs simple to do (flick of a switch coding-wise) and better for users, but thus far they are choosing not to enable this feature.

title: Overall, a Great App for Meditation
review:
I started using Headspace in 2014, which was a great entry point into meditation for a total beginner. 

I stopped using it in 2017 for financial reasons but came back to it because I think it beats out the other free meditation apps due to the consistent quality of the meditations and the guided courses (without courses I ended up barely meditating anymore).

My only qualm is the new app interface/experience. I don‚Äôt know when it changed but it‚Äôs a lot more content-heavy and kind of confusing to navigate. I liked the simplicity of the old app (2014-2017 version I suppose). It also just feels like a different vibe a bit with all the social justicia content throughout, not really what I‚Äôd associate a meditation app with.

All in all, still a great app but hope it doesn‚Äôt get too detached from what it started as, a simple meditation app.

title: Bring back the daily check in list please
review: Recently switched to iPhone and this app had this cool feature the android one didn‚Äôt. The daily check list. It was so cool! But then a week later it‚Äôs gone ha. Bring it back please?

title: Mindful
review:

Through meditation and the guidance of Andy ( I feel like we are on a first name basis after all these years) I have learned to be more mindful everyday. This affected my life by being more compassionate, relaxed and living in the moment. My relationship with my family, people who I don‚Äôt know in addition to myself to be significantly improved.
Steven M. Stoller,M.D.,FAAOS

title: Soothing and habit forming
review: I love The Wake Up!  And I‚Äôm enjoying completing courses and watching the BBC videos as well.  Headspace is a real treasure trove of resources to help anyone learn to meditate and maintain the healthy habit.

title: Great for learning, practice and training.
review:
Update 8/23/17 - many hours in and still enjoying the app. New design is much better too. I've been taking a "technique" based approach through the packs and currently find noting to be the most applicable to daily life. 

I've enjoyed all the journeys on the app thus far. The queues and directions are great. The assignments for the day help to take the practice into the rest of the day. Thanks!

title: Relaxing
review: Relaxing

title: Really helped reorganize my thought patterns
review:
I love this app. I‚Äôm a healthcare worker, so 2020 has been an especially stressful year for many reasons. There were days when I would consider it a success if I made it the whole day without crying. I‚Äôve been using this app religiously for minths now and my thought patterns have become much less illogical. I use this app twice a day, for a morning meditation and then got a sleep meditation. This may be a surprise (haha) but I often struggled to turn my brain off enough to go to sleep as well. 

I am in a completely different mindset these days and don‚Äôt dwell on negative thoughts like I used to. These meditations are different than I expected, and honestly I was skeptical. I thought why wouldn‚Äôt I just listen to a free one from YouTube? While they almost seem simpler, my outcomes are better and that‚Äôs what I care about.

I would strongly recommend this app (and have to many of my friends, family, and coworkers). Try use it daily for a few weeks before you make a decision. Changes don‚Äôt happen overnight, especially when you‚Äôve likely been in your current pattern for awhile. Mental health is so vitally important, make sure you take care of your brain along with the rest of your body!

title: They steal your money (update)
review:
Someone finally got back to me. Customer support very slow, said they were backed up. I am back into the app and my subscription was reinstated. Very sad to see all my progress and saved stuff gone. But none-the-less I am happy to be meditating again. They even gave me a voucher to pay for my lost time. Most likely my fault. Don‚Äôt accidentally pay for a subscription under a different email than you set up your app under. 
Updated from 1-5 stars. 

They steal your money. Paid for a year got maybe two weeks  worth of enjoyment. Until my account is locked. Got proof on my bank account that they took my money. Did everything that it says on their Q & A page to resolve. Sent emails, tried customer support chat and even submitted and called from pissedconsumer.com. There has been no reply back from this company with a resolve. I am out of $48.99. So much for help with panic attacks. This all just made mine worse. They are thieves! I‚Äôd give them zero stars if I could!!!

title: I love Headspace - but see the Netflix logo was disturbing
review: As I sat down to start my morning meditation in Headspace I thought I would watch the one minute animation on the homepage about starting the new year right. I‚Äôve always loved the animations and Headspace -I believe it‚Äôs the best and meditation app out there and it has changed my life. I‚Äôve always loved everything about this app.It‚Äôs helped me center myself by getting away from all the commercial crap in the world. And don‚Äôt get me wrong I love Netflix as well. But I really don‚Äôt want to see an advertisement for Netflix in my meditation app. Just seeing the Netflix logo inside Headspace is too much. I think it‚Äôs great that Andy is spreading the word and that there will be what I am guessing is a course in meditation or a documentary on Netflix. But please do not advertise it on this app inside of an animation or a meditation. It goes he gets everything you stand for. Please don‚Äôt pollute this in beautiful environment which you have created with the Netflix logo or anything that is not your core mission.

title: Charged me 69.99 w no consent
review: I am going through a very difficult time and my therapist suggest I tired the app for a the trial time to help me at home. I had canceled the app before the trial was over, I woke up today and it charged me $69.99 for an annual fee after I canceled my subscription. I had to cancel it AGAIN, & file a claim with Apple. I expect a refund because this is not zen or calming at all. It even says that you can try it and cancel it before it ends to not get charged. I don‚Äôt understand why you have to pay to mediate or find a peace of mind. Needless to say it was my last $100, this is very frustrating and literally brought me to tears.

title: Poorly designed
review: I had high hopes for this app because it was a recommendation from a classmate and I‚Äôve had so much trouble sleeping . I started the free trial and I thought the navigation was unnecessarily difficult and the content was underwhelming so I deleted the app and watched YouTube for free. I got an automatic charge for the subscription because I forgot to cancel it so I thought I‚Äôd give it another shot since I paid for it and now I‚Äôm remembering why I deleted it. I spent all night trying to get access and it would not let me in saying they could not restore my purchases when I received a receipt for the purchase from Apple an hour before trying to use it. I did every troubleshooting protocol, chatted with bots, emailed customer service and now I‚Äôm having to wait days for something I already paid for when other apps can get this resolved very quick (or this would not be a problem in the first place) and yes I am logged in with the correct Apple ID. I only have one.

title: Great for Beginner
review:
In the past, I‚Äôve tried to meditate using many apps or Youtube. But this one locked me down! I started using this when my company offered free subscription so I thought to give it a try. Going in with not much expectations because knowing myself, I just cannot control my thoughts when I meditate. But Headspace techniques are great for a monkey mind for people like me and really drill down to the basic. 

Can I also say the British accent and the deep male voice are so soothing and calming?! Fast forward now, I‚Äôve meditate 63 days consistently. Great product and grateful for my company to offer this app.

title: Great! Please Streamline the Sleep Section!
review:
Update: 21-Dec-2020
I‚Äôve been using this a few years now, and the Headspace app is still wonderful!! I love that you can do multiple meditation packs simultaneously, based on what you want to focus on that day. The ever-rotating daily meditations are great too!! Thank you! 

Things I would request/improve upon: 
‚Ä¢ The rotating aspect of the daily meditations are great, but please add a way to listen to them beyond that Day!  Maybe add a ‚ÄúPrevious Daily Meditations‚Äù section? I‚Äôd also love to be able to refer back to previous episodes of ‚ÄúThe Wake Up‚Äù‚Äî though I‚Äôm not sure if that works be an app thing or a YouTube on.  
‚Ä¢ Regarding the sleep section: first off, I love it.  I live in a city, so the cover noise it provides is a game changer for how quickly I can fall asleep.  Moreover, I love the 500 minutes option for the ‚ÄúSleep Radio‚Äù and some of the ‚ÄúSleepcasts‚Äù and ‚ÄúSleep Music‚Äù‚Äî please extend this capability to all of them!  Otherwise, once the Sleepcasts‚Äô timer runs out, silence ensues, and then the outside nose takes over again, waking the sleeper and bringing them back to square one. 
 ‚Ä¢ Also, the ‚ÄúWind downs‚Äù have an option to choose which narrator to use, while the ‚ÄúSleepcasts‚Äù section has separate tab entries for the same male/female or ASMR/[non-ASMR] Sleepcast theme.  
Overall, while having lots options is great, a bit more streamlining of the options in that section would be appreciated.  Without sacrificing the content, it could be made more efficient in terms of presentation and UX.  

‚Ä¢ Lastly, please add a yoga section to your ‚ÄúMove‚Äù tab! While some of the recordings touch on yoga (7-Minute; Gentle Flow), so much more could be incorporated. With all the mindfulness that both Yoga and Meditation provide, this seems a match made in Heaven!  You could even call it a ‚Äúmoving meditation‚Äù!

Of course, these are all just suggestions and I‚Äôm still beyond grateful for the wonderful meditations and how accessible Headspace has made them for me (and thousands of others). Thank you!! Happy Holidays and Happy New Year! 

Update: 2-Oct-2017
Back to awesome!! I love that you can do multiple meditation packs simultaneously, and yay you added the Body Scan in, as requested!! Thank you! 
I took an inadvertent break from Headspace due to phone issues, but now I'm back and can't wait to have this in my everyday routine again!!!

Update: 27-Feb-2017
Well it Was awesome the First 14 days... now I can't get anything to download, it somehow lost my downloads of previous sessions and lost my 11-Day streak as a result! It just says "waiting to download" for all my upcoming sessions in Level 2! 
I'm Very disappointed! Please fix this, and I'll restore the stars docked for this. Still gets an extra star because out of the gate it was still wonderful. 

---
21-Feb-2017
Awesome meditation practice! So many people say they don't have time for this or that, but the 10-minute practice is wonderful because Everyone can find 10 minutes out of their day. I just started Level 2 of the Foundation series and I can't wait to continue my new daily routine! 

One thing I'd request is a guided "Body scan"-- every meditation in the training has had it, but it would be nice to get a clearer idea of what specifically to focus on.  A few friends and I did a yoga teacher training, which heavily included meditations, and we all found it helpful to have a guided body scan, especially when we were first starting out. 
Otherwise this app is amazing and my new favorite morning routine!

title: Change in subscriptions

title: Don't pay. Better free options out there.
review:
I have the premium version. I do not recommend paying for it because:
1 - No background music on the several audios I heard.
2 - Neutral monologue and boring.
3 - Zero motivating audios most of them talk about mental problems, why talk about problems when there are solutions? Talk about solutions.
4 - Can get higher quality material in YouTube for free.
5 - Only two voices? I have no idea how this app made so much money and reviews! Kindergarten drawings and two prerecorded people talking? Not worth it.
6 - Focus music makes me sleep. Maybe a couple could be saved.
7 - The techniques which are less than a minute are great! Sadly only a small part of the app.
8 - Workouts are ok but too guided.

In general, I feel that the app guides too much.

There are much better options for your well-being out there.

Hope the developers say something, at least it means they care about honest criticism so they can be better.

title: So Helpful
review:
As an ‚Äúessential worker‚Äù (I‚Äôm a barista), my job is to care to the needs of a customer and create an experience of normalcy during this time. However, a lot of the times that becomes being an emotional punching bag to those who often don‚Äôt realize they are expressing their personal stress in a way that negatively impacts myself or someone else. This has been very difficult for me, as I was finding it hard to not take their words, tones, and actions personally. Headspace has been an essential tool to help me through guided meditation during stressful and overwhelming moments. It taught me an essential skill, the ability to allow these negative actions to roll off my shoulders instead of sink into my heart. It has also helped tremendously with my insomnia, especially since my main problem when trying to fall asleep is a busy mind. 

The reason I gave this 4/5 stars is due to the fact that I wish I could link my smart devices (like the Google Mini/ Amazon Alexa) to have the Sleepcasts play off the speakers. I find that the ‚Äúsurround sound‚Äù effect they have in a room helps mute out distractions and allows me to focus on the wind down and eventually sleep. I would really appreciate any sort of Bluetooth communication improvement between smart devices.

title: THIS APP IS NOT FREE! DO NOT DOWNLOAD!!ü§¨
review:
I would always use this app to help me fall asleep. My favorite sound being cabin downpour (which I just listened to, to help me fall asleep last night). So I go to try and put it on so I can fall asleep tonight and it‚Äôs locked. Since downloading this app the creators have locked sound by sound slowly to try to force you to pay, soon you‚Äôre not going to be able to use the app without having to pay. It‚Äôs really frustrating because if I calculated correctly, there are only 4/30 sleep casts, 2/9 wind downs, 0/5 nighttime sos, 1/52 sleep music, 0/23 sound scapes, and 0/3 sleep radio made available to listen to for free. That‚Äôs a total of only 7/122 or 5.7% of all available content to listen to for free. Which is ridiculous! In my opinion there should be AT LEAST ONE available piece of content for each category so listeners can have a taste! I just feel very let down and disappointed. I would recommend looking for another app or on YouTube for other free available content if you‚Äôre not willing to pay.

Edit: I just wanted to update and say this app is a SCAM!!!! Many people have had money taken out of their accounts just for signing up for the ‚ÄúFREE‚Äù trial and I was just trying to listen to another sound and even though it doesn‚Äôt say that it is locked when you see the thumbnail of it, when you go to click on it to play the sound it says you have to either try the free trial or upgrade to the premium service!
