The moment you open the app you face a video. That immediately makes me stressed out. I don't go to Headspace because I want YouTube, Instagram or TikTok.

It may be helpful for some people to have videos, especially considering the company's intention to bring meditation to the masses. But if you're someone who already meditates and/or you just want meditation to be meditation, or you want to meditate to get away from social media then don't waste your money.

title: Paid for lifetime, still getting charged
review:
I would like to start by saying the app has been seriously helpful to me in the last two years. I‚Äôve had leaps and bounds with stress management, better sleep and exercise. I will continue to use headspace going forward, as I appreciate it‚Äôs applications and it is now solidified into my routines. However, I will be continuing my use of headspace only through their website, as the app has a few problems that I have noticed as of late that I can no longer ignore. 

Two years ago, I paid roughly $400 for the lifetime subscription, and after emailing the company I have confirmed this. I was unaware that the app itself DOES NOT SUPPORT THE LIFETIME SUBSCRIPTION. I was charged last year for $100 during a very bad time and it set me back that month with expenses. To prevent having to pay that again, I switched to the 12.99 a month subscription plan this last year directly before I would have been charged again for my subscription. As many are aware, COVID has affected nearly everyone‚Äôs hours at work and I am unable to afford this now. Apple has refused a refund to me on the grounds that I paid for a yearly subscription (not true). As such, I will no longer be utilizing the app for my meditations and instead will be using only the web browser. 

The second issue I have been having a problem with is that no matter what I do the meditation or sleep sound will cut out after a few seconds, and refuses to play. This has gotten extremely frustrating. I have installed and uninstalled the app. I have had my phone looked at, I have tried it on my iPad. Nothing. This is more than likely a programming issue, but I won‚Äôt be worrying about this after I delete this app. 

Overall, it‚Äôs a good app. The meditations are helpful and it‚Äôs very easy to use. However, due to the expenses I have had to deal with for something that I paid for two years ago I will be deleting this from my phone. If or when they have the app supporting the subscription that I had paid for I will be more than happy to continue using the app, but at this time I must put it down.

title: Horrible customer ‚Äòservice‚Äô
review:
I would give this app a higher rating if it wasn‚Äôt for its horribly staffed customer service department. I‚Äôve sent 4 requests regarding my subscription; going on 3 years now. I‚Äôm paying the highest annual fee and they haven‚Äôt updated it to reflect the family plan. 

Don‚Äôt get scammed. Google free YouTube videos. Never again, HEADSPACE!
developerResponse: {'id': 15064321, 'body': 'Our apologies with the trouble with your subscription. Do you mind providing your email reference number so we can follow up with you?', 'modified': '2020-05-03T23:41:33Z'}

title: Don‚Äôt listen to one star reviews
review: I‚Äôve used the app for almost 5 months. It‚Äôs amazing. I have never used a meditation app before, (I used to meditate at the temple because I‚Äôm Buddhist) but then my schedule got too busy. So I started using the app in the mornings. To be honest it works amazing even for beginners. I‚Äôve shown it to my girlfriend and she meditates everyday and I can clearly see her being more happy and calm. While reading the reviews people seem to be really mad that is not free? I understand that we would all like free products but I feel like headspace is one of those apps that puts a lot of effort into its craft. They make really good animations to show you so you can visualize what they are talking about. Also at the end of the day you can‚Äôt expect great things to be free. I mean if you wanted a free meditation then there is youtube? But in my opinion head space is there $13 a month or $65 a year. And when you break it down the value for that price is so cheap. I‚Äôm sure half of the people complaining spend more money on their coffee per month. So why not invest more into your mental health? So honestly just give it a shot. Even for a month it‚Äôs just $13 that breaks that too about 50 cents a session.

Im uncofortable with the fact of signing in. I just can't trust companies. Well, Thanks to you i'll be on youtube until 4:00 AM getting ads for this app. By the way, Thanks for lowering my self esteem again!

review:
1. The set of night audios or meditations is very limited for a $70 a year subscription
2. Not all night audios are suitable for three nights sleep. I know all people are different but some sounds are reality hard to imagine to be useful for anyone
3. Navigation through audio should be simpler. You have to click 3 times to start an audio instead of once. It makes it very cumbersome to try out a few sounds to find one you want for a moment: you have to click on the sound, click BEGIN, then click play. Why? All the info about the sound is displayed on the first screen.
4. Audio stops playing as soon as you close that screen. Why? Why not make it like an actual audio player where you have to select a different sound of clock so or pause. It's basic UX !! 

Overall, I think it's not worth the money. I can find pretty much the same or very similar sounds, music and meditations on YouTube for free.

Make the app more user-friendly and widen the selection and rotate it, so maybe people will stay.

title: Get rid of community please.
review:
3/7/20 - 2 Stars. Headspace is certainly under new management. Updates lately are making it worse. Please remove videos of people dancing and stories of other people from my homepage. Maybe somewhere else for community stories I guess but I use this app for my head, not other people‚Äôs.  This app is not supposed to be social media. It is supposed to help you get some space.
3/8/20 - 3 Stars. Ironically the home page has been reorganized so there‚Äôs a headspace animation moving at the top instead of some ad. Progress already! But please stop animating. And then the daily headspace is next. Novel! (That was sarcasm. I expect it to be at the top.) Third is my current plan in progress. Good. Next is a community story. Meh. I still don‚Äôt want to be social. Or ‚Äúinspired.‚Äù Maybe that‚Äôs just me.

title: Life changing but buggy
review: I‚Äôve used the app for 1.5 years now and have become addicted to it in a great way. However, it constantly shuts down in the middle of sessions so I have to set a separate timer. I‚Äôve reinstalled multiple times on multiple latest-edition Apple devices and it still closes randomly. I thought it was only while using audio over Bluetooth, but that wasn‚Äôt it. I downloaded the entire 365 days and that didn‚Äôt fix it. I saw the info about Android so I checked battery settings and haven‚Äôt found the solution yet. It‚Äôs really hard to progress when you have to interrupt your meditation session to check on the app and reset it when you find it has died and then guess at what time point it died.

title: Overpriced
review: The app is simply too overpriced for a basic membership. If you do manage to ignore all the basic popups, you are greeted with only 3 measly 'meditations' to work with. Youtube is free and better than paying $60+ dollars for this. Spotify is also a cheaper option if you are low on funds and have a college email. Very disappointed with headspace.

review:
Wow this is amazing. Every morning I‚Äôve been jumping on YouTube and letting the trending topics be the start of my day. Often times the videos I watch there will make me unhappy or even negative. It‚Äôs always a toss up.

I know I can trust you to help start my mornings in a better place. Better awareness of the things my body is telling me and the opportunity to hear the noise that I‚Äôm generating from the inside

title: REFUND
review: Refund. This is crazy. This App will withdrawal $69.00 from your bank account as soon as the free trial is over. I didn‚Äôt use the free trail, didn‚Äôt even log in. I asked for a refund. The costumer service is awful. They sent me an email saying that due to high volume they could not help me for 2-3 days. Really? High volume. Then another option was to go to the App Store, who I thought they for sure would have my back, they are the ones that have my credit card on file and they hold a very trustworthy position. But, as soon as I sent a request for a refund from the headspace app, they denied the refund within seconds . Appalling customer service. Online purchasing, especially with the App Store, nobody is there to help the customer. Bad experience, think twice before accepting a free trial!!!!!!

title: I had cancelled a long time ago but still got charged
review: I cancelled my subscription a long time ago thru Apple since I was not using the app. Not that I did not enjoy it, I was just was not using it and considered it a waist of $. Somehow I get charged a renewal thru PayPal when I had NOT signed up for automatic renewal, since I canceled my subscription thru Apple... why would I need an extra step to cancel thru PayPal as well??!!  Plus I get charged not only another year but at their highest price at $95.88!!! I read on their website says the automatic renewals (which I believed to be cancelled) would be at half that amount. I lost my job, I cannot afford a charge like this on my account. And after 4 emails I just get automatic replies saying they‚Äôll get back to me.

title: Life Changing
review:
I started my headspace journey seven years ago (wow!), and I could not imagine my life without it. My therapist recommended headspace to me when she presented two options to manage my anxiety; 1. Meditate or 2. Medication. Given that I was 21 years old,  I decided to try meditation because i wasn‚Äôt ready to be on anti anxiety medication for (what may be) the rest of life. At first headspace was hard, I felt mentally tired ALL.THE.TIME! It‚Äôs like exercising a muscle. If you feel this way don‚Äôt give up, make time for yourself because once you exercise that muscle more the tiredness goes away. Throughout the seven years, some months I would ‚Äúfall off the headspace wagon‚Äù but I eventually would get back on. Having headspace these past seven years, has eliminated my need for anti anxiety medication. 

No matter where you are in your headspace journey, I recommend making time for a little headspace everyday. It‚Äôs worth it, and you deserve it!

title: Great Meditation Program - We LOVE It
review:
My husband and I have been using Headspace everyday for the last couple weeks, so far, we LOVE the program!!!  Before settling down for the night, we share meditation time together enjoying a session.  The Sessions are so relaxing, my husband usually dozes off to sleep before the session ends.  What a great way to relax and experience inner quiet and peace....  This is a wonderful way for us to spend time together - after prayers and just before going to bed.ü§óüíú  

I discovered that the cost of Headspace can be bundled with a Spotify subscription.  Unfortunately, we have the Spotify family plan, which does not include or support the Spotify/Headspace bundle option. üò© Please Spotify and Headspace, offer a plan that includes a bundle option for the family plan!   When you do, our family will be the first to sign up.

In the meantime, thanks Headspace - for developing this fantastic program and kudos to Spotify for teaming up with you, it‚Äôs a great experience!
